loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa is part of the Banco Comunal Flor del café. She sells chicken meat at a stand at the local market in the district of Soritor, Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martin. She decided to start her business in order to continually support her family and to generate her own income in order to grow personally.

With the recent loan given to her by Manuela Ramos of $233 that will be repaid in four installments, she will buy 30 to 40 chickens, special pepper, and garlic in kilos to sell her farm chickens. This way she is able to meet the needs of her clients and the local market.

She is 54 years old and has five children. She is content with what she does and she is satisfied with the results she has obtained ever since her group of clients has increase. Her goal is have her own shed to raise the chicken. She wants to sell large and small quantities and to supply the region with this essential food to many families.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal Flor del café, se dedica la venta de pollos viscerados, tiene un puesto en el mercado de su localidad, en el distrito de Soritor, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martin. Decidió iniciar su negocio por que tenía que sacar adelante a su familia y de esa manera generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona. Con el reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 700.00 soles ($ 233.00), el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 30 a 40 gallinas de las chacras, especies como culantro, ají especial, ajos en kilos para licuarlos y surtir su puesto de venta de pollos de granja y criollos, y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y del mercado local. Tiene 54 años y 5 hijos, esta contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha su clientela aumentó, su meta es tener su propio galpón para criar y tener su centro de acopio, vender al por mayor y menor y abastecer a la zona con este alimento primordial en la cocina de muchas familias.

loans.use: Purchase chicken and garlic.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
I am Khursheed B.. I am married and a mother of seven, four boys and three girls. I live with my family in a big city, Lahore, Pakistan. I stay at home and do my household chores; I do not go out and work because I have grown old and my sons have started earning income. My husband owns a vegetable business in a nearby market.

One of my sons paints and polishes furniture on order. My son is in the process of expanding his business so that he can take on bigger orders and thus increase his income. He wants to give to us so that we can be comfortable and worry free in our old age. For this purpose he requires a loan for his business.

loans.use: Expand furniture business

loans.name: María De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria De La Luz is a single mother of two children. She is putting them through school so that they would have a better future. She can do this thanks to the fact that she has started a small business selling natural consumer products. At first she tried these products herself and noted that they worked, this made her realize that these products could sell and with the help of her family, little by little attracted customers that currently seek her out, to sell them these dietary supplements.

In December, however, her sales decreased and she currently does not have enough money to replenish her inventory. This is the reason for Maria to be requesting a USD $525 loan that she is going to repay in 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy merchandise to offer to her customers. With your help Maria will be able to improve the future of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

María de la Luz es madre soltera de dos hijos. A quienes tiene estudiando para que sean personas de bien, los mantiene estudiando gracias a que María decidió comenzar su propia microempresa de venta de productos naturales para consumo personal. Primero María utilizó estos productos y se dio cuenta que servían, fue así como se convenció de que estos productos los podía vender y asó poco a poco empezando con su familia comenzó a hacerse de clientes que actualmente la buscan para poder venderles estos complementos a sus dietas.

Sin embargo en Diciembre las ventas para María disminuyeron, y es por eso que maría actualmente no cuenta con dinero suficiente como para resurtir su negocio. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $525 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Zarnigar

texts.en: Zarnigar (her brother is pictured) is a  53 year old widow with 3 children. She and her family live in Khachmaz region.  Zarnigar and her brother have been in clothing sales for 5 years, and now they need a loan of $850 in order to buy clothes to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Mwajua's Molemo Group

texts.en:
Mwajua is 35 years old and is married woman with1 child, aged 4 years old. Mwajua owns a small saloon, which she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

In the past, Mwajua has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who have business dealings in timber sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Joha

texts.en:
Joha is 33 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 12. Joha is a charcoal seller who started up her little business in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $275 from her sales.

In the past, Joha has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a second loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel started her business because her husband´s income was insufficient to meet the family´s expenses. She´s allways had a knack for business and saw the opportunity to increase their earnings with her family´s help. Six years ago she began selling refreshments, fritters, and sweets amongst her neighbors. Eventually she began to sell meat next to her brother´s store on saturdays and sundays.

She is requesting a $500 credit to purchase foodstuffs to be paid back in six months. With your support, Isabel will make it.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase food to prepare

loans.name: Yaye Diabou

texts.fr:
Yaye Diabou Cissé is 39 years old, unmarried with 3 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Manguiline Santhiaba in Bignona in the Ziguinchor area for 7 years. She runs a business selling thioub (a type of dyed cloth). She buys her goods in Tambacounda and sells them in Bignona. With her income, she looks after her family and supports the education of her children. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Yaye Diabou Cissé ,39 ans, célibataire, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona dans la région de Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans. Elle mène une activité de vente de thioub (tissus teintés) .Elle va acheter à Tambacounda pour vendre à Bignona. Avec ses revenus elle entretien sa famille et assure la scolarité des enfants. Yaye est très dynamique. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell thioub (a type of dyed cloth)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase jewelry and clothing for her business.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to invest the money in the construction of a new room for her house. She has worked as a teacher in the school Rubén Darío for the past 8 years, and she performs her job with great love and care. She lives in the city of Nueva Guinea (New Guinea), Nicaragua. She has two daughters, the oldest of whom is 8 and studies in the second grade, and the youngest still a baby of one year. Sandra’s husband works as a police officer. Both share the responsibility of sustaining the family and providing their daughters with an education. Sandra’s dream is to continue studying, to be healthy and have stable work, and to improve the conditions of her home so that her daughters will not lack anything.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra está solicitando el préstamo a nuestra Institución para invertirlo en construcción de una habitación en su vivienda. Labora como docente de la Escuela Rubén Darío desde hace 8 años, en la cual se desempeña con mucha responsabilidad y amor a su trabajo. Habita en el municipio de Nueva Guinea. Tiene 2 hijas , la hija mayor de 8 años estudia su 2do grado de educación primaria y una bebita de un añito, su esposo trabaja como Policía. Ambos la responsabilidad de llevar el sutento a su familia, y proveerles de educación a sus hijas. Su sueño es seguir estudiando, tener salud y estabalididad laboral, tener mejores condiciones en su hogar para que a sus hijas no les falte nada.

loans.use: To build an additional room

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda, 31 years old, has 3 children. Two of them are students and the youngest is a baby. She lives with her husband who sells groceries wholesale and who helps her out whenever possible.

She is a determined and visionary woman. She sells beer wholesale (50 cases daily), a business which she runs from her home, working 24 hours a day. She has a select clientele (warehouses and bars) and she sells the product for cash or credit. What she likes about her work is selling and meeting many people. What is difficult for Esmeralda is that she does not have a secure area for storing her products.

She works to take care of daily expenses and for her children´s education.

She would like to build an adequate space in her home where she can store the beer. Later on she would like to have a distributorship, not only for beer but also for soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Esmeralda, de 31 años, tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudiantes y el último un bebe, ella vive junto a su esposo, quien es comerciante (vende abarrotes al por mayor) y la apoya en lo posible.

Ella es una mujer decidida y visionaria, se dedica a la venta de cerveza al por mayor (50 cajas diarias), negocio que instaló dentro de su vivienda, trabaja las 24 horas del día. Su clientela es selecta (bodegas y bares) y les deja su producto al crédito o al contado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender y socializa con mucha gente. Lo difícil para Esmeralda es no contar con un local seguro para almacenar sus productos.

Esta madre trabaja para solventar los gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos.

Quiere mandar a construir un local adecuado en el interior de su vivienda, donde almacenará sus cervezas. Posteriormente quiere llegar a tener una distribuidora, no solo de cerveza, sino también de bebidas gasificadas.

loans.use: Build a space to store cases of beer, which she sells wholesale.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Né le 07 avril 1969 à Tchékpo dans la préfecture de Yoto, monsieur T. Kodjo est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Depuis 2004, il a crée un établissement de vente des matériaux de construction surtout du ciment dans le quartier d’Agoè.  
Il n’a jamais sollicité du crédit mais sollicite ce premier compte tenu de la demande important de ses clients. Ainsi avec ce crédit il achètera 6 tonnes de ciment de type fortia qui est apprécié par les clients compte tenu de sa qualité. Ce nouveau stock de ciment lui permettra de bien vendre afin de pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Born on April 7, 1969 in Tchékpo in the Yoto prefecture, Mr. Kodjo T. is married and the father of two children. In 2004, he opened a business selling construction materials, especially cement, in the Agoè district.

He had never asked for a loan but now is requesting his first due to large orders he has received from his customers. With this loan, he will be able to buy 6 tons of Fortia cement which is most sought after by his customers due to its quality. This new stock of cement will allow him to increase his sales so as to better cater for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 6 tons of cement

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad Baji, married to J. F., lives in a small town called Kot Radha Kishan, located near Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in the town for the last 8 years. Irshad Baji has two daughters, the eldest of whom is 7 years old, while the youngest is 1 year old. For the past five years, Irshad Baji’s husband has been working as a tractor driver, while Irshad Baji has been earning income running a milk sales business. She owns two buffalos that produce up to 24 liters of milk per day. On average, Irshad Baji earns US$5-6 per day from the milk sales. Currently, she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk business.

loans.use: Purchase of another buffalo for a milk business

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
One of the coastal barrios in the town of Plaridel is the barangay Usocan, where a certain woman named Meriam A. lives. She is 46 years old and married to Juanito, a devoted and brave fisherman. The couple was blessed with two children and both of them have settled down.

Mr. Juanito once worked with their neighbor who had a fishing boat. He had a small share of the fishing income, but it was not enough for the whole family. Meriam happened to become a Paglaum Co-op member when one of their neighbors (a co-op member too) sold the couple Paglaum’s programs and services five years ago. The couple was so thankful for Paglaum because they were granted enough money to purchase machinery for their own fishing boat. From then on, Meriam's husband no longer worked with their neighbor, but focused on his own fishing boat and has reaped their income from it. While her husband is focusing on fishing, Mrs. A. is also vending snacks, ice candy, ice, and bar-b-que in their neighborhood to provide additional income for the family. Bar- b-que is a kind of thinly sliced pork or any meat attached to a bamboo stick and grilled. It has a minimal selling price of only two to five pesos and is very affordable to the market.  

Currently, the couple has acquired three unit motorized pump boats and is applying for a loan worth fifteen thousand pesos (P15,000.00) for the acquisition of another fishing boat which is bigger and better than what they have now.  According to them, the bigger the boat is, the more it can fight big waves, can run through even during stormy season, and can transport and hold a number of huge fish caught at sea. An average of fifty kilos per day is their daily sales from one unit motorized pump boat, with an average of forty pesos (P40) selling price per kilo, depending on the type and variety of fish. 

The couple was so grateful for Paglaum MPC because through the co-op they were able to build a partially concrete house. The couple hopes for more blessings to come as they faithfully maintain their Member In Good Standing status with the co-op and pay their loans on time with no trace of default. The family is dreaming of having a “lantsa”, a much bigger fishing boat with at least 20 workers so that they can fish from coast to coast in the future.

loans.use: Purchase motorboat for fishing

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena R. se dedica a la venta de productos personales como lo son colas, chapas, pulseras, peluches y cosméticos en el mercado La Terminal de León donde ofrece sus productos a los clientes que a diario le visitan

Hoy en día ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de estos productos debido a que las ventas han estado muy buenas y al habérsele agotado la mercadería le urge comprar nuevamente los productos y es por este motivo que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Maria Elena R. sells personal products like pogs, bracelets, plushy toys, and cosmetics in the market La Terminal de León where she offers her products to her clients that visit her daily. Today she is asking for a loan through Ceprodel to buy these products given that sales have been very good and after having sold out the market she urgently needs to buy new products. It is for this reason that she that her loan will be granted and through this she will be able to continue business that needs your support very much.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Joyce D.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Joyce S. from Tukuyu. She is a widow with four children, between the ages of 5 and 16. Joyce has been running a rice business since 2007. She purchases rice on a wholesale basis and sells it retail.

She works at the business for 1-4 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her brother. Joyce currently earns about 380 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Joyce thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice in bulk

loans.name: Rosario Ventura

texts.es: La Señora Rosario Vásquez de 35 años de edad,  Casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un pequeño Taller,  habita conjuntamente con su esposo y sus hijos, desde su niñez se dedicaba a la artesanía, gracias a ello a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Caserío Palemop I de la Aldea Vásquez del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, ella ha llegado a solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un préstamo para la Artesanía con el fin de comprar materia prima para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda de su clientela aprovechando las ganancias y así poder darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario Vásquez is 35 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in Caserío Palemop I, Vásquez, located in the Totonicapán district of Guatemala. Rosario is a seamstress and makes traditional women's garments with the help of a small loom. Since childhood, she has been working in her craft. Thanks to her business, she has been able to help her family succeed and is well-known in her town. Rosario is requesting a loan from Asociación Asdir to purchase raw materials to meet customer demand, increase her profits and provide a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (Creation of traditional garments)

loans.name: Akanji

texts.en: Akanji O. is single and he is 27 years old. He sells and repairs rechargeable phones. He hopes to expand this business. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phones. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phones to sell

loans.name: Mouniratou

texts.fr:
C. Mouniratou est née le 05/12/1984 à Cotonou. Mouniratou est célibataire sans enfant.
Mouniratou vend les pâtes dentifrices et brosses à dents, coton et papiers-mouchoirs. Mouniratou a déjà deux crédit avec ALIDé. Depuis que Mouniratou a commencé par avoir de prêt à ALIDé, elle a augmenté son niveau d'activité et espère parvenir d'ici la fin de l'année à ouvrir une une petite boutique pour la vente de produits cosmétiques. Aujourd'hui Mouniratou demande un troisième crédit pour diversifier son activité.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Mouniratou C. was born on December 12th, 1984 in Cotonou. Mouniratou is single without children. She sells toothpaste and toothbrushes, cotton and tissues. She has already received two credits with ALIDé. Since she has been receiving credits from ALIDé, she has increased her activity level and she hopes to open by th end of the year a small shop to sell cosmetics. Today, Mouniratou requires a third credit to diversify her business. The meaning of ALIDé in Benin local language - Fon - is "a path always exists for the poorest". Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria, with a GDP per capita of $1,500. ALIDé offers special credits at 0% interest rate for very vulnerable people, and is part of a group that soon will launch a program of heath micro-insurance for the beneficiaries of a micro-credit.

Translated from French by anne-laure behaghel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of pencils and chalk, 3 boxes of cream and lotion, 12 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Osana

texts.en: Osana T., 38, is married with five children. She has one year of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the public six days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Osana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase plastic papers, sacks of sugar and other items for her business.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 42-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Mahdi has owned a butcher shop for fifteen years. He requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase goats for his shop. This is the first time that Mahdi has requested a loan. 
Mahdi is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. Mahdi decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for his shop.

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr:
N. V. Lucienne est née à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Lucienne est mariée à DAGA Richard. Lucienne est mère de trois (3) enfants. Lucienne n'a jamais été à l'école, ni appris un métier. Lucienne a été élevée par ses parents et aidait sa mère dans la vente de maïs et de l'huile végétale. Après son mariage, Lucienne s'était lancée dans la vente de bouillie de maïs. Actuellement, Lucienne vend la même chose que sa mère, mais pour son propre compte. Lucienne a déjà eu deux prêts de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Lucienne sollicite un troisième crédit présentement pour s'approvisionner en une importante quantité de maïs et d'huile de noix de palme afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.  

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Lucienne N. V. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Lucienne is married to Richard Daga. Lucienne is the mother of three children. Lucienne never went to school, nor did she learn a professional trade. Lucienne was raised by her parents and helped her mother sell maize and vegetable oil. After getting married, Lucienne began selling maize bouillie (a thick cornmeal porridge). Currently, Lucienne sells the same things as her mother, but for herself. Lucienne has already obtained two loans through Alidé to develop her business. Lucienne is currently seeking a third loan to supply herself with a sizable quantity of corn and oil from palm nuts in order to better respond to the needs of her clientele. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and its per capita income is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 sacks of maize and 2 50-litre cans of palm nut oil

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en: Mrs Florinda is married to an exemplary husband, Reinaldo, and they have two children. They both work to support the family. They have their own house and a small business – a laundrymat. Mrs Florinda's husband has always supported her business. Mrs Florinda is applying for credit so that her business is able to meet the demand of customers and neighbors who want their clothes cleaned. She has the only laundrymat in the neighborhood and she needs a new machine in order to keep up with demand. If she receives this credit Mrs Florinda will be able to renovate her machinery, allowing her to provide her services faster and earn a higher income. She is a very friendly, enterprising person who wants to progress, all of which are very important qualities for furthering her business.

loans.use: To buy an automatic washer

loans.name: Santa Teresa Group

texts.en:
The committee “Santa Teresa” was formed by neighbors from the city of Villa Elisa.  All the participants in the group have developed their own independent activities, many in sales.  The members have created a very united and capable group that participates in many activities that strengthen their camaraderie. 
All of the participants in the committee are mothers and work in their respective fields in order to strengthen their household economies and to develop their businesses in a sustainable way.  

1	Elida R.-	   Food sales 
2	Graciela S.-	   Dressmaker 
3	Juana Elena M.-   Charcoal sales 
4	Petrona M.-	   Manicurist 
5	Maria Elena V.-	   Dressmaker 
6	Guillermina Z.-	   Convenience store 
7	Norma E. A.-	   Hair salon 
8	Aida Karina M.-	   Cosmetics sales 
9	Norma Teresa M.-     Fruit sales 
10	Juana Maria A.-     Charcoal sales 
11	Zulma A.-   	   Beverage sales 
12	Margarita A.-  Event planner 
13	Ruth Noemi R.-    Food sales 
14	Isolina F.-	   Cosmetics sales 
15	Carmen Lorena R.-  Clothing sales 
16	Claudia B. R.-	   Hair salon

loans.use: The funds obtained by the committee are invested in their respective small businesses.  All of the participants invest their loan according to the needs of their business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora F. is from the village of Malibangcao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Flora is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Flora grows crops, especially coconuts and bananas, to sale. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Flora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that she will use to expand her business. This is Flora's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is twenty-five years old and married. She is the mother of one child, a daughter, who is currently in pre-school. She lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in their community.

Eunice sells assorted biscuits (cookies). She sells her biscuits on a table at the community's public school and in the market square. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy more biscuits. She desires to expand her business and add the sales of other groceries. This, she believes, will help her save more and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits to sell

loans.name: Idrissou

texts.fr: Cet homme s’est spécialisé dans la réparation des appareils électroniques dans son atelier situé à Agoè-Klinvé, qui est l’un des quartiers périphériques de Lomé. En plus de cette profession de réparateur, il vend aussi des matériels électroniques de toute catégorie. Pour maintenir son stock à jour, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter un régulateur, un testeur, un étain et des fils électroniques de réparation. Il est célibataire sans enfants.
texts.en:
This is a man who became specialized in repairing electronics in his workshop located in Agoè-Klinvé, which is one of the outlying districts of Lomé.  In addition to this repair profession, he also sells electronics of all kinds.  To keep his inventory up-to-date, he is requesting a WAGES loan to buy a regulator, a tester, some tin, and some electronic wire for repairs.  He is unmarried and has no children. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a regulator, a tester, some tin, and some electronic wire

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: Maria Ofelia M. Q. tiene 53 años de edad. Maria tiene la actividad económica de venta de nacatamales y de cerdos. Tiene 2 hijos que asisten a una escuela pública ya que los ingresos de Maria son muy pocos. Ella dio inicio por su Mama quien le enseño este negocio y al fallecer decidió que Maria se hiciera cargo del negocio para pudiera salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, ingredientes, masa entre otras cosas. El sueño de Maria es seguir adelante con su negocio y que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells loaves of bread retail to her customers in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 42 years old and married with 7 children. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a vegetable vendor in their village. She plants vegetables in their backyard for their family's consumption and she also sell some of her produce. She purchases most of her merchandise in Cauayan City. With the help of her previous loan, she was able to venture into another business, fish selling. Joan would like to further grow her businesses. She is again requesting additional capital from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 6,000. She hopes that lenders will continue to support her in her small businesses to keep them growing. She is also hoping that someday she can have a more stable business.

Joan is 33 years old and she is residing in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Robert, a furniture laborer in their village. They have four children and she prays that they may able to send them to school and provide them with a good education.

loans.use: Additional capital to further grow her business

loans.name: Claudia Guadalupe

texts.es: Claudia Guadalupe G. A., reside en el departamento de Sonsonate junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad y estudiantes. Claudia tiene tan solo 27 años de edad y tuvo que pasar por la pérdida de su ser amado, ella es una mujer viuda quien no tiene apoyo económico ni respaldo de nadie, solo cuida de sus hijos quienes son la inspiración y deseo de superación para Claudia, quien se ha dedicado de lleno a su negocio la venta de verduras y ropa que sale a vender de manera ambulante, ella solicita de este crédito para invertir en sus negocio, así poder brindarle una mayor estabilidad económica a sus hijos a través de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Claudia Guadalupe G. A. lives in the department of Sonsonate with her two school-aged children. She is 27 years old and has already experienced the loss of her husband. Being a widow, Claudia does not receive financial support from anyone else. She is the only one taking care of her children, who provide her inspiration and motivation to succeed.

Claudia sells vegetables and clothing as a street vendor. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her business, increase her sales, and provide greater financial stability for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo (José), de 37 años, y con sus 2 hijos: Luisa de 7 y Diego de 4 años.

Ella es una mujer muy alegre y emprendedora, es así que hace un mes incursionó en la venta de productos de belleza, teniendo anteriormente otros negocios, los cuales dejó porque necesitaba  de una labor que no le demandara mucho tiempo en la calle, ya que tiene hijos pequeños los cuales necesitan mucho de su ayuda en el colegio y en su hogar.
Es por ello que Nancy decidió dedicarse a esta actividad, pues puede libremente trabajar en los momentos en la que dispone de tiempo, ya que ofrece su mercadería a sus vecinas, amigas y familiares de la zona en la que vive.
Para el futuro quisiera tener un puesto en un mercado, donde implemente un bazar, ya que le daría la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más cosméticos, y también ropa para cubrir algunos pedidos que le hicieron sus clientes, incursionando también en este negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy, 24, lives with her husband (José, 37) and their two children: Luisa, 7 and Diego, 4. She is a cheerful and enterprising woman. A month ago she began to sell beauty supplies, having had other business ventures in the past, which she left because she needed to do something that did not require her being out on the streets for long because she has small children that need her help at home and with school work. She decided to start this new venture which allows her to go out on sales visits when she has free time since she offers her wares to her neighbors, friends and family in the neighborhood where she lives. For the future, she would like to have a stand in a market where she can set up a bazaar since that would allow her to increase her income. This is her first loan with MFP and she commits to be very punctual with repayments. The funds will be used to buy cosmetics and clothing to fill some orders placed by her customers therby beginning to make inroads into this type of business too.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca tiene 35 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad de 14 y 8 años en edad ambos en edad  escolar. Ella es conviviente, su conyuge trabaja como chofer de transporte urbano. Cuenta con casa propia de material rustico la cual está en reconstruccion despues del terremoto quedó  destruido. Actualmente tiene la parte adelante de cercados de estera y tiene sus habitaciones de adobe. Su casa está ubicado en el Distrito de la Tinguiña. Blanca se dedica como ayudante de una peluqueria. Ella se dedica a esto hace 6 años. Blanca tiene muchos objetivos y metas uno de ellos es poder reconstruir su vivienda.  Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Blanca is 35 years old and has two children, 14 and 8 years old, both in school. She lives with her partner who works as a public transport driver. She owns her own rustic home which is being rebuilt after being destroyed by the earthquake. Currently the front part of the house is closed in by mats, while the rooms are made of adobe. Her home is located in the Tinguiña district. For the past six years, Blanca has worked as a hair salon assistant. She has many objectives and goals, and one of them is to rebuild her home. The money she is asking for will be invested in improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement of her home that was destroyed in an earthquake

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita L. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old. Conchita is married. To make a living, Conchita owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Conchita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en:
Ronke is 38 years old and is married with two children. Her husband sells engine oil to make a living.

Ronke sells nuts and bolts at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more nuts and bolts to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Ronke is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more nuts and bolts to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo Teofilo, de 33 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos: Morelia de 14, Aymar de 8 y Cristian de 4 años. Ellos viven en una pequeña casa (propia) ubicada en la sierra peruana.

Desde hace 13 años, con la ayuda de su esposo, se dedica a la siembra de papa, flores, arveja y zanahoria, en los terrenos heredados por sus suegros. De su trabajo, lo que más le llama la atención es sembrar, porque según refiere cada producto sembrado es una esperanza de progreso, sin embargo no le gusta cuando la mala hierba invade sus terrenos. Pese a que sus labores son muy sacrificadas, asegura que gracias a la agricultura puede solventar los gastos de su vivienda, así como amoblarla en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, y lo más importante, puede costear la educación de sus hijos. Por tal motivo, para más adelante ha pensado en sembrar en mayor cantidad, comprar dos cabezas de ganado e implementar una tienda de comestibles en un espacio disponible de su vivienda, la cual está localizada en una zona céntrica en su pueblo.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y le agrada mucho trabajar en su banco comunal porque encontró a personas responsables, honestas y trabajadoras como ella. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en comprar 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, 2 sacos de abono orgánico, además de fertilizantes e insecticidas para mejorar la producción de papa.
texts.en:
Nancy is 30 years old, and she lives with her husband Teofilo, 33 years old, with whom she has 3 children: Morelia, 14; Ayma, 8; and Cristian, 4. They live in their own small house located in the Peruvian mountains. For 13 years, with her husband's help, she has grown potatoes, flowers, peas and carrots on land inherited from her in-laws. In her work, what most interests her is planting, because she says that each seed sown is a hope for progress. However, she does not like it when weeds invade her land. Despite the fact that her work is full of sacrifice, she assures us that thanks to agriculture she can cover expenses for her home, such as furnishing it, to have a better quality of life for her family. Most importantly, she can pay for her childrens' education. For this reason, in the future she hopes to grow larger quantities of crops, buy two head of cattle and start a grocery store in a room in her house, which is located in the center of town. This is the third loan she has with MFP, and she is very pleased to work in her communal bank because she has met people who, like her, are responsible, honest and hard-working. The money she requests will be used to buy 2 bags of pea seeds and 2 sacks of organic fertilizer, as well as fertilizer and insecticides to improve her potato production.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Jose Miguel vive en anticrético con su mama en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como locutor en una radio de mucha audiencia.

El crédito que solicita es para el pago del costo de matricula y pensiones  para continuar sus estudios en la carrera de comunicación y poder acceder a un mejor trabajo.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Jose Miguel lives in “anticrédito” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia) with his mother in the Miraflores area of the city of La Paz. He works as a radio announcer for a radio station with a big audience. The loan he is requesting is to pay the registration fee and boarding house fees to continue his communication career studies. That way he will be able to access a better job. He is a client of Impro, and he pays very well. Therefore, he can have access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay registration fee and boarding house fees to continue studies at the university

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang P., age 35, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has five children. She is engaged in the business of selling various kinds of groceries, earning approximately US $2 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially those for the children’s education. She has been doing this business since 2000. Her husband is a local doctor for a public health care center, earning an income of US $4 per day. Their standard of living has improved since P. started this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. P. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase more groceries for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora es una mujer trabajadora de 41 años, está casada con Víctor de 48 años, ellos viven junto a sus 4 hijos (mayores de edad) en su casa propia.

Desde hace 25 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz, arveja y diferentes variedades de verduras. Asimismo, para tener otros ingresos económicos cría toros y vacas que también le ayudan a trabajar en la chacra y le proveen de leche para elaborar ricos quesos. Gracias a su trabajo y al apoyo de sus hijos, ya que suelen distribuirse las tareas agrícolas, a Nora le gusta más alimentar al ganado. Desde muy pequeña, al igual que a su pareja, le agradó vivir en el campo, alrededor de los pastos verdes, pero sus hijos decidieron arrendar la gran mayoría de sus terrenos para que no se sacrifiquen mucho, por lo que para más adelante piensa vender quesos y choclos en un mercado de la capital.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que por su trabajo puede acceder a futuros créditos; a su vez, viene motivando a los integrantes de su banco comunal para que desarrollen actividades mutuas en fin del progreso de todos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará 10 sacos de semilla de papa y 3 botellas de insecticida.
texts.en:
Nora is a hardworking woman of 41 years of age. She is married to Victor, 48, and they live with their four children (all grown) in their own house. For 25 years, together with her husband, Nora has worked growing potatoes, corn, peas, and a variety of vegetables. Also, for additional income, they raise bulls and cows, which help them in fields and also provide milk to make delicious cheeses. Nora counts on the help of her children, who usually sell her agricultural products while she prefers to take care of the animals. From an early age, both she and her husband have enjoyed living in the country next to green fields. Their children, on the other hand, have decided to rent out most of their land as they plan to spend most of their time selling cheeses and corn in a market in the capital. This is Nora’s third loan with MFP. She knows that by working hard she can obtain future loans. She encourages the members of her communal bank to develop projects that will benefit them all. With this loan, Nora will buy ten bags of seed potatoes and three bottles of insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seed and insecticide

loans.name: Maryol Marcelina

texts.es: La señora Maryol Marcelina, ella tiene 28 años, tiene 1 hijos de 4 años que está a su cargo. La señora se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada en esto incluye venta de ropa de cama, camisas, pantalones, los cuales distribuye generalmente de forma ambulante, también en su casa realiza ventas, las cuales en su mayoría son a crédito. Ella dio inicio a este negocio porque no tena un medio de supervivencia y al mismo tiempo no encontraba trabajo. Este negocio le ha servido como fuente de ingresos para ella y para la manutención de su familia. Esta solicitando un financiamiento que será invertido en la compra de mercaderías principalmente ropa usada ya que debido a la crisis es la que más se vende. Ella posee el sueño de hacer que el negocio crezca lo suficiente para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maryol Marcelina is 28 years old and takes care of her 4-year-old child. She sells new and used clothes, which include bedclothes, shirts, and pants, which she generally distributes by foot. She also makes sales from her home, which are mostly done on credit. She began this business because she didn't have a way to support herself, nor could she find work. This business has served her well as a source of income and a way to provide for her family. She is requesting a loan, which will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, particularly used clothing since this is what sells the most due to the crisis. She dreams of growing her business enough so that in the not so distant future, she can make improvements on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Sal

texts.en: Mrs. Sal P., 39, and her husband, Mr. Vai Long, 43, live in a small village off of National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1988 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. The eldest daughter is married and lives outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, and the other three are in school. Sal has been a farmer for fifteen years, while her husband has been a construction contractor for twenty years. Because her children commute to school far away, they often have to take a motor remoque or taxi. (A remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer attached.) Since taking a remoque to school is expensive, Sal is asking for her first loan of $300 to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To add to her own savings to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Nayra Sarantañani Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento NAYRA SARANTAÑANI cuyo significado es (Iremos hacia delante)  fundado en la zona de chasquipampa, en la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta compuesto por 9 socios que se dedican a distintas actividades como ser venta de café, venta de comida, albañil etc. muchos de los integrantes usan los prestamos para el incremento de su capital de negocio y en algunos casos el inicio de uno nuevo.

El Sr. Francisco es el representante del Banco,  el tiene tres hijos y no convive con la esposa por algunos problemas que tuvieron, el es quien se hace cargo de los niños que se encuentran en etapa escolar, el sr Francisco es Padre y Madre para sus hijos, se dedica al trabajo como albañil contructor en distintos puntos de la ciudad, y los fines de semana el se dedica al trabajo como arbitro de los distintos campeonatos desarrollados en la zona. el sueño y la meta que se puso es el de ver terminar el colegio a sus hijos y a la fecha su hijo mayor esta a punto de terminar su etapa escolar, por lo cual el esta muy orgulloso. Con el dinero del credito comprara material de construccion para poder realizar su trabajo. Al igual que el sr francisco los demas integrantes son personas con distintas historias pero con la misma meta " la de salir adelante".

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadora que sacan a su familia adelante en muchos casos solas que desean mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Nayra Sarantanani Entrepreneurial Village Bank (which means "We will go forward") was founded in the Chasquipampa area to the south of the city of La Paz. It is made up of 9 members who work in various businesses like the sale of coffee or food, construction, etc. Many of the members use the loans as their working capital and a few have used it to start a new business. Francisco is the representative of the group. He has 3 children and does not live with his wife due to some problems they had. He has taken care of the children who are all in school. He acts as both father and mother for his children and works in construction in various parts of the city. On the weekends, he works as a referee for football tournaments in the area. His dream and goal is to see his children graduate from school and currently, his oldest child is about to graduate from high school; this makes him very proud. He will use the loan to buy construction materials for his work. Like Francisco, the other members of the group have distinct stories but all have the same goal: Moving forward. All the members are very responsible and hard-working and move their families forward, in many cases on their own. They hope to improve the standard of living of their families and are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the support they are receiving through these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 40 years old and married with three children, ages 9, 13, and 20. All of her children are attending school. She's a farmer in Litein in the South Rift Valley of Kenya. She's been farming for ten years and employs two people from the community. She has a mixed farm and sells maize, beans, vegetables, and tea produced on the farm. She also earns income from the hair salon and boutique she runs in town. (She is pictured above in her boutique.) She says that the main challenges to her business are an insufficient market for milk and hail storms, which have reduced her tea production.

She successfully completed a previous loan for Kshs. 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo and requested this loan for Kshs. 60,000 to purchase a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her overall dairy business and then she'll be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. In the future, she would like to expand into pineapple farming, increase and improve her dairy animals, and install a salon on her own premises (rather than renting). She added that "she has been able to learn how to save through Juhudi."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Srey Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Pov M. is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Svay Sar village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Khorn Soy, are farmers who own three hectares of land on which they cultivate rice for a living. 

Aside from being a farmer, Mrs. Srey Pov M. is also a pig breeder.  In order to increase her income and help support the family, Mrs. Srey Pov M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.  

This couple has three children who all are students in the local school and also assist their mother in farming. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa E. is a 63 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store business and rice retailer business. She lives in Barangay Jantianon, Amlan Negros Oriental with her husband, Cruc, who is 67 years old. Their 10 children, who are between 28-45 years old, also live with them. Nine of the children already have their own families and 1 is working.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and rice retail business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP15,000.

Basilisa is now borrowing PHP17,000 to use as additional working capital for her general store. This will be her 15th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP24,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Basilisa aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Hoeurng Chin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of 14 members located in Samar Khmaer village in the Takeo province. Mrs. Sok Hoeurng C. is 31 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its members. The members of this village loan will use it to support different purposes. 

Mrs. Sok Hoeurng C. is a silk weaver at home who is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to support this business, Mrs. Sok Hoeurng C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk. Her husband, Mr. Kol Chil, is an iron welder who is also able to earn a small profit to support his family. This couple has four children, all of whom are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina lives in a small city called Borewala in Pakistan.  She is the mother of two children; a three years old daughter and one year old son.  Her husband is a loader by trade. He owns a donkey cart and uses it for his loading business. He loads different items such as fruits & vegetables on his donkey cart and generates income for the family. 

Zarina is 28 years old lady who carries out her household responsibilities very well, she is also very good at sewing clothes and works part time to earn an extra income.  She has applied for a loan to help her husband buy a new donkey cart because his old cart breaks down and he can’t put heavy loads on it for delivery.
 
Zarina is a third year member of Asasah. In the last two years she has made 3 loans and she never put Asasah in trouble regarding repayments and maintained a good credit.

loans.use: Purchase a new donkey cart for a loading business

loans.name: Evarist

texts.en: The thinking of many Ugandans today is that those employed formally are missing out on the opportunity of income from business ventures, and many of them are beginning to have side incomes to supplement their salaries to make ends meet. Evarist falls in that category. Evarist is 39 years old and married with one child. He is a teacher living in Fort Portal, Uganda with five dependents. The purpose of this loan is to enable him to buy land for commercial building construction.

loans.use: To purchase land for commercial building

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora J. is currently in the business of selling local Sudanese green vegetables such as 'korofo', 'kombo' and okra at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish to sell.  Flora is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to initiate another type of business, mainly selling charcoal.

loans.use: Stock dried fish to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a member of Neema group that is  part of  Faulu Kenya.  Moses  sells bags.  He was previously employed before he went into business. He hopes to expand his business to improve his standard of living.  He has requested for a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy more bags for sale.  This will be his first loan from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes that in the future, he will run a big shop for selling bags.

loans.use: To buy a variety of bags

loans.name: Bukere Twimukye Group, Mubende

texts.en:
Hardworking and married, M. Amos has been operating a new garment sales business for 4 years from Kyaka Trading Centre, Mubende. This determined and innovative man has, by all standards, tried to maintain this business that he started with a little capital from his previous farming business. He sells a variety of garments and looks after farms.

His main setback is having little stock; therefore, acquiring this loan will help him buy more varied clothes to attract more customers. This will enable him to get more sales revenue and pay his family bills as he looks at educating his children and expanding his business. He belongs to Bukere Twimukye group, whose members hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes

loans.name: Mónica De Lourdes

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “16 de Julio”.

La señora Mónica tiene 38 años de edad, esta divorciada hace ya un buen tiempo, de esa relación tiene un hijo de nueve años y dice que es lo mejor que Dios le dio, a pesar de lo duro que es sacarlo adelante ya que en la actualidad está en la escuela y esto conlleva  muchos gastos, vive en la casa de sus padres, aprendió corte y confección hace mucho tiempo en el Centro de Aprendizaje Virgen De Guadalupe.

Es así como al verse sola con su hijo decidió instalar un pequeño taller de costura aprovechando que su papa le dio oportunidad de que lo ponga en su casa y no pague arriendo, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am después de dejar a su hijo en la escuela hasta las 12h00, de allí ayuda a su hijo en las tareas para luego volver a su costura hasta la noche, dice que es sacrificado pero a ella le encanta su trabajo y lo realiza con amor  por eso que tiene muchos clientes afirma.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar telas y materiales de costura. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus metas son tener casa y taller propios.
texts.en:
On the street, San Eduardo via a Santa Ana, in the city of Portoviejo, known as Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos ("The City of the Real Tamarinds") since colonial times, members of the Communal Bank, "16 de Julio," meet every 15 days.  

Señora Monica is 38 years old and has been divorced for quite some time.  From that relationship, she has a 9 year-old son and says that it was the best gift from God, regardless of the hardships of being able to provide him with a better quality of life.  He is currently in school, which comes with many additional costs.  She lives in her parents' house.  She learned to cut and tailor a while ago at the Virgen de Guadalupe Learning Center.

Seeing that she was a single mother, she decided to install a small sewing workshop, taking advantage of the opportunity her father gave her to have it in their house without paying rent.  She works every day from 8am, after dropping her son off at school, until noon, when she helps her son with his homework.  She then continues to sew into the night.  She says that it is a sacrifice but she loves her work and does it with love which is why she has many stable customers.   

This credit will be used towards the purchase of fabrics and sewing materials.  She has been a member of the Communal Bank for over 5 years and likes it for the ease at which she can obtain loans.  

Her goal is to have her own house and her own workshop.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, buttons, thread, closures, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cecilia reside en El transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 25 años y posee un comedor que le llama COMEDOR JUANCITO, el nombre es en honor a su hijo de 3 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus hermanos quienes la apoyan en el negocio  desde hace 2 años, el negocio tiene venta de comida, desayunos y almuerzos, por la tarde vende también pupusas y pasteles de papa, trabaja todos los días.
Ella necesita en el comedor un mostrador de comida y comprar mercadería para la preparación de los alimentos por lo que solita un préstamo que le ayude a realizar esta inversión, así tendrá de una mejor manera el mostrador con los diferentes menús que ofrece a los clientes, volviéndolo  más atractivo y con mejor atención.
Las proyecciones de ella es mejorar sus ingresos y crecer con el comedor, atrayendo a más clientes con la esperanza de ampliarlo y mejorar su imagen.
texts.en:
Cecilia lives in El Transito, located in the village of San Miguel. She is 25 years old and she has a restaurant named "Comedor Juancito". It is named after her 3-year old son. She is a single Mom and she lives with her siblings who all have all helped with her business for the past 2 years. She caters and also serves breakfast and lunch. In the evenings she makes pupusas and potato patties. She works every day

She needs to have a better stand set up in her restaurant and she needs to purchase ingredients to prepare the foods. She requires a loan to invest in her business. She will have a better stall to serve the various menu items that she offers her clients. It will be more attractive and give her costumers better service.

Her goal is to improve her earnings and to expand her restaurant to attract more clients. She hopes to have a larger restaurant and improve its presentation.

loans.use: To purchase a stand.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of milk, radio batteries, crates of soft drinks, bags of sugar etc

loans.name: Nasim's Group

texts.en:
Nasim is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. She is 48 years old but is still very active and does her work very well. She is married to M. I. who has a business selling clothes. He purchases clothes from wholesale markets of Lahore called "Ichra" & "Shahalmi” and sells to his local area clients at a profit. 

Nasim has given birth to 2 sons. Her elder son operates a thread-selling business while the younger one stays at home. He is 18 years old and illiterate. Nasim couldn’t provide education for her children due to poor financial conditions. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder son’s business. With the loan, he will buy thread in bulk quantity to improve his sales. Nasim is hopeful that an investment will help her son to improve his business on a large scale and increase his income as well. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 6th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit history and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy thread for thread-selling business

loans.name: Kiribedda Savings And Credit Farmers Group A - Mityana

texts.en:
N. Alivera, age 36, who makes common cause with Kiribedda Savings and Credit Farmers Group - Mityana, has been overseeing the operations of her pub in Kasagazi, Mityana for 20 years. This, by all accounts, is a highly lucrative business given the high alcohol consumption rates in Ugandan urban areas. She does not only sell hard drinks; she also sells soft drinks in equal measure as they are also in high favour with some of her other clients. She credits her mom for teaching her the requisite business skills at an early age. In a sense, she says, these laid a firm foundation for her –  not only in terms of providing her with self conviction and efficacy so that she could succeed, but also so that she could give a good account of herself running a business. 

This happily married mother of three says her future plan is to own the biggest pub in Kasagazi. With weekly business profits that amount to 133,000 shillings, her prospects seem to be rosy. With this loan she is going to procure more crates of both hard and soft drinks for resale at her pub.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of both hard and soft drinks for resale at her pub

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira B. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Almira is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Almira owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack foods in the local community. She chose to lower her loan because it is easier to pay. Almira has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Almira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Almira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Almira is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like beverages & instant noodles. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Almira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa G. is a married woman who lives in Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a Sari-Sari (general) store. Her husband Pancholito G., who is 32 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 7 to 12 years old. Nelfa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nelfa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 14,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so she can continue to save up for future improvements and expansion of her business. Nelfa G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Madai Ludim

texts.es:
Madai tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Jayanca, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir para todo público. Ella cuenta con un stock de prendas de vestir que suele adquirir en las ciudades de Chiclayo o Lima regularmente. Trabaja en base a pedidos y debido al tiempo que lleva como comerciante se ha vuelto conocida y cuenta con una clientela estable y fidelizada. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le ayudan a solventar sus gastos y apoyar a su familia con su sostenimiento económico.

Madai desea adquirir prendas de temporada para implementar su negocio y afrontar la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Madai is 18 years old, single and lives with her parents in the district of Jayanca, an agricultural area in the province of Lambayeque located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She makes a living selling clothing to the entire public. She has a stock of garments that she usually acquires in the cities of Chiclayo and Lima on a regular basis. Her work is based on orders, and as a result of her time in this activity she has become known and has a stable and loyal clientele. Her profits from her work help her cover expenses and support her family financially. Madai wishes to acquire seasonal clothing for her business to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve this objective.

loans.use: Acquire seasonal clothing for her business.

loans.name: Batuli

texts.en:
Batuli has been selling clothes in a shop for four years. She is a married woman with five children who attend school. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, Batuli wants to pay school fees for her child so as to enable the child to settle into school without having to be sent home often for fees. 

Batuli sells clothes on a retail basis to the villagers. She owns her home, which has electricity but no water. She cites school fees as her greatest expense. She hopes to someday open a wholesale sales location. She joined Yehu so as to access funds to run her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: Pay school fees

loans.name: Bon Berger Group

texts.fr: Kabuo J.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire Bon Berger, âgée de 34  ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants. Son marie est un enseignant. La cliente  Kabuo J.  est  vendeuse des denrées alimentaires (tomates, huile de palme, oignons, etc.). Elle s’installe au long de la Route, au point de vente  du quartier Ndosho-CAJED. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de son mari ayant une valeur de 60$. Il ya 3 ans qu’elle est en activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (4 bidons d’huile de palme, 1 bidon d’huile végétale Rina, 1 sac d’oignons, 2 paniers de tomates, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire confortablement sa maison. La cliente Kabuo J.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Bon Berger est constitué de 28 membres.
texts.en:
J. Kabuo is an entrepreneur and president of the business group Bon Berger (good shepherd) which consists of 28 members. She is 34 years old and married with five children. Her husband is a teacher. 

J. Kabuo sells foodstuffs (tomatoes, palm oil, onions, etc.). She sets up by the road in the commercial area of the Ndosho-CAJED district. She started this activity with her own capital of $60 received from her husband. She has been in business for three years. 

This new loan will allow her to replenish her stock of products (four cans of palm oil, one can of Rina vegetable oil, one bag of onions, two baskets of tomatoes, etc.).  She also plans to expand her business, give her children and education, and build a comfortable home. 

J. Kabuo wishes to thank Hekima for helping the less fortunate women who cannot turn to traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy 4 cans of palm oil, 1 can of Rina vegetable oil, 1 bag of onions, 2 baskets of tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Repair a bathroom & install tiling

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ar: جميلة في عمر 46 سنة متزوجة ولها 3 اولاد تعمل في بيع الالبسة لها في عملها 6 سنوات تحب العمل وهي نشيطة ومثابرة في العمل تريد تأمين العيش الكريم للعائلة وتطوير نفسها ماديا واجتماعيا تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع موسمية للعمل وتزيد من مدخول المحل لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة هي تلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة تحب ان تعمل بنشاط وان تكون منتجة وخاصة ان تعول اولادها
texts.en: Jamila is 46 years old and married with three children. She works in selling clothes. She has six years of experience in her field and she likes her work. She is very active and dilligent in her work. She would like to secure a respectable life for her family as well as improve her own material situation and social position. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she plans to buy seasonal clothing for her store, and in doing so, increase her store's income. She has a good history with al-Majmoua and has received full support from her family in applying for this loan. She likes to work hard and to be productive, especially in order to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise for her clothing store

loans.name: Hector Juan

texts.es:
Héctor de 35 años, un hombre trabajador que inicio vendiendo ropa. Un día su tío le pidió ayuda en la panificadora y desde allí le gusto esta actividad de preparación y ventas de panes y dulces.

En la actualidad el trabaja en la panadería con ayuda de su esposa desde las 3 de la mañana hasta la noche. Con el préstamo quiere compra materiales como harina, manteca, huevos para poder mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro desea seguir en el negocio y adecuar su vivienda para darles todo lo mejor a sus hijos en los estudios y lo personal.
texts.en:
Héctor, 35, is a hard working man who started out selling clothes.  One day his uncle asked him for help in his bakery and since then he liked the activity of making and selling bread and sweets.

He currently works in the bakery with help from his wife from 3am until nighttime.  He wants to us the loan to buy supplies like flour, lard and eggs to improve his business and increase profits.

In the future he’d like to stay in business and furnish his home in such a way as to provide his children with the all the best both for their persons and for their education.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard and eggs.

loans.name: C4909 Urukundo Group

texts.en:
Dorothe is 23 years old and is married. In this family, only Dorothe works. Dorothe is a businesswoman selling beans and cassava, sorghum and so on. Dorothe is the leader of this group which is called "Urukundo". The group has seven persons, six women and one man. Dorothe is the second person on the left.

Dorothe and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products such as beans, cassava, etc. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as beans, cassava, sorghum etc.

loans.name: Virgnie

texts.en: Virgnie is 32 years old.  She has 2 children who are 3 and 7 years old and are both in school. She owns a general store in which she sells sugar, shoes, radios, etc. This business has enabled her to pay her children’s school fees, pay house rent, and feed her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy more items for her shop in order to make more profit.

loans.use: buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Erminda

texts.es: La señora Erminda nacida en Valle grande el 25 de Julio de 1978 con 2 hijos pequeños vive en Guaracal a 10 km de Jorochito donde tiene su parcela,  que junto a su esposo trabajan  enla siembra de  papa, tomate y camote, después de cosechar comercializan en el mercado de la comunidad, con el dinero del crédito comprara semillas, para la siembra de Papa y los demás productos que la Sra. siembra, es una persona muy trabajadora y combina sus dos labores la de madre y agricultora, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
