Erminda was born in Valle Grande on July 25, 1978. She has two young children and lives in Guaracal, 10km from Jorochito where her farm land is located. Erminda works with her husband to farm potatoes, tomatoes, and sweet potatoes. After the harvest, they sell their produce in the local market. 

With this loan, she will buy seeds to plan potatoes and other crops. Erminda is very hardworking, as both a farmer and as a mother. She is grateful to this financial institution for its support.

loans.use: To plant potatoes.

loans.name: Kossivi Amétépé

texts.fr: Revendeur d'objets d’arts au Grand marché de Lomé depuis 2006, kossi  achète sur place pour revendre après. Il a 30ans et père d’un enfant.  Ce prêt  lui servira à acheter du bois pour la fabrication d’objets d’art pour satisfaire les commandes de ses clients.
texts.en: An art object retailer on Lome's Grand Market since 2006, Kossi purchases locally to resell later. He is 30 years old and a father of one. This loan will allow him to purchase wood to manufacture art objects and fulfill his clients' orders.

loans.use: to purchase ebony wood to manufacture art objects.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three school-aged children. In 2001, she started running her own business; she works as a beauty specialist, receiving clients at her home. She has worked in this domain for more than 10 years. Her income is important to help with her household expenses and to pay for her children’s school fees. 

Her story exemplifies the day-to-day challenges Lebanese women are facing in running a business and at the same time raising children and taking care of their houses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a massage machine in order to satisfy her customer’s demand. In the future, she hopes to open a formal beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase a massage machine.

loans.name: Paca Francisca

texts.en: Paca Francisca lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with her husband and two children. For the last five years, she has run a small convenience store where she sells basic food items and household supplies. She is applying for a loan for Lps. 8,000 to buy merchandise to sell to her customers. In her spare time, she enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in a convenience store.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 64 years old and married. She has four children.

Cecelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested an PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like sardines, groceries, etc., for her sari sari store.

Cecelia has been running the sari-sari store for 35 years and also earns an income from fish vending. She has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Cecelia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Carmelo Antonio

texts.es:
Carmelo es oriundo de Urabá-Colombia, lugar que tuvo que abandonar debido a la crítica situación de violencia que vivía la ciudad, desde entonces se radicó en Itagüí, municipio del Área Metropolitana de Medellín donde tiene su propio negocio de venta y reparación de celulares, así como toma de fotografías, pues a sus 65 años de edad este emprendedor se siente orgulloso de rebuscarse la forma de vivir y generar sus propios ingresos. 

Convertir su negocio en el más reconocido de la zona es el sueño de Carmelo quien actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar equipos celulares y accesorios para los mismos, lo que le generará mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmelo is originally from Urabá in Colombia, a place he had to leave owing to the critical level of violence that the town was experiencing.  Since then he has been living in Itagüí, a town in the metropolitan area of Medellín, where he has his own business selling and repairing cell phones as well as taking photos.  At 65 years of age, this entrepreneur feels proud that he has successfully searched for a new way of life and a way of earning his own income.

Carmelo's dream is to turn his business into the most well known in his area.  He currently needs a loan to buy cell phones and cell phone accessories which will make him more income.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has three children. Efua sells "wakye" and doughnuts at Elmina, which she has done for three years. Her husband is a farmer. "Wakye" is a traditional rice dish in Ghana. To prepare wakye, Efua gets her beans, rice, and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans until they become tender and adds the colored leaves to give them a reddish colour. Then, she adds the rice to the bean mixture. She cooks the rice and beans until they become tender enough to eat. Wakye is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (cow skin), gari (cassava couscous), salad with pepper sauce, tomato sauce, fish, or meat.

Efua assists her husband with her income by providing daily food for the family. Efua will use the loan to purchase beans, rice, flour and other items for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, flour, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 55 years old and is a married man with five children. He built a backyard piggery where he raises pigs. He also tills a parcel of land and grows rice and corn crops. Jose works hard to improve his family's living conditions.

Jose plans to use his loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI to purchase vitamins and both growth and finisher feed for his hogs. He hopes this loan will help his hog-raising business grow.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and both growth and finisher feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés, de 47 años, es un padre ejemplar, junto a su esposa Betty, salen adelante para poder ofrecerles una buena educación a sus 3 hijos, quienes viven en la ciudad para poder tener una buena educación. Ellos viven solos en su casa propia, ubicado en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Como socios, ellos se distribuyen las diversas actividades económicas que realizan. Betty cuida de su pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde todos los días ofrece productos de primera necesidad. Mientras Moisés, se dedica al servicio de trasporte, en la ruta Tarma-Huaricolca. Pero la actividad que más los une a ellos es la agricultura, ahí todos los fines de semana, cuidan de sus cultivos de papa, avena y olluco (productos agrícolas) que siembran en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos productivos y otras tantas que alquila en temporadas, ya tienen 21 años dedicándose a ello y juntos hacen posible mandar el dinero necesario a la capital del país, donde estudian sus hijos. Por ello para el futuro desea, comprar una casa en la capital, donde planean poner una tienda de comestibles y alquilar cuartos, con ello estarán cerca de sus hijos y podrán verlos desarrollarse para el futuro. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde los integrantes son personas unidas y muy solidarias. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Moisés está pensando sembrar papa de la variedad “única y tomaza”, por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 30 sacos de fertilizante orgánico y 50 sacos de guano de isla, que le ayudará en su próximo sembrío de papa.
texts.en:
Moisés is 47 years old and an exemplary father. He and his wife Betty are able to move forward so that they can offer a good education for their three children. Their children live in the city so that they can pursue a good education. Moisés and his wife live alone in their own home in the rural district of Huaricolca. As residents of this area, they divide their time among different business activities. Betty manages a small grocery store where she offers basic necessity products every day. Meanwhile, Moisés provides transportation services and has a route that runs from Tarma to Huaricolca. However, the business activity that unites them is farming. Every weekend they look after their crops of potatoes, oats, and “ulluco” that are grown on two hectares of productive farmland. They rent additional land on a seasonal basis. Moisés and his wife have been farming for 21 years and this has enabled them to send money to Lima, where their children are studying. In the future, he wants to buy a house in Lima where he plans to open a grocery store and build rental rooms so that he can be near his children and see them develop.

Moisés is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) and this is his sixth loan with MFP. He is pleased to be a member of the Communal Bank because the members are close and supportive of one another. For this reason, he promises to submit his payments on time. Moisés is planning to plant potatoes of the “Única” and “Tomaza” varieties, which is why he is receiving this loan. The money he requested will be used to buy 30 sacks of organic fertilizer and 50 sacks of guano manure, which will be helpful with his next crop of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy to buy 30 sacks of organic fertilizer and 50 sacks of guano manure.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 30 years old. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Cristita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Cristita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cristita has been farming vegetables for six years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Cristita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Zacarias Luis

texts.es:
El Señor Zacarias tiene 42 años de edad, está casado con la Señora Elida de 46 años de edad, con quien tiene 2 hijos, María Mercedes de 18 años de edad, quien esta estudiando confección y Luis Fernando de 16 años quien esta en el tercer año de la Educación Media.
El Señor Zacarias se dedica a la fabricación de Bloques de cemento para cordones de empedrados desde hace más de 5 años, y se independizó hace 2 años aproximadamente. Ahora cuenta con sus propias herramientas e insumos, y posee su negocio en su propio domicilio, trabaja con la Municipalidad y también con contratistas de obras de empedrados. Es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada, quien esta muy agradecido con la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de cemento que es la materia prima fundamental para la elaboración de los bloques de cemento que vende.
texts.en:
Señor Zacarias, who is 42 years old, is married to Señora Elida, who is 46 years old.  Together they have 2 children.  María Mercedes is 18 years old and studying dressmaking.  Luis Fernando is 16 years old and in his third year of high school.
Señor Zacarias has made his living for the past 5 years fabricating cement blocks for cobbled paving.  He went out on his own approximately 2 years ago.  He now has his own tools and supplies, and he runs his business out of his own home.  He works with the municipality and also with contractors who do cobbling work.  Señor Zacarias is a very hard-working, self-sacrificing person.  He is very grateful to Fundación for the opportunity that they are giving him.
Señor Zacarias is requesting the loan to purchase cement, which is the basic raw material for making the cement blocks that he sells.

loans.use: to purchase cement to make cement blocks.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina has two businesses. She cooks food and smokes fish for sale. She has been smoking fish for 12 years now. 

She is married and has three children. She uses her income to take care of her family. She will use this loan to buy fresh fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards buying land.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Almakan's Group

texts.en:
Almakan is the treasurer of this group. She is 43 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she brings up two daughters and a son, all of whom study at school. Almakan cultivates nuts and is engaged in livestock breeding. She started to breed livestock in 2007. With an initial investment of 3000 soms, she purchased a calf. If they need money to meet the family needs, they can sell some livestock. With money received from the loan, Almakan wants to purchase about 300kg of nuts in order to resell them at a higher price in spring. In the future, she wants to provide her children with a good education. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase nuts for resale

loans.name: Mot

texts.en:
Mot and his wife Saran (pictured together), live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one young son. 

Mot is a construction worker, while his wife is a garment worker. He is in the process of building his new house to live in, but the house is not finished yet, so Mot decided to apply for a loan of $1,200 to complete the work.

loans.use: to finish his house building.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Adolfo; el tiene 25 años de edad y es soltero; El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,el socio vende chompas,mantas,chalinas y gunates,el socio vende en el centro artesanal del distrito de Chinchero,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania . El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como chompas,chalinas,guantes y sombreros al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Adolfo, 25, is the member; he’s 25 years old and single.  He continues selling crafts.  He sells sweaters, blankets, shawls and gloves.  He sells in Chinchero’s crafts district and works from 8am until 6pm.  He supports his children through this business.  He wants to enlarge and improve the crafts sales business and is asking for a loan to buy more crafts like sweaters, shawls, gloves and hats at wholesale.  He’s happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy crafts.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 42-year-old mixed crop farmer who is married to Maria, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with three children. John has been in the farming business for the past two years and makes a monthly income of 6,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.
John is applying for his first loan with Kiva partner KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET client. John will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. John's hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses, which will help him improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cerveza y venta de chicha,ella tiene una picanteria donde realzia platos tipicos como cuy al horno,caldo de gallinas,chancho al horno entre otros platos,la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de picanteria y negocio de venta de cerveza y chicha.La socia solicita para comprar cerveza,chicha y para comprar  productos para cocinar como carne,pollo,verduras y arroz al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member is in the business of selling beer and has a “picanteria”, a small family-style restaurant where she makes local dishes such as baked guinea pig, chicken broth, baked pork and other dishes.  The partner, through this business, moves ahead for her children.  The member wants to expand and improve her tavern and beer-selling business.  She is requesting a loan to buy beer, chicha (a Peruvian corn drink) and purchase cooking products such as meat, chicken, vegetables and rice in bulk. The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with payment of her quota.

loans.use: to buy beer, drinks and cooking products such as meat, chicken, vegetables and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Juana;  La socia tiene 48 años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 3 hijos de 25, 18, 12 años de edad; La socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo todo tipo de granos en el mercado de Cusco, la socia vende solo los días domingos y cuando no está vendiendo ella está en su stand en la feria artesanal vendiendo sus diferentes trabajos manuales como gorros, chalinas, chompas, ponchos, todo en lana de alpaca y de ovino, la socia es una mujer muy emprendedora y desea sacar adelante a sus hijos y verlos profesionales motivo por el cual ella se esfuerza para darles ejemplo de trabajo y para darles comodidades en el hogar y apoyarles en los estudios. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas de alpaca, sintéticas, y de ovino para la elaboración de los diferentes trabajos a mano.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO” Communal Bank, which is located in Ccorao district, in Calca province and Cusco department. Sra. Juana is 48 years old, married and has three sons, 25, 18 and 12 years old.

Juana buys and sells all kinds of grains at the Cusco market. She sells every Sunday and when she is not selling there, she is at her stand in the handicraft market selling her different handmade items such as caps, scarves, sweaters and ponchos, all in alpaca and sheep’s wool. She is a very enterprising woman and wants to help her sons get ahead and see them become professionals. That is the reason why she works so hard everyday – to serve as an example for them and to provide them with amenities in the home and support them in their studies.

Juana is requesting the loan to purchase alpaca and sheep’s wool, as well as synthetics, in order to produce her handmade items. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy alpaca and sheep's wool and synthetics to make different handmade items.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: El socio es el Sr. Feliciano; continua con sus terrenos de cultivo, le socio también continua con su consultorio naturista y desearia poder ampliar el local y poner vitrinas para la exhibicion de los productos alternos que vende de la linea omnilife, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de productos naturales y los batidos de la misma linea.
texts.en: The member, Feliciano, continues with his farming.  He also continues with his natural products consultancy and wants to be able to expand his place and install display cases to show the alternative products he sells from Omnilife.  This time he wants to invest the loan in buying natural products and shakes of the same brand.

loans.use: to buy Omnilife natural products and shakes

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is 39 years old, married and has three children. Two of the children work jobs while the youngest one is still studying. 
Shameem's husband is a driver and provides transportation services to his clients. He is very much an expert in driving and people trust his driving skills and feel safe while traveling in his vehicle. 
Shameem is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has good skills in sewing and receives a good number of orders every month. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband because he wants to buy new tires and also wants to repair his vehicle (a 32 seat van). 
By doing this, he will be able to drive his van more smoothly and provide better quality transportation services for the passengers. 
Shameem is hopeful that an investment will be more helpful for her husband in securing his business assets and will increase his income. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shameem”.

loans.use: To repair and buy new tires for a van.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
Silverio tiene 48 años de edad y es casado y tiene dos hijos, él nació en la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco. Silverio trabaja en unos de los restaurantes más prestigiosos de la ciudad del Cusco, él es cocinero de profesión y desde hace mucho tiempo desempeña su profesión y le ha ido muy bien. Silverio requiere el préstamo para uso personal como para la ropa, educación de sus hijos. 

El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Silverio is 48 years old. He is married and has two children. Silverio was born in Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco, and he lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.

Silverio works in one of the most prestigious restaurants in Cusco. He is a professional cook, he has been working in this job for a long time, and it has gone very well for him. Silverio needs the loan for personal use, for expenses like clothing and his children's education.

The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) communal bank is made up of responsible, hardworking people who help their families get ahead. Most of the members live in the city of Cusco, and this is where they run their businesses. Cusco is known as an area for commercial activity and tourism. It is also known for its traditional "Inti Raymi" festival and because it is the site of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to cover personal expenses like clothing and education for his children.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna owns a retail shop which she has been running for over ten years. Her business has been very profitable and she has used the profits to start constructing rental houses. 

Maimuna faces the challenge of inadequate capital to supply her increasing number of customers. Her goals are to educate her children and to own a wholesale shop and an estate. Maimuna needs this loan to complete building her rental houses.

loans.use: to complete her rental houses.

loans.name: Laura Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a young woman of 26 year-old; she is married and has two children of 7 and 4 years old respectively. Her husband\'s name is Carlos and he works as a bricklayer, for that reason his income are variable. She wants to be able to cover all the family necessities,and so she started a small business. One year ago her mother supported her to begin her stationery business. She gave her merchandise and Margarita started to sell at home to her neighbors. So she reinvested the incomes and her business started to grow.

The Christmas season is very close and she requires a loan of $200 USD to purchase merchandise like notebooks, pens, gifts and more. These articles are very demanded in these days, she thinks that with your support she will have the capacity to obtain better incomes, benefiting her business and her family, repaying the loan in a term of 3-6 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Margarita es una mujer joven de 26 años de edad, ella esta casada y tiene dos hijos, de 7 y 4 años respectivamente, su esposo se llama Carlos y trabaja como albañil en la construcción, es por eso que sus ingresos son variables, debido a ello se vio en la necesidad de iniciar un pequeño negocio. Hace un año que su madre la apoyo para que iniciara su negocio de papelería, le regalo mercancía para que comenzara a vender en su hogar a sus vecinos, fue así como con las ganancias de sus ventas fue reinvirtiendo en mas mercancías y su negocio empezó a crecer.

Ante la temporada navideña que se avecina, requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 USD para comprar algo de papelería y regalos, los cuales son muy demandados en estos días, piensa que con su apoyo ella podrá obtener mayores utilidades, beneficiando a su negocio y a su familia, pagando el préstamo en un plazo de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise like notebooks, pens, gifts and more

loans.name: Minah

texts.en: M. is a 36 year old mother of 4 children. She sells vegetables and other foods as well as household goods such as coffee, soap, and salted fish. Her husband, Nasir, helps her everyday in their booth and buys goods to sell in the neighboring market in Sepatan. He will stand in for M. during MBK’s weekly meeting.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Jahn

texts.en: Jahn lives in district 1 of Kabul Afghanistan she is married and she wants to help with her son she took her 4cycle group of loan for her son he open a retail shop and try to work fast to make a good business and make good monthly income for his family and now his mothers wants to take anther loan that he buy rice.onion.milk.tea.and some other retail for shop to make his business butter than now and now he would like to thanks from AFSG.

loans.use: to buy rice.onion.milk.tea and extra things

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leonico lives with his parents in a home near the district of Pasankeri, on the western side of the city La Paz. Like many Bolivians, he is self-employed, assembling computers that are sold to business offices in the city. With the savings he had, he was able to purchase a piece of land in the Pasankeri district. He found this site without a single previous construction on it, with only a wall for property definition surrounding it. The loan he is applying for will be used for the construction of a brick-home, which will allow him to live on his own and to begin the construction of his own home. His previous history with Impro shows him to be a reliable client and able to take on a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Leoncio vive con sus padres en la vivienda de éstos ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la Ciudad de la Paz. Como muchos bolivianos trabaja de forma independiente armando computadoras que comercializa en distintas oficinas de nuestra ciudad. Con los ahorros que tenía ha logrado comprar un terreno en la misma zona de Pasankeri. El mismo que se encuentra sin construcción alguna y tan solo tiene un muro perimetral de resguardo de propiedad. El crédito que solicita es para la construcción de una habitación de ladrillo que le permita poder vivir de forma independiente e iniciar la construcción de su vivienda propia. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Just because she left school at an early age doesn't stop Rosa from trying her best to start a business. She is newly married and has plans for her family. She joined Kiva last month when her vegetable garden needed help.  She will use her loan to buy weedkiller, fertilizer, and other materials to keep her garden healthy.  She get on average $150.00-200.00 a week from selling vegetables.

loans.use: To buy weedkiller, fertilizers, foschek fungicide.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro, 26, is married and works as a mechanic on Ave. del Plan 3000 in the city of Santa Cruz in Sierra. During the weekends, he helps his wife in her plastic business. The B. family lives in Plan 3000 by the high school Communidad Balencia. They live in an anticrético - a place where they pay the landlord a fixed sum at the start of the rental period instead of paying monthly rent. They also have a young daughter. As a plastic merchant, Genaro has years of experience; as a recent mechanic, only a couple of years. That's why he only helps his wife sometimes with the plastic business's expense management. The plastic business is rather competitive, which is why Genaro made the decision to become a mechanic. Ultimately, he did it to find other means of income for his family. Since Genaro is competitive, he does not neglect any part of his businesses and assumes responsibility for the plastic business's development by bringing his products to various markets. The current loan is to acquire more merchandise for later. Genaro does not have any previous negative marks in his credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Genaro es una persona casada de 26 años de edad que trabaja como mecanico en Av. del Plan 3000 de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra, por otra parte los fines de semana ayuda su esposa en su negocio de comercialización de plásticos. La familia B. vive en el Plan 3000 por el colegio Comunidad Balencia, viven en una casa en anticrético, este matrinomio joven cuenta con una hija. Genaro como comerciante de plásticos tiene varios añor de experiencia, pero como mecánico recién tien un par de años, es por ello que en este negocio a veces también le ayuda su esposa con el manejo de los gastos. La comercialización de plásticos es bastante competitiva, por esta razón Genaro tomó la decisión de incursionarse en el rubro de la mecánica, esto con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos para la sustentabilidad de su familia. Debido a que Genaro es una persona competitiva no descuida ninguno de los negocios y pese a la elevada competencia con los plásticos el lleva a varios mercados su mercadería. El presente crédito es para la adquisición de más mercadería para su posterior comercialización, por otra parte Genaro no tiene antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
I am Khalida P. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. My husband and I both are scrap dealers. We operate a scrap store where we buy and sell old and used objects of various kinds. We have been doing this business for the last twelve years. The business generates just enough to put food on the table and send our children to school.
Our children are growing and so are our expenses. With every passing day, we feel the need to make extra income. Please lend me $350 to expand our scrap store. We will buy the scrap objects in bulk and will sell them to various other dealers.

loans.use: Expand scrap business

loans.name: Herlinda's Group

texts.en:
Herlinda, Victoria, y Lidia Aydee are all resent members of the community bank “Solución”.  Herlinda is 28 years old and Lidia Aydee is 29, they both have small children.  Victoria is 52 and has seven children.
They all agreed that in their community bank they have learned values such as, to save, to be responsible, punctual, and to respect women.  They said that as well, they have learned a lot from the lessons given by the bank.  In their bank they can relax and forget about their problems.
Herlinda has sold vegetables in the market since April of last year.
On the other hand, Victoria sells prepared food in the Nery Garcia market.  She has been doing this for the last ten years.  On the holidays she travels to different communities to sell her food.  Meanwhile, Linda Aydee sells cheese in several different markets.
Their loans are for 400, 600, and 600 soles respectively.  They will be invested in buying vegetables, oil, potatoes, sausage, chicken, cheese, and transportation.  
Herlinda, Victoria, and Lidia Aydee will use their savings to buy land and build houses from solid materials, and to improve the education of their children.
The dreams of Herlinda, and Victoria are to have their own car to help transport vegetables between Lima and Ayacucho.  Lidia Aydee’s dream is to run a grocery store from her house.

loans.use: Their loans are for 400, 600, and 600 soles respectively.  They will be invested in buying vegetables, oil, potatoes, sausage, chicken, cheese, and transportation.

loans.name: Kireka A1 (I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Agnes N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Agnes is 35 years old and her husband is in the welding business. She has 4 children ranging from age 4 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Agnes makes approximately UGX 150000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to buy a piece of land. Agnes has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Agnes is joined in her small group by Jane Adam, Robinah N., Leonia Gipata, and Joyce N.. Jane Adam owns a local brewery and wants to reinvest in her brew business. Robinah N. is currently operating a bar/ pub and wants a loan to purchase more beers and soft drinks. Leonia Gipata operates a business of stone quarrying and wants to expand business. Joyce N. owns a salon and is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment.

loans.use: To expand clothes business

loans.name: Busazi East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Aisha Abenoyo. She is currently in the business of selling farm produce and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Aisha is 25 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from age 4 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Aisha makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Aisha has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Aisha is joined in her small group by Mariam B., Jowali F., Hawa N., and Ruth N.. Mariam B. has a business selling clothes and wants to venture into a shoe sales business. Jowali F. is currently operating a business selling produce and wants a loan to expand her business. Hawa N. operates a business trading produce and wants to boost business. Ruth N. is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to construct a charcoal shade.

loans.use: To improve the quality and quantity of produce sold

loans.name: Ramiza

texts.en: Ramiza was born in 1972 and is the mother of two children.  Her husband is a construction worker earning a monthly salary of 500,00KM, and they receive additional money from the humanitarian organization “Amica” in the amount of 120,00KM. Ramiza is involved in cattle-breeding and agriculture, but in order to increase income and improve the family’s living standard, she is requesting a loan of $975 to diversify through the purchase of chickens and bee hives.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and bee hives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina is a member of the communal bank Villa Huatatas. Paulina is from the town of Huatatas which is located twenty minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. It is a small valley where the people dedicate themselves to farming and raising cattle.

Paulina is widowed, is 46 years old and has 6 children. She buys potatoes and grains in the different fairs in the Ayacucho region and then sells them at the Nery Garcia market. She transports her products in rented cars. In addition, Paulina sells fruits as a traveling salesperson and also farms.

Paulina needs a loan of $450.00 which she will invest in the purchase of potatoes and quinoa.

Pualina’s dream is to get ahead, to get a car to transport her products and a home to give her children comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas, Paulina es natural D. la comunidad D. Huatatas que se encuentra a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, es un valle pequeño donD. la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Paulina es viuda, tiene 46 años y 6 hijos, Paulina compra papa y cereales en las diferentes ferias D. la región D. Ayacucho y luego lo venD. por mayor en el mercado Nery García, sus productos son transportados en carros alquilados. Además Paulina venD. frutas D. manera ambulatoria. También Paulina se dedica a la agricultura.

Paulina necesita un préstamo D. 1250 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa y quinua.

Los sueños D. Paulina son progresar, tener un carro para transportar sus productos y casa para dar comodidad a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes and quinoa.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice T., 34, is married with 8 children. She has many years of experience in the barbeque foods business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Janice’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also use the loan for home improvements by buying cement, timber, and an iron roof. Her husband is working and helps her with family needs and running the business.

loans.use: To purchase meats and ingredients needed for the bbq business

loans.name: Thi Luu

texts.vi:
Before joining the TYM Fund, Mrs. T. Thi Luu's family only focused on farming and small retail activities, thus, her family was very poor as she and her husband had just started to live separately from their parents. In 1995, she joined the Fund and borrowed 500.000VND (about 32USD) to invest in buying and selling general goods. She realised that it was easy to repay the loan weekly and that she had more capital for her business. Therefore, she used the subsequent loans to move into butchering. Her husband selected and butchered the pigs while Mrs. Luu sold the pork at the wet market. She also catered for offices and restaurants, so her annual income reached hundreds of millions VND. In 2005, she used the profits from the butcher shop and borrowed more money to build a spacious 2-storey house. Currently, she is still concentrating on the butcher shop and caters for the restaurant in Noi Bai airport. Her family's monthly income is about 8,000,000VND (about 515USD). This time, she would like to borrow 19,000,000VND (1,150.00USD) to invest in her butcher shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Trước khi tham gia Qũy Tình Thương gia đình chị chỉ làm nông nghiệp và buôn bán nhỏ lẻ, khi đó kinh tế gia đình rất khó khăn vì hai vợ chồng mới được bố mẹ cho ra ở riêng. Năm 1995 chị tham gia Quỹ và vay vốn vòng đầu tiên 500.000 đồng phụ thêm cho việc đi chợ, thấy việc hoàn trả theo tuần dễ dàng và lại có thêm nguồn vốn hỗ trợ cho việc buôn bán. Được vay vốn các vòng tiếp theo chị chuyển hướng đi chợ chuyên vào thịt lợn, chồng chị chọn và mua lợn về mổ và sơ chế thịt lợn, chị bán hàng thịt lợn tại chợ và nhận các mối làm ăn từ các cơ quan, cửa hàng ăn, hàng năm cho thu nhập hàng trăm triệu đồng. Năm 2005 từ số tiền lãi do đi chợ dành dụm được và vay thêm bên ngoài, anh chị đã làm ngôi nhà 2 tầng khang trang rộng rãi. Hiện nay chị vẫn tiếp tục buôn bán thịt lợn và nhận đặt hàng cho bếp ăn sân bay Nội Bài, thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình khoảng 8.000.000 đồng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000 đầu tư buôn bán thịt lợn.

loans.use: Invest in butcher shop

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol is 32 years old, single, and has a 12 year old son named José who is a student in secondary school. She sells food from a tricycle. For more than 10 years this young woman from Juliaca has been working in this business, but one year ago she decided to launch her own food business, which today, can provide income for her son’s food and education. Marisol works in the mornings, offering delicious dishes. She has always enjoyed cooking, but at times it is difficult to acquire the ingredients as prices are rising. This mother wants to offer the best for her son José, so that he can study and have a professional career and a good future. With the money she will be able to buy kitchen accessories, benches to make her small business more inviting and help grown the clientele, so that in the future she can have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Marisol tiene 32 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo llamado José de 12 años de edad, quien estudia en la escuela secundaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulante, en un triciclo. Desde hace diez años esta joven juliaqueña se ha desempeñado en este negocio, apoyando a su madre ganando un poco de dinero para su manutención, pero desde hace un año decidió poner su propio negocio de comida, con el cual, en la actualidad, puede brindarle educación y alimentación a su hijo.Marisol trabaja por las mañanas, ofreciendo los ricos potajes que prepara, a ella siempre le ha gustado cocinar, pero a veces es difícil adquirir los ingredientes ya que los precios se están elevando. Esta madre, quiere brindarle lo mejor a su hijo José, para que estudie una carrera profesional y tenga un buen futuro. Con el dinero que se le facilite comprará más accesorios de cocina, bancas para hacer de su pequeño negocio un lugar más acogedor y tener mayor clientela, para que en el futuro pueda tener un restaurante.

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils and some benches for her customer's comfort

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana V.  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
 
Vive. en la comunidad de Ticuyo de la Provincia  Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas  y media de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es soltera, vive junto a su madre quien se dedica a la agricultura. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos..
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana V. works in the cattle raising business, whose milk production is commercialized in the Andean Milk Industry Plant. She lives in the community of Ticuyo in the province of Los Andes in the suburb of La Paz, which is located 3 and a half hours from the city of La Paz. She is single and lives with her mother who works in agriculture. Juana will use the loan to purchase cattle from a better breed so that she can increase milk production and her income. This is her first time working with Impro., as the evaluation recently qualified her to be a loan recipient.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Ameena's Group

texts.en:
Ameena baji is the widow of M.Ashiq and lives in a small place named Kot Radha Kishan of the city Kasur, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is 40 km from Kasur. She has been living in this place for the last 32 years. She is the mother of four sons. Her first two sons are daily wage laborers. Her younger son buys goats for reselling. Her youngest son is a milk seller by profession. He has been in this business for the past 3 years. Ameena baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo to expand her son’s milk selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zuhra baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to resell. Nusrat baji and Jamila baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk selling business. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (tea, sugar and milk) for her tea stall. Rasoolan baji wants a loan to buy buffalo to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for milk business

loans.name: Samach

texts.en:
Mrs. Samach S., 23, is a local tailor who took this up over 3 years ago for income to support family, especially for her one young child’s food. She can earn approximately $5 each day and her husband, Mr. Shot So, 33, is a motorcycle taxi driver who always leaves home in the early morning to pick up passengers for money.

Samach needs to ask for $1,100 loans to use as capital for local transferring money service for her customers from place to place and charge fee. The family lives in Banteay Meanchey province.

loans.use: to use as capital for local transferring money service

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok K. is 26 years old, married, with three young children. Her family lives in Siem Reap Province. She is a local farmer who grows rice or vegetable crops. Her husband, Ream Vann, is a 28 year old fisherman who earns approximately $2.50 per day. Recently, his fishing equipment was broken thus he has not been able to catch as much fish as before. Therefore, Sok K. is requesting a loan to buy more fishing tools to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El señor Gregorio A. está muy agradecido por el gran apoyo que le brindaron en su anterior crédito, el cual pudo poner la losa en un cuarto de la vivienda.
Pero le esta haciendo falta a otro cuarto que construyo la losa de concreto y así  tener la casa ya terminada , es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación para este nuevo préstamo y así poder realizar su mejora.
Don Gregorio A. trabaja en una empresa como operador de una maquina de constricción, este es su ingreso de su familia. Cuando visitamos la vivienda del señor Gregorio no se encontraba es por eso que en la foto esta su esposa la señora Teresa Vazquez quien nos atendió.
texts.en:
Mr. Gregario A. is very grateful for the great help that he was given in his last loan, which let him install flooring in one room of his house.

However, the other room that he built needs concrete flooring, and when that room has flooring the house will be finished. This is why he is asking for your cooperation for a new loan, this way he can make the improvements a reality.

Mr. Gregario A. works for a business and operates construction equipment; this job provides an income for his family. When we visited Mr. Gregario's house, he was not at home, as a result, his wife Mrs. Teresa Vazquez met us and is in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a concrete floor

loans.name: Sy

texts.en: Mr. Sy H. lives in the Ty Buon village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is 32 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study.  His wife, Mrs. Toem Sora, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  He sells bamboos in the local village. In his business, he has a problem because he cannot provide delivery service for customers, which would increase his income. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse to use with a cart for his bamboo deliveries. His wife is pictured with him.

loans.use: To buy a horse to use with a cart for bamboo deliveries.

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede sells tubers of yam at Ojoo Market in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is 37 years old and married with four children. She needs a loan of N100000 to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Lorena De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Lorena tiene la edad de 32 años, su vivienda ubicada en barrio Memorial Sandino, casada de profesión carpintero ebanista.Los planes que tiene para su hogar es culminar la construcción de su casa de habitación. Doña Lorena es una mujer emprendedora en el ámbito laboral inicio su propio negocio de mariscos y otros productos como ropa, cosmético y perfumes teniendo tres años de experiencia en la comercialización. Iniciándolo con la venta de cosmético posteriormente ampliándolo con variedades de productos y ahora vendiendo marisco. El préstamo que solicita es para seguir incrementando el volumen de venta para llegar a nuevas clientela y ofrecerles mayores cantidades de productos tales como: mariscos, cosméticos, la compra de un frizer para mantener mejor los productos.
texts.en:
Lorena is 32 years old. Her house is located in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She is married to a carpenter. She plans to finish the construction of her house. Lorena is a hardworking woman. She started her own business selling seafood and other products, such as clothing, cosmetics, and perfumes. She has been working at this for three years. She started out by selling cosmetics and began selling a variety of other products, and now seafood. The loan she is requesting is so she can continue increasing her volume of sales so she can get new customers and offer them greater quantities of products such as: seafood, cosmetics. She will also buy a freezer to better maintain her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer and seafood

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира для улучшения условий своей семьи кроме основной работы содержит дома домашний скот. Это хоть и небольшой доход, но за счет этой деятельности Мунира может без проблем изготовить что нибудь из молока, а за счет продажи излишков молока можно купить комбикорм для скота. Мунира замужем, ей 45 лет, имеет 3 детей. На займ планирует приобрести маленького бычка для откорма.
texts.en:
Munira improves her family's standard of living by raising domestic livestock in addition to her regular work. The actual profit is small, but thanks to her activity she can easily make various things from milk, and can buy feed for the cows using the income from selling surplus milk. Munira is married, 45 years old, and has three children. She plans to use this loan to buy a young bull calf to raise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull calf

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 38 year old woman who lives with her husband in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. She has owned a clothing shop for four years.

Manal requested a loan of $800 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.

Manal’s clients can be anybody from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulty. She decided on starting her business because of her financial need. In the future, she plans on improving her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola is 42 years old and married with four children. She earns an income by making bags and clothes. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N30,000, which she wishes to use to purchase more materials in order to make more bags to sell.

She sends her thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for making bags to sell

loans.name: Marcelino Feliciano

texts.es: El Joven Ricardo Adán C. D. L.  cuenta con 23 años D. edad, soltero, es “Graduado D. la carrera D. Bachiller Industrial ” Actualmente está Prestando sus servicios como Lector D. Contadores en el municipio D. la Ciudad D. Guatemala, el resiD. en el paraje Alvarado, del Cantón Juchanep, municipio y departamento  D. Totonicapán, Guatemala, pero en las condiciones a las que viaja son muy complicadas por lo que solicito  un préstamo  acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, y así poder transportarse D. un lugar a otro facilitando su trabajo y poder cubrir el área que le corresponD. en mejor tiempo posible como también así poder mejorar sus ingresos y darle una mejor vida a sus padres.
texts.en:
The youth Ricardo Adán C. D. L. is 23 years old and is single. He is a “Graduate of the course of Bachelor Industrial”. Currently he is loaning his services as a Lecturer of Accounting in Guatemala City. He lives in the place called Alvarado, in Cantón Juchanep, municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala,. The conditions in which he travels are very complicated, and so he is asking for a loan from ASDIR to enable him to transport himself from one place to another, facilitating his job so he could cover his area in the best time possible and so also be able to increase his income and give a better life to his parents.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Lucia es separada, tiene 46 años y 2 hijos, Lucia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, productos que vende en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Lucia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz y haba.
Los sueños de Lucia son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Sonrisa Microfinance Institute.

She is a 46-year-old separated mother of two children. She travels to the different markets in the region where she buys grains, then sells them in various markets throughout the city of Ayacucho.

Lucia needs a 1,600.00 PEN loan, which she will invest in purchasing corn and broad beans.

Lucia dreams of buying a car so that she can transport her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn and broad beans

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Business-minded - that best describes Mrs. Janeth O.. She is a Tupperware vendor in their village but, aside from that, she also sells beauty products. She also manages a fish pond as another source of income. With her businesses, she is able to generate income for her family. Most of her earnings are being used for their daily expenses, thus she is somewhat worried because her three children are already attending school.

Wanting to secure the future of her children, Janeth is being motivated to borrow from Kiva the amount of PHP 5,000 for use as additional capital. With that, she will somehow feel she can relax because she can save money for the education of her children. Moreover, she believes that with her perseverance and hard work, she will become successful and eventually her determination will bear fruit.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is 34 years old. She is married and has three children who are all in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in their community. Roselyn is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She prepares the food in her residence and sells it at the lorry station in her community. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from the central market of the city. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk to expand her business. It is Roselyn’s desire to give all her children quality education and provide them with a quality life.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Sturuda

texts.en:
Sturuda is a member of the Idunda In Kihesa Iringa,she is 50 years old woman.she is widowed and a mother of 3 children.Her children  are aged 31,29,26 years.

 sturuda started her own clothing business selling vitenge (fabric) 5 years ago.she works 9 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 130,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sturuda`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania.She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vitege.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Sturuda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja tiene 43 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en una pequeña casa alquilada, junto a sus 3 queridos hijos: Yesica de 19, Henry de 17 y Yonathan de 10 años. Y lo que más desea es brindarles unos buenos estudios, para que en el futuro puedan salir adelante por sí solos. Los 10 años que Maruja viene realizando la crianza de ganado le han servido para forjarse una vida digna, ella realiza esta actividad desde que tenía 20 años y actualmente se ha convertido en una de las ganaderas más solicitadas de su zona, debido a las grandes reses que lleva a vender a la ciudad de Juliaca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es criar a sus animales, ya que sabe que mientras mejor los cuide, mejores pagos le darán por sus reses, pero lo más difícil para ella, es transportarlos hasta el lugar de la venta, puesto que es una actividad que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo. Para el futuro desea implementar una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le pueda generar otros ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es el primer préstamo de Maruja con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere meter en problemas a sus compañeras de banco comunal, donde es muy querida debido a la alegría que le pone a las reuniones. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más forraje (tipo de pasto) para tener a su ganado mejor alimentado.

loans.use: Compra alimento para sus animales

loans.name: Gnonlonfoun Eric

texts.fr: B. Gnonlonfoun Eric, est né en 1976 dans la commune de DANGBO. Eric marié et père de deux enfants. Eric exerce comme métier la couture. Mais, les machines à coudre d’Eric sont devenues vétustes. Eric sollicite donc l’appui financier d’ALIDé pour acquérir une nouvelle machine à coudre. Ainsi, Eric pourra améliorer ses prestations pour répondre qualitativement à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
B. Gnonlonfoun Eric was born in 1976 in the community of DANGBO. He is married and the father of two children. His works as a tailor by trade. But his sewing machines have gotten old and worn. He’s therefore requesting financial support from ALIDé to acquire a new sewing machine. He will thus be able to improve the services he offers to respond to customer demands in terms of quality.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel K. was born in 1953 in Ijevan. He is married and has two daughters. One daughter works in the Ijevan Music School, the other is married and lives away from her parents. Samvel has owned a food shop since 1999. Before starting his business, Samvel worked as a builder up until the closing of his Building Department. His mother and his wife are helping him in the business. In the past ten years, thanks to his profits, Samvel has been able to buy new furniture for his house and to pay the expenses for his daughter’s wedding, as well as for his mother’s surgery. Unlike the other food shops in Ijevan, Samvel’s shop is open for 24 hours. This is Samvel’s 6th borrowing cycle with “Nor Horizon.” This time he is requesting 500,000 AMD to buy non-alcoholic drinks and candy for his shop. In the future Samvel wants to open a second food shop in Ijevan.

loans.use: To buy non-alcoholic drinks and candy for his shop.

loans.name: Promise Mae

texts.en:
Promise Mae L. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. She is 26 years old. Promise Mae is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Promise Mae owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ready-to-wear (RTW) items and sometimes a variety of fishes in the local community. Promise Mae has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Promise Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Promise Mae is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Promise Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa M. se dedica a su actividad de venta de verduras en el departamento de Managua donde a diario ella ofrece las verduras y son varios los clientes que le visitan para obtener los perecederos. Ella cuenta con una mesa de madera donde coloca tales productos y los ofrece.

La necesidad que la señora María Teresa atraviesa es que requiere de un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las verduras como cebollas, chayotes, ajo, naranjas, entre otros, y por tal motivo es que espera confiadamente para así mejorar las condiciones de la actividad y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes que  a diario le visitan para adquirir los perecederos.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Teresa M. sells vegetables in the department of Managua where she offers them daily to a variety of customers who visit her for perishables. She sells her products from the wood table where she displays them.

The needs of Mrs. María Teresa require a loan so she can invest in the purchase of vegetables like onions, chayotes (vegetable pears), garlic, and oranges, among other things. For this reason, she optimistically hopes she will be able to improve the quality of her business and satisfy the needs of her customers who visit her daily to purchase perishables.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn R. has been into buying and selling household appliances like television sets, DVD players, electric fans, rice cookers and other electronics in her community for almost three decades now. She is a 52-year-old widow living in Marcela, Pasay City with her two children. Customers order from her and she sells these items to them on an installment plan. She started small a few years back, but she’s now getting a lot of orders. She also attends to her small sari-sari (general) store right inside her house. She earns more than 22,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from her businesses. While she enjoys her work, she sometimes gets fed up with customers who don’t pay on time. She also gets tired of hopping from one house to another.

Jocelyn joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. Loans provided by the cooperative have been very helpful in the growth of her business. She is now applying for a new loan of 31,000 PHP as additional capital for her business. Jocelyn wishes to soon establish her own stall where she can sell her items and included in her dreams is a grocery store.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. It is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. CCT serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her electronics sales business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita G. es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 28 años, es soltera, ella se esfuerza por salir adelante.
Margarita se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y néctar al por menor, ella se esfuerza a diario para ampliar su negocio. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de gaseosas para vender en su casa. Ahora Margarita necesita un crédito de 1200 soles que será utilizado en la compra de bebidas refrescantes para vender. La meta de Margarita es  tener una tienda de abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Margarita G. is a hard-working and active woman. She lives in Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 28 years old, single, and works hard to get ahead in life. Margarita sells soft drinks and juice nectars at retail, and strives daily to expand her business. She has been a member of the "Las Divinas" Community Bank for two years. The first loan she received was 300 PEN, which she used to buy soft drinks to sell from her home. Now Margarita needs a loan of 1200 PEN that she will use to buy soft drinks to sell. Margarita's goal is to have a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks at wholesale

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr:
En 2007, cette dame a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle elle fait du commerce de détail, après un an d’activité, elle dispose d’une clientèle considérable, tellement qu'elle doit augmenter son stock pour pouvoir tous les satisfaire. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle s’est adressé à WAGES pour obtenir un crédit et augmenter son stock avec 2 postes télévisions, une machine à laver et 4 baffles.
elle est célibataire et c’est avec son revenu qu’elle subvient à ses charges.
texts.en:
In 2007 this woman opened her own shop in which she exercises a retail activity; after a year of business she has built up a significant customer base, to the extent that she needs to increase her stock in order to satisfy them all. It is for this reason that she has approached WAGES in order to get a loan to increase her stock with two televisions, a washing machine and 4 loudspeakers. She is single and uses her income to cover her expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of televisions, washing machine and loudspeakers

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity sells kerosene. She buys her kerosene from other petrol (gasoline) stations and comes home to sell retail. She has been doing the business for the past eighteen years. This one business has been her source of finance.

Charity lives in Delta State. She is 35 years old and has six children, all in school. She wants her children to have a good education in the future.

Charity needs a loan of N80,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. It will help to boost her business and income. She says thank you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Los Autenticos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los auténticos” esta representado por la señora Amalia Omelia y conformado por 20 socios que van cursando su primer ciclo, la mayoría son D. la misma zona y se conocen bastante bien D. manera que es un grupo unido y solidario por que entre todas se ayudan para que el grupo marche bien, los integrantes  son 15 mujeres y 5 varones. Entre las actividades que realizan podemos mencionar a la atención en su propia licorería, otras se dedican a la venta D. comida, ropa, pan, cosméticos, pollo, empanadas y entre los varones se dedican al servicio D.  la albañilería, transporte en motos y autos. La competencia entre las socias esta realmente muy difícil, especialmente en la venta D. cosméticos y D. pan, pero gracias a su esfuerzo y experiencia salen adelante en sus negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias.  El destino del crédito es poder hacer crecer sus negocios con la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a  generar una mejor ganancia para el mantenimiento D. sus hogares y para poder mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. La mayoría D. las socias son personas, nuevas que ya conocen el producto por lo que se encuentran entusiasmados por el apoyo económico ya que muchos D. ellos tienen grandes proyectos que desean realizar a futuro y saben que si cumplen con sus pagos en forma responsable contaran con el apoyo D. la fundación siempre que lo requieran.
texts.en:
The group “Los Auténticos” (The Authentic Ones) is led by Sra. Amalia and consists of 20 members who are starting their first loan cycle. The majority of the members live in the same area. They know each other fairly well, which will help them become close and work well together as a group, which consists of 15 women and 5 men. Among the retail businesses they operate incluD. selling liquor, food, clothing, bread, cosmetics, chicken, and empanadas. The men are engaged in service businesses involving masonry and transportation by motorcycle and car. The competition encountered by the members is very difficult, especially when it comes to selling cosmetics and bread, but their hard work and expertise allows them to advance their businesses. The livelihood of their families depends on their success.

The loan will be used to grow their business by acquiring merchandise, supplies, and equipment to help them generate better earnings so that they can maintain their homes and improve the quality of life for their families. Most of the members are new to the Institution, but they are already familiar with loans and excited about receiving financial support since many of them have grand projects that they want to pursue in the future. They know that if they complete their payments in a responsible manner, then they will always have access to the support of the Foundation whenever needed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Ambrosio Irineo

texts.es: El señor Ambrosio Irineo E. es casado con la señora Juanita Elizeth y son una pareja joven pero muy trabajadora, el labora para una empresa como supervisor, y su esposa es enfermera de una fabrica. Ellos son clientes distinguidos de nuestra Institución ya que anteriormente se les otorgo un crédito para mejoramiento de vivienda proyecto que ya fue finalizado, pero nuevamente están tramitando para la colocación de una barrita en el área de su cocina.
texts.en:
Ambrosio Irineo E. is married to Juanita Elizeth; they are a young, hard-working couple. He is employed as a supervisor and she is a nurse in a factory. They are distinguished clients of our intitution in that they were granted a prior loan which was used for home improvements. They have repaid it and are requesting new funding to build a little wall in their kitchen area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a little wall in the kitchen area.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann B. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Mary Ann is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns & operates a business providing sing-along services to local community members. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP that will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Ann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: Pablo Ramón

texts.es:
El cliente pablo ramón L. C.vive en la comarca el barro municipio Achuapa se dedica principal mente a la ganadería este es el segundo crédito con nuestra institución CEPRODEL-El sauce, dicho crédito fue destinado para la compra de 2 ternero de desarrollo con el objetivo de mejorar su hato ganadero.
Los ternero lo realiza primordialmente con el objetivo de elaborar una yunta de bueyes el cual le permitirá el desempeño de su trabajo.   
El cliente cuenta con 3 hijos a su cargo y su esposa, 2 hijo están en la universidad y 1 en la primaria y su esposa copera con las actividades que se desempeñan.
texts.en:
Our client Pablo Ramón L. C.lives in the region of El Barro, Achuapa Municipality. He works primarily raising cattle. This is his second loan with our institution, CEPRODEL-El Sauce. This loan will be used to buy 2 calves with the goal of improving his herd.

He buys calves with the objective of creating a team of oxen, which will allow him to work. He and his wife have three children in their care; two are in university and one in primary school. His wife supports and helps him with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 2 calves for a team of oxen

loans.name: Delmi Marbeli

texts.es:
la sra. Delmi Marbeli U. M. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de Golosinas, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación desde hace once años,  es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar ya que sus condiciones de vida son favorables.
También nos comento y nos dimos cuanta a la vez de que ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de las compañías AVON, ARABELLA, ZELSA.
Delmi se ha sabido ganar la clientela por la atención que les brinda, el local es de un ambiente muy agradable e higiénico.
Delmi es casada pero su esposo emigro para USA en busca de mejores condiciones de vida y Delmi nos comento que las remesas que recibe de su esposo han sido para mejorar su casa de habitacion, en la cual viven con sus 2 hijos, ellos ambos jóvenes cursando sus estudios secundarios. 

Doña Delmi, utilizara el  crédito para comprar: refrescos, platos, verduras, carnes etc.
texts.en:
Delmi has been selling snacks out of her home for the past 11 years. It’s evident that she’s been able to manage her business well over the years, as her living conditions have improved. She tells us and we have seen that she also sells products via catalogs, such as Avon, Arabella, and Zelsa. Delmi has been able to gain customers because of the attention she gives them and her place of business has a clean and friendly atmosphere. Delmi is married, but her husband has emigrated to the United States in search of a better life and she tells us that the money she receives from him she uses to make improvements to their home. Her two children live with her and both of them are completing junior high school. She will use the money from this loan to buy soft drinks, plates, vegetables, meats, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en: Mrs. Chroeb P. is 38 years old and lives in Rung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Reang Mok, are farmers who own a 3-hectare field for growing rice to sell. Mrs. Chroeb P. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine, fertilizer, pesticide, and to hire a plowing laborer for the rice farm. Aside from farming, Mr. Reang Mok is a construction worker, earning a small income to help support the family. The couple has four children; one is seamstress in a garment factory, two are students in the local school, and the youngest is still a baby.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine, fertilizer, pesticide, and labor for their rice farm.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: LA SRA. BENITA ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA SE ENCUENTRA EN (DECIMA SECUENCIA),  HA MOSTRANDO RESPONSABILIDAD   EN LOS PAGOS DE SUS CREDITOS, ELLA TIENE LA DETERMINACION DE LLEGAR A VENDER POR MAYOR, ES EMPRENDEDORA, EL PUESTO DE VENTA  SE  ENCUENTRA EN LA POPULOSA  ZONA DE LA 12 DE OCTUBRE,LA SEÑORA SE ESFUREZA POR SUPERARSE YA QUE TRABAJA DESDE LA MADRUGADA HASTA QUE SE PONE EL SOL, EL ESPOSO DE DOÑA BENITA ES PANADERO QUIEN DE IGUAL FORMA TRABAJA TODO LOS DIAS DE LA SEMANA YA QUE EL PRODUCTO QUE EL REALIZA ES DE PRIMERA NESECIDAD, EL  APOYA ESE SUEÑO DE CONVERTIRSE EN  UNA EMPRESARIA, EL MAYOR ANHELO DE LA CLIENTA ES DE TENER UN NEGOCIO QUE REALIZE ENTREGAS AL POR MAYOR DE SUS PRODUCTOS QUE OFRECE COMO DULCES, GALLETAS, ETC. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA AL PO MAYOR PARA LUEGO ENTREGAR A LOS CLIENTES QUE LE HICIERON PEDIDOS, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Benita is married and has three schoolaged children. She is an old client who is in her tenth cycle. She has shown herself to be responsible with the loan payments. She is determined to sell wholesale and she is enterprising. Her store is in a populated area of 12 de Octubre. She is making an effort to get ahead, and she works from the very early morning until sunset. Benita's husband is a bread baker who works every day of the week as well, since his product is a basic necesity. He supports her dream of becoming a businesswoman. The client's biggest wish is to have a business that makes wholesale deliveries of the products she offers, such as: candies, cookies, etc. With the money from the loan, she will buy merchandise wholesale in order to deliver to customers that have ordered from her. She is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust they have put in her by granting her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “KILLA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.
