Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Flor,  ella tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad, la socia tiene un restaurante y ella trabaja de administradora y de cajera y a veces moza, nuestra socia es una mujer decidida y muy emprendedora, ella solicita el préstamo para mejorar su restaurante y también comprar cubiertos. 
   
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the “KILLA” Communal Bank. She lives in the Huanchas district in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Our member is named Mrs. Flor. She is 26 years old and has 2 children, one who is 7 and the other who is 5. She owns and manages a restaurant as well as works as a cashier and at times a waitress. She is a determined and very enterprising. She is requesting the loan to improve her restaurant and buy silverware.

She is very thankful for and appreciates the support offered through this resource and commits herself to repay her loan in the required payments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her restaurant ind buy silverware

loans.name: Sasa

texts.en:
Sasa L. is 23 and married with one child. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale and has one year of experience in this business.

Sasa needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone. She plans to use the earnings from her business, estimated to be 300 talas (approximately USD 120) per week, to improve and expand her business.

In 2010, Sasa joined SPBD and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.


About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join  SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene S. is a 43 year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: general store, Buy & Sell and piggery businesses. She lives in Purok 5, Barangay Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, Buy & Sell and Piggery businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 15,000. Arlene is now borrowing PHP 28,000 so that she could buy stock for the general store. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Arlene aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun S. is 55 years old and lives in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2.6 hectares of land, where she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Sophat Phann, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. In order to support her farm, Mrs. Noeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline. This couple has two children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other is a student at the local school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela lives in a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.  She is 41 years old and has struggled financially all through her life. Her husband is 60 years old and can’t work to earn income for the family. She is the mother of three sons; two of them work to financially support the family. 

Jameela makes handmade fans on order to share the financial burden of her family. These fans are famous in rural areas specifically because they face a shortage of electricity.   

She has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah for her son. With the loan he will buy bicycle spare parts and repair tools for his bicycle spare parts and repair shop. 

 Jameela hopes that working with Asasah for her family’s better future will be a good experience for her.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and repair tools for a bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 59 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y su hija que es casada y tiene una hija aún pequeña. El negocio a la que se dedica es la venta de juguetes y demás accesorios de acuerdo a las campañas o festividades que se presentan, en este casi están en fiestas patrias. Su puesto es alquilado y se encuentra ubicado en el interior de un mercado, que es el más concurrido de su distrito. Todas las ventas son al contado, es por ello que su trabajo se basa en la cordialidad y la mejor atención, de esa manera realiza muy buenas ventas. Lleva 6 años trabajando en esta actividad, donde se siente muy feliz; ya que también le da trabajo a hija en el negocio, para que le ayude en las ventas. Su mayor anhelo es terminar de construir su puesto en otro mercado para después trasladarse y de ese modo mejorar su negocio. Es el veinteavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete  en pagar oportunamente sus cuotas, ya que sabe que este aporte le será de mucha utilidad para el progreso de su negocio. Con este crédito que solicita, piensa incrementar su negocio con la compra de escarapelas, boinas, guantes, escarpines, ponches, para la temporada de fiestas patrias.
texts.en:
Martha is 59 years old and she lives in her own home together with her husband and their daughter, who in turn has a little girl of her own. Her business is toy sales, adjusting the items she carries according to the time of year and special national holidays. The stand she occupies is rented space. It is located in the market, the most visited market in the district. All her sales are finalized in cash only. She pays special attention to cordiality and customer service, which is why her sales are always so good. She has been at this business for the past 6 years and she loves doing what she does. She is able to employ her daughter as help to carry out sales. Her greatest dream is to finish building a stand in a different market so that they can move their business. This is the 20th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making her payments on time. She knows that this help has been crucial for the development of her business. This loan will be used to supplement her merchandise by purchasing ribbons, hats, gloves, boots, and ponchos to prepare for the national holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items to sell during the national holidays.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace Y. is currently in the business of selling bread, fried sweet potatoes and groundnut paste at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of local Sudanese ful (fava) beans to sell.  Grace is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has four children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock bags of local Sudanese ful beans to sell

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Johanna de 23 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. Tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Hace unos meses atrás comenzó con su tienda de vivieres ya que por su sector no había, poco a poco la ha venido surtiendo con aceites, arroz, bebidas etc. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo atendiendo en las tardes la tienda. 

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo aceite, arroz y bebidas. En el futuro quiere tener una despensa de vivieres, y mejorar su casa y que es de ladillos.
texts.en:
Johanna is 23 years old and lives in the periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil, an area known for its mountainous roads. She has a small store that is set up in the front of her house.

A few months ago she started her general store since this type of business did not exist in her area. Johanna gradually stocked her business with oil, rice, beverages, and other products. She works with the help of her husband, who manages the store in the afternoons.

In order to restock her business, Johanna will use this loan to buy oil, rice, and beverages. In the future, she wants to open a food pantry and make improvements to her brick house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, rice, and beverages

loans.name: Kalandar

texts.ru: Ашуров Каландар житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 54 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Сын на заработках в России. Сам Каландар имеет среднее образование. Более 30 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить количество скот.
texts.en:
Kalandar A. lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 54 years old, married, and has three children. His son works in Russia. Kalandar has a high school education. For more than thirty years, he has been working in animal husbandry. He raises cattle at his home. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle to increase his herd.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica N. is a 43-year old married woman who supports her family by fattening and selling pigs. She lives on Borraska Street in Poblacion barangay, a part of Santa Fe on the island of Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 PHP.

Veronica is borrowing 29,500 PHP so that she can continue funding her business. This will be her nineteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Veronica aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es:
EDGAR ANTONIO C. S., Trabajo como Higienista en el mercado Oriental Managua.
Va a utilizarlo la plata la va a utilizar en el mejoramiento de vivienda de su casa de habitación, cambio de techo para su hogar
texts.en:
Mr. Edgar Antonio C. S. is a sanitation worker at the Oriental Market in Managua. 

He will use the loan to make home improvements (to change the roof).

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi lives in a small city called Kot Radha Kishen which is located in Punjabi, Pakistan, famous for its agriculture and dairy industry. She lives there in a 2 room brick house with her family. She moved here 15 years ago.  She is 44 years old, married to M. N. and a mother of 4 daughters. Allah Rakhi is aware of the importance of education but unfortunately, she couldn’t educate her children due to financial constraints.

Her husband is a private entrepreneur and involved in an animal sales business. He buys animals from animal markets on cheaper rates, raises them up and sells them to butchers. He has been doing this business for over 10 years and it is working well for him. 

Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy young animals and improves his   sales. Allah Rakhi is hopeful that an investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position and help him to improve the financial condition of his family. 

Allah is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit rating and never missed ameeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Allah Rakhi.

loans.use: To buy animals for an animal sales business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Esther has a business of selling sugar canes, which she has had for two years. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar canes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  

In the future, Esther hopes to own a retail shop. Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: Sugar canes

loans.name: Charlito

texts.en:
Charlito L. is from the village of Anakan, Gingoog City. He is 48 years old. Charlito is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Charlito owns & operates a business venture in the services sector running a transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. Charlito has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Charlito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlito is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Charlito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to maintain service

loans.name: Maali

texts.en:
Maali is a young woman who is married to Nael and the mother of four daughters and four sons. Maali and her husband own a shisha (an oriental tobacco pipe) place. Maali took out a loan from FATEN to buy a large amount of shisha supplies and coffee to sell and increase their profit. The store is located in the heart of the city and attracts a good number of clients. That's why the increased stock would improve the family's finances.

Maali's husband, Nael, appears in the picture here as Maali is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To purchase large amounts of nuts and coffee

loans.name: Kanybek

texts.en:
Kanybek T. was born and raised in the Republic of Tajikistan. He grew up in a large family and, from early childhood, he helped his parents in the household. 

In 1997, Kanybek moved with his family to Kyrgyzstan. Using the money they had earned, his family bought a house and Kanybek started to work at the local state farm as a driver. In 2004, he got married and became the father of three children. To find additional means of subsistence for his family, Kanybek decided to engage in cattle breeding. Using his starting capital of 6,000 KGS, he managed to raise his floating capital and earn 12,000 KGS monthly. 

Today, his farm has three calves and two milk cows and still needs to be developed. Kanybek, therefore, plans to use this loan of 60,000 KGS to increase the number of cattle on his farm. Eventually, Kanybek plans to provide higher education for his children and to build a house for his family. As a very purposeful and positive person, Kanybek works hard to support his family and provide them with a prosperous future.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.
Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Juan Domingo

texts.es: Don Juan Domingo Hernández Hernández, es una persona casada, ha cursado el sexto grado primaria, tiene 8 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, él  se dedica a la artesanía confección de pantalones de lona, tiene 10 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de su esposa, para realizar este trabajo de confección lo  ayudan sus hijos para realizar esta actividad. El préstamo el lo utilizará para compra de una maquina industrial plana y así incrementar el volumen de producción. Una de las dificultades de ser, operario  ha sido la falta del capital de trabajo, pero ha salido adelante con la ayuda de sus hijos y espera que su negocio sea más grande y productivo.
texts.en: Don Juan Domingo Hernández Hernández has a sixth grade education.  He is married and has 8 children, all now grown.  He has operated a business making and selling denim trousers for 10 years.  He has the enthusiastic help and support of his wife and his children help him with the business.  He will use this loan to buy machinery so that he can increase his output.  One of the difficulties that he has faced as a business owner is access to working capital.  He has managed to make a success of the business with help from his children, but he wants to expand the business and make it more productive.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

She has operated a business selling building materials for the last eight years, selling from home to her neighbors and orders from house builders. Hellen's major challenge is seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business and sell at wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase ballast. She decided to join Yehu because of the variety of loans that meets the customer’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase ballast.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
With the death of a loved one, a person does not stop living. Mamerta S., age 61, still has something to live for even without her husband at her side any more. Maita, as she is called by fellow community partners in CCT*, reached high school level during her educational years; at present, she devotes her time to running her own small business. She has her seven children to continue living for. Maita’s family resides in Pasay City, Metro Manila.

A sari-sari (variety) store serves as Maita’s main source of income. With it, she strives to meet the immediate needs of her community as she makes every effort to earn income for her family. The store is residential and is thus accessible to the family. Maita has been running a sari-sari store for 25 years now; she did so even when her husband Valentin, also a vendor, was still living. Monthly, Maita earns Php 12,000 on average.

To help her grow her business, Maita loans Php 10,000. She will make good use of the loan by purchasing products that are in demand in their location, such as the vinegar and coal used by some families to prepare their meals. Maita says the loan also enables her to give to family members when an emergency arises. 

The challenge Maita has to face is the selling of products that are not much in demand, such as canned goods. People in her community are not much into buying these goods, as they prefer cooking their own meals. But one good thing is that Maita can focus on making her business efficient, as she currently has no significant personal problems. She desires to make her business more profitable in order to be able to help others. She hopes that her sari-sari store will grow into a grocery, so that she will be able to renovate her commercial space as well as their house. Most of all, she prays that her children will become successful and have their own growing businesses.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase such items as coal and vinegar for retail sale in her shop

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ana; La socia tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos, (20,17); la socia es comerciante minorista, la socia vende productos de belleza por catálogos, ella tiene un pequeño almacén en casa en el cual ella almacena los productos de belleza que la socia compra en oferta para después de un tiempo poderlos ofrecer a un poco mas y como deja en dos partes el producto, las clientes que tiene le compran; la socia también viaja y trae ropa de la cuidad de Lima, ella vende todo tipo de ropa; La socia requiere el crédito para comprar ropa y productos de belleza para la venta. La socia ahora solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de ropa y la compra de productos en oferta.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ana, 51, is a member of the “AMAUTA” communal bank that’s located in Urubamba District, Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She’s married and has two children who are 20 and 17 years of age.  She is a Retailer.  She sells beauty products via catalogue.  She has a small warehouse at home where she stores the beauty items she buys on sale which after some time she resells at a slightly higher price and, because she collects payments in two parts, her customers buy from her.  She also travels and brings clothes from Lima.  She sells all types of clothes.  She needs this loan to buy clothes and beauty products to sell.  She is requesting the loan to buy clothes and beauty products that are on sale.

She is satisfied with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion

loans.use: to buy clothing on sale.

loans.name: Roque Gilberto

texts.es:
Roque de 63 años, es un hombre trabajador que empezó su actividad con poca  mercadería y le gusto que abrió una mini tienda.

El inicia su trabajo diariamente de 7:00 am a 9:00 pm. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, fideos para aumentar su productividad en su tienda. Lo que más anhela de su trabajo es sacar adelante su negocio para así mejorar su casa y ponerse un comedor mas adelante.
texts.en:
Roque, 63, is a hard working man who started out in business with very little merchandise but liked it and opened a minimart.  His daily work schedule is from 7am until 9pm.  

He wants to use the loan to buy rice, oil and noodles to increase his store’s productivity.  What he wants most is that the business succeeds in order to make some home improvements and later on set up an eatery.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and oatmeal.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia L. C. es una mujer que vive en Cartagena de Indias, ciudad amurallada, colonial y turística; en este ambiente de playa, brisa y mar,  Claudia  tiene varios negocios; ella inició en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace alrededor de 15 años y ha recibido 22 financiamientos, su primera actividad vinculada fue una pequeña venta de mercancías mediante catálogos, o guías especializadas de productos, pero inspirada por la actividad de sus padres,  que también formaban parte de los programas de la Fundación, adicionó a su actividad la venta de refrescos como cervezas  en un pequeño enfriador, que aún conserva y también agregó la producción de congelados, actividades que aún siguen generándole ingresos  y con las que sueña  hacerlas crecer cada día más para continuar aumentando su calidad de vida. En la actualidad su pequeño enfriador no se encuentra en condiciones óptimas y ella necesita reemplazarlo rápidamente, por eso recurre a su credikiva con el cual comprará un nuevo enfriador, para  pasar de la venta de cerveza a l detalle, a proveer en mayor cantidad a las tiendas y otros establecimientos. Su sueño es comprar su casa propia, porque en la actualidad vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes siempre la han apoyado en cada uno de los propósitos de su vida.
texts.en: Claudia L. C. is a woman who lives in Cartagena de Indias, a walled in, colonial and tourist city. In this ambience of beach, breezes and ocean, Claudia has several businesses. She started in the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo more than 15 years ago and has received 22 loans. Her first activity was realted to a small business selling merchandise via catalogues, or specialized product guides. Then, inspired by her parents activities, also a part of the Foundation's programs, she added the activity of selling beverages such as beer from a small cooler. She still has the cooler and has added making frozen food. These activities continue generating her income and she dreams of making them grow more every day to continue improving her quality of life. At present, her small freezer is not in the best condition and she needs to replace it soon. That is why she is turning to Kiva loans to buy a new cooler to go from small scale beer selling to providing a larger quantity for stores and other establishments. Her dream is to buy her own house, because at present she lives in her parent's house. They have always supported her in all of the things she has done in life.

loans.use: to buy a cooler

loans.name: Josianne

texts.en: Josianne is 32 years old.  She has 5 children who are between 2 and 15 years old. Her husband  has a motorcycle which he uses for business.  Josianne sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as sweet potatoes, irish potatoes and beans.  She has been doing this business for 11 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs. With her profits she plans to buy home equipment and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
Hace 2 años, a raíz de la separación con su esposo Maria Nelly decidió montar su propio negocio en compañía de su hermana, elaborando, vendiendo y distribuyendo comida por los barrios cercanos a su vivienda ubicada en la ciudad de Medellín, departamento de Antioquia. Ella es reconocida entre sus vecinos por tener una buena sasón al momento de realizar las diferentes recetas.

 

Maria Nelly elabora los alimentos y su hermana se encarga de llevarlos a domicilio en una bicicleta, sistema que les ha impedido tener puntualidad al momento de entregar los pedidos, su negocio les ha generado hasta ahora bueno ingresos, pero saben que para que éste sea cada vez más grande y les genere mayores utilidades necesitan otro medio para transportar los productos, por lo que han ahorrado dinero algún tiempo para invertirlo en una moto, sin embargo aún no les es suficiente, y necesitan un préstamo para dicha inversión puesto que cada vez son más sus clientes y proporcionalmente sus pedidos. 

 

Maria Nelly y su hermana sueñan algún día con tener un negocio reconocido no sólo en su barrio y sectores aledaños si no también en el resto de la ciudad, donde puedan distribuir sus productos, y atender todo tipo de eventos especiales.
texts.en:
Two years ago, after separating from her husband, Maria Nelly decided to open her own business with her sister making selling, and distributing food in the nearby neighborhoods in the city of Medellín, departament of Antioquia. She is well known among her beighbors for being a good cook while trying new recipes. 
 
Maria Nelly makes the food and her sister is in charge of delivering them door to door on her bicycle. This system has impeded them from having punctual deliveries. They know that for this to grow and to make more income, they need another way to transport the products. They have been saving their money for awhile to invest in a motorcycle, but it has not been enough. They need a loan for this investment to have more and more customers and orders.  

Maria Nelly and her sister dream of having a business one day that is known not only in their neighborhood, but in the rest of the city, where they can distribute their product and cater all types of events.

loans.use: to buy a motorcyle to transport product.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Carmen works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming bananas. Carmen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

Carmen has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

loans.name: Tiemprokotie  1 Group

texts.fr:
TIEMPROKOTIE  1  est un regroupe de femmes mariées du village de MORIBILA MANKAN  dans la préfecture de SAN, région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, au moins 6 enfants et cultivent essentiellement de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne.
SALI, qui a l’enfant à côté, utilisera son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles  pour la culture,  au grand marché de Kimparana ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana, de MORIBILA et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 65 000 à 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Teimprokotie 1 is a group of married women from the village of Moribila Mankan in the San prefecture in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are, on average, 36 years old with at least six children each, and they mainly grow peanuts.

Wanting to make their farming operations profitable, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program four years ago. After having duly repaid their preceding loans, they are on their fourth farming loan.

Sali, standing beside her child, will use her loan to buy a sufficient amount of peanuts to plant, small tools and equipment, and other planting supplies at the large market in the city of Kimparana. After the rainy season, the harvest is stockpiled for some time in order to increase its value. Then it will be sold retail (often wholesale) at the big market in Kimparana, in Moribila, and in surrounding markets on cash basis to customers mainly from large cities.

After selling their harvests, the group members each plan to make a profit between 65,000 and 95,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay back interest on the loan and for daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy planting supplies, seed, and small equipment.

loans.name: Paola Maria

texts.es:
Paola de 30 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Es separada y tiene tres hijos que estudian en escuela fiscales. Su negocio es la venta de comida.

Después de su separación ella decidió abrir su negocio de ventas de comidas para solventar los gastos del hogar. Labora sola diariamente desde las 6H00 am en la elaboración de los almuerzos y eso del medio día empieza sus ventas. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar utensilio para su negocio como vajillas, vasos y demás instrumentos. En un futuro dese expandir su negocio a provincias.
texts.en:
Paola is 30 years old, lives in Duran Spring (the city boundary was originally irregular with various hills, streams, and lagoons which are remains of a deteriorating ecosystem). She is separated and has three children who attend public school. She sells food for her business. 
After her separation she decided to start selling food to pay for house payments. She begins working on her own at 6 am to make meals and by midday begins selling them. She plans on using the loan to buy utensils for her business such as dishes, cups, and other supplies. In the future she would like to expand her business to other provinces.

loans.use: buy utensils for her business such as dishes, cups, and other supplies to sell food.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a housewife who stays at her home and does her household responsibilities. She is still very active at the age of 56 and performs her duties very efficiently. 

Her husband is a retired government employee.  She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her eldest child is a driver and operates a motor workshop. The second child is an electrician by profession and her daughter stays at home and helps Nazeeran in her routine tasks. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who wants to expand his motor workshop business. With the loan, he will buy car batteries and some repair tools. He started this business five years ago and it is working well for him. 
 
Nazeeran hopes that an investment will help her son improve his business and that she will be able to collect some dowry for the marriage of her daughter with the increased profits.

loans.use: To buy car batteries and some repair tools

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Amelia, es socia del banco comunal Las Orquídeas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 61 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijos mayores e independientes.  Su primer préstamo fue de gran ayuda para comenzar a trabajar.
Son siete años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, brinda  servicio de costura de prendas de vestir, trabajo que realiza en su propia casa.  En este negocio lleva ya mucho tiempo, todavía le queda dos hijos por educar y tiene que trabajar para poder costear sus gastos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 máquina nueva, 1 pisador de máquina, 1 aceite y 1 correa para máquina.
Al quedarse viuda ha tenido que asumir todos las obligaciones y  responsabilidades de  la crianza de sus hijos, desde ahí ha tenido que trabajar para poder sacarlos adelante.  Ella está muy contenta porque sus hijos le han sabido agradecer.  Si trabaja ahora es porque desea hacerlo, con ello se siente bien.
texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the communal bank "Las Orquideas", meaning "The Orchids", located in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 61 years old, a widow, and she has two grown and independent children. Her first loan was a great help in starting up a business.

She has been working with loan from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for the past seven years. She provides sewing services, crafting articles of clothing. She works from her own home. She has been in business for a long time and she still has two children who are still in school. She needs to work to be able to cover their expenses.

Her new loan is in the amount of S/1000 nuevos soles and with it she will purchase: 1 new sewing machine, 1 sewing machine presser foot, 1 oil dispenser, and 1 sewing machine belt.

When she was widowed she was needed to assume all of the obligations and responsibilities associated with raising her children. Since them she has needed to work to provide for them. She is very happy because her children have been grateful. She works now only because she wants to and she is content with this.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and sewing machine oil.

loans.name: Las Elegidas Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento "LAS ELEGIDAS" se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco de Emprendimiento esta representado por las siguientes socias la Presidenta la señora Janeth quien convive con su pareja ya bastante tiempo, la Sra. Janeth se dedica a la venta de ropa de temporada su pareja es albañil contratista, tienen 2 hijos pequeños, que necesitan cuidados, la Sra. se dedica a vender y también a cuidar a sus hijitas, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería por mayor ropa de temporada y así  incrementar su capital, vive en  alquiler zona Valle Hermoso, es una persona muy trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The venture bank "LAS ELEGIDAS" ("THE CHOSEN WOMEN") is in its second lending cycle.  It is made up of responsible and hard-working women.   This venture bank is represented by the following member: the President, Señora Janeth, who has been living with her ​​partner for quite some time.   Señora Janeth works selling seasonal clothing, and her partner is a construction contractor.  They have two small children who need to be looked after.  The Señora makes her sales, and also cares for her small daughters.  With the money from the loan, she will buy merchandise of additional seasonal clothing and thereby increase her capital.

She lives in a rental in the Valle Hermoso (Beautiful Valley) area.  She is a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support being offered.

loans.use: to buy merchandise of additional seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Soriano

texts.en:
At age 45, Soriano has four school-age children, and his oldest child is already beginning a college-level education. Soriano is a farmer, and his wife is a housekeeper. He works hard and strives just to feed his family and to provide a good quality of life.

Soriano has operated his hog raising business for almost five years, but it is not steady because of a lack of financial resources. For this reason, Soriano is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy piglets to raise. He wants his hog raising business to be a stable business aside from farming and to be able to fulfill his responsibility to his family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina tiene 57 años, está casada con Jose de 60 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Ella emprendio un nuevo negocio, que es la venta de abarrotes, negocio que lo tiene en pequeño espacio de su casa. En un comienzo no le fue tan bien el negocio pues no contaba con mucha clientela pero la paciencia y la perseverancia logró mantenerse en este trabajo, además utiliza la táctica de ofrecer su productos a un precio muy cómodo y acompañado de cordialidad y atención han hecho que se gane clientes. A pesar de que ella y su pareja tiene un Bar – Recreo, en donde le permite tener otros ingresos, sin embargo ella está entusiasmada en seguir apostando en el negocio que emprendió, porque confía en que más adelante piensa tener su tienda de abarrotes mucho más amplia y completa que la de ahora. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que ella una vez más se compromete en realizar el pago de sus cuotas con regularidad. Ella está contenta por ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos son tenaces y responsables. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles ella comprará más productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en: Justina is 57 years old and is married to Jose, who is 60 years old. They have three children. They live in their own house, which is located in the Pichari District. Justina is learning a new business, selling groceries. Her business is located in a small space in her house. In the beginning her business wasn’t doing very well as she didn’t have very many customers. With patience and perseverance she was able to continue working. She offered her products at a good price and accompanied that with cordial and attentive service. She is now gaining more customers. In addition, Justina and her husband have a bar with recreational amenities, which provides them with another source of income. Nevertheless, Justina is enthusiastic about continuing with the business that she just started. In the future she hopes to have a store with a greater variety of goods than she has now. This is her second loan with MFP. This is another opportunity to show that she can pay her payments on time. She is happy to be part of this communal bank as everyone is tenacious and responsible. With this loan of 1500 new soles she will buy products in order to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha, 43 years old, sells vegetables, pork and beef at home and earns $3 per day. Her husband, a motor taxi driver, earns $2 per day. This couple has two children; one is working in a factory and earns $2 per day. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her son’s motor taxi service. This family used to do farming but could not make a good income so they changed their career last year. In the future, she wants to open a grocery shop in front of her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son's motor taxi service.

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
Rosa Alicia  tiene 41 años, tiene 5  hijos de veinte, diecinueve, diecisiete, catorce y nueve años de edad. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz,arroz y fréjol gandúl.

Rosa Alicia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol gandúl. Compra y vende los productos en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insumos, urea para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder apoyar a los hijos para que puedan culminar los estudios universitarios.

Le gusta salir a disfrutar de las festividades del recinto y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Rosa Alicia is 41 years old. She has 5 children who are 20, 19, 17, 14 and 9 years old, and she lives with her partner and her children.  The 'San José de los Amarillos' community bank is located in Amarillos community, in Ventanas canton. Its members work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and peas.

Rosa Alicia is a farmer who grows corn, rice and peas. She buys her products in the Murillo shopping area where she also sells them. She is asking for this loan to buy seeds, fertilisers, supplies and urea for her crops. The support of this loan will help her to cover her financial needs. She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather. Her dream is to be able to support her children through university. She likes playing sport and going out to enjoy local festivities.

loans.use: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insumos, urea para los cultivos

loans.name: Tunyo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tunyu Group in Western Kenya! This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Priscilla is the facilitator of the group. She takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to ensure food security for her family and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Priscilla had a very good maize yield harvesting fifteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Priscilla was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Priscilla and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Priscilla will invest in animal rearing and educate her children.
In 2012, the members of Tunyu Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
Priscilla is pictured in the above photograph together with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Roderic

texts.en:
Being a father, Roderic is responsible for feeding his family and for supporting the education of his children. Likewise, Roderic aims to improve their status of living and give his family a better life. He is now 36 years old and has two school-age children. As a way of gaining income, he is engaged in a vegetable production business in their village. He has been in this business for almost 15 years and usually earns a profits of P9,000 a month that he utilizes for their basic necessities. 

He aims to plant more of a variety of vegetables to increase his yields and income, but due to financial difficulty, he is asking for an additional P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his vegetable production. He hopes that through patience and hard work he can be able to improve the business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable production.

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rakey

texts.en: Rokey (shown in the photo) sells chickens and ducks that she buys from her villagers, transporting them to sell in a market approximately three kilometers from her house. Her husband, Mat, is a fisherman, and they have eight children - six sons and two daughters. Rokey is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to assist in her husband’s fishing business by buying new fishing nets and a boat.

loans.use: to assist in her husband’s fishing business by buying new fishing nets and a boat.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La socia sigue con su negocio propio de compra y venta de cosmeticos por catalogos, ella sigue trabajando y le va muy bien, la socia trabja en esto desde hace 15 años y como promotora de belleza le han dado muchos regalos por el desempeño que puso y continua haciendo de este negocio una empresa personal, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de cosmeticos como esmaltes de uñas, lapiz labiales, perfumes, cremas y otros. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza para teneren su stock.
texts.en: The member continues buying and selling cosmetics through catalogue and business is going well.  She has been in this activity for fifteen years and as a beauty saleswoman has received many gifts for her hard work.  She wants to use the loan to buy cosmetics such as nail polish, lipstick, perfumes, creams and other items to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics such as nail polish, lipstick, perfumes, creams and other items.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Tumaini group. Moses and his group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Moses takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Moses was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Moses will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Tumaini group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.
In the photograph above, Moses is pictured with his group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a fish monger at Besease near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has four children. She has been a fish monger for the past ten years. Efua assists her husband in the upkeep of their children. She will use her loan to purchase more fish for sale. Efua will expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, quienes le ayuda a realizar la venta en el negocio, José administra una tienda desde hace 10 años donde ofrece productos todos de la canasta básica como por ejemplo sodas, agua, jugos, embutidos, huevos entre otros de sus vecinos le demanda.
Actualmente el comprar a más mercadería por esto solicita un préstamo para cubrir el gasto en adquisición de jugos, gaseosas, gatorade, refrescos, agua, entre otros, su inventario será mejor y tendrá mejor preferencia de sus clientes.
El quiere mejorar económicamente, por eso se refugia en préstamos pequeños para poco a poco ir creciendo y mejorar su condición.
texts.en:
41-year old José lives with his wife and three children who all help in his store. For ten years now he has run a stall selling basics such as soft drinks, water, juice, cold meats, and eggs--whatever his customers ask for.

Now José wishes to buy more merchandise, so he is seeking a loan to cover the cost of these items. He is planning to buy juices, pop, Gatorade, soft drinks, water etc. He will have more choice to offer his customers who will choose him over his competitors.

José wants to improve his financial situation so he has decided to take out small loans which will enable him to expand the business gradually and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy juices, pop, Gatorade, soft drinks, water etc.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married to a farmer and has 5 children. Ekua sells secondhand clothes at Brasi near Abura which she has done for 2 years. Ekua uses her income to assist the husband to care for their children. Ekua will use the loan to purchase secondhand clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further her education.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Otgonjargal is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is employed, her elder two kids are college students and her younger two are school students. Otgonjargal operates a water distribution business. She started her business in 1990. She runs a well. Her well is fairly profitable. However, her equipment is broken. Therefore, she's requesting 1,150,000 MNT to buy necessary equipment. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "It has been horrible since my business gone down. I have to act aggressive in order to pay my children's college fee".

loans.use: To buy necessary equipment

loans.name: Luisa Veronica

texts.es: Luisa Verónica tiene 40años de edad, es una persona asalariada en el cual se desempeña como secretaria ejecutiva de una empresa, su mayor sueño es de acondicionar su vivienda pero no ha tenido muchos recursos para poder  hacerlo debido a que el poco salario que devenga no le permite acondicionarla. Luisa Verónica está solicitando financiamiento para acondicionarla en lo cual comprara con el préstamo perlines y zinc entre otros.
texts.en: Luisa Verónica is 40 years old.  She works for a salary, as an executive secretary.  Her biggest dream is to do up her home.  However, she hasn't had enough resources to do this owing to the low salary that she earns.  Luisa Verónica is requesting a loan so that she can do up her home.  She will use her loan to buy beams, sheets of metal roofing, etc.

loans.use: to buy beams and sheets of metal roofing, etc.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es: Cinthia es madre de una niña discapacitada, por esta razón debe trabajar desde su casa, ella compra plata y otros metales para fabricar bisutería cuya clientela es mayormente los comercios  de la ciudad donde vive, también vende el producto directamente a las personas que llegan a adquirirlo hasta su hogar. Debido a los tratamientos y medicamentos especiales de alto costo que debe estar dándole a su hija, ella necesita incrementar sus ventas y ha pensado hacerlo a través de la web, para esto solicita un préstamo de un millón ciuarenta mil colones (¢1.040.000) con este dinero comprará "plata" y otros metales con los que elaborará bisutería de calidad, y le generará mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Cinthia is the mother of a disabled child and for this reason must work from home. She buys silver and other metals for making costume jewelry, and her clientele is mainly businesses in the city where she lives. She also sells the product directly to people who come to her home to buy it. 

Due to the treatments and special high-cost medicines that she must give her daughter, she needs to increase her sales and has thought of doing so through the web. For this, she is requesting a loan of 1,040,000 colones. With this money she will buy silver and other metals to use in making her quality costume jewelry, and this will generate greater income.

loans.use: To buy materials for making costume jewelry.

loans.name: Mariche

texts.en:
Mariche is 40 years old and married with seven children. With four children in school, Mariche works very hard to provide for them.

Mariche runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Mariche has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Mariche would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Salamat

texts.ru: Саламат, 25 лет, замужем, есть ребенок. У Саламат высшее образование, занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход Саламат составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS). Она решила развивать свой бизнес и обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, она хочет накопить на ремонт дома.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Mrs. Itohan A. is a professional hair dresser who obtain her training on hair dressing before she peaked up her business in the year 2004, she is a 25 years old woman married with a child. According to her, the above amount mentioned will enable her expand her business.

loans.use: Hairdressing

loans.name: Faavevela

texts.en: Faavevela is from the village of Safune Savaii. She is married to a young business man from the village of Moataa and they have one kid. She is staying at Moataa but she joined Apia Park center at the beginning of 2005. Joining the program was very good encouragement for her business because at the center meetings all the members and the center manager discuss what, how, and where each member's business is, and discuss putting aside savings for emergencies. She believes that these center meetings instill strength and provide different ideas of things she can do with her own hands and from her own home to earn money to help support her family.

loans.use: Purchase 10 kava bowls.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa has a convenience store and at night she sells hamburgers and salchipapas (dish made out of sausage and potatoes); her husband is a building custodian. With these as their main sources of income they support their two children and two grandchildren who they are responsible for. The store is located in her house, in Río Seco in Ciudad del Alto. She needs the loan to increase the inventory in the store. This is her third credit with Impro, since her good credit record allowes her to take out another loan, which will aid her in increasing the family’s income.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Rosa tiene una tienda de abarrotes y por las noches vende Hamburguesas y salchipapas; el esposo es rentista. Estos son sus principales ingresos para la manutención de sus dos hijos y dos nietos que depende de ella. La tienda esta ubicada en su mismo domicilio, en la zona de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requiere para incrementar mercadería en la tienda. Es el tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le habilita para sacar otro préstamo, misma que le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos familiares.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam T. is 48 years old and is a vendor at an open air market selling handkerchiefs and different kinds of towels. She can typically make up to $9 each day in revenue, while her husband works as a construction foreman and makes about $4/day. T. has four school-aged children who put big pressure on her family’s expense.

Currently, this couple needs a motorcycle to help transport her products faster and easier. She believes this motorcycle is a potential help for her business. She and her family feel grateful and appreciate your kind support.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle to help her transport her products.

loans.name: Lesili

texts.en: S. Lesili is a 61-year-old married woman, and her business is growing and selling peanuts. She is also the mother of five children. Mrs. Lesili is an older woman in her community, and she is very supportive of her hard-working husband. The two of them are working to support not only their family, but also to fund the education of their grandchildren. Twice a week S. brings 20-30 packets of peanuts to the New Market  from which she can make $200 to $300. Mrs. Lesili will use the loan to purchase farming tools such as knives and spades, as well as fertilizer for the peanut plants.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, fertilizers, knives, spade

loans.name: Maxim

texts.en:
Maxim is married and has one daughter, Anastasia. He and his family live in Melitopol, Ukraine. Maxim started his own small venture after his relatives suggested he should try his luck as a market vendor. Today Maxim runs a small business selling children’s clothing and accessories in the central city market. His vending facility has a very favorable location and offers a large assortment of merchandise, which attracts many customers to his kiosk. Maxim believes that financial support from Nadiya Ukraine has helped him boost his sales and grow his business. After three years in operation, his turnover capital is about $2000, his monthly gross income is around $1200, and his monthly net profit is about $300.

Maxim would like a loan of $800 to purchase inventory wholesale for the fall/winter season. He believes this loan will help him further develop his business and get additional income to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz is a single man who lives in Khachmaz region, in the village of Garagurtlu. This 24-year-old man has run this business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $475 to maintain his car for improving his business.

loans.use: To maintain his car

loans.name: Cicih

texts.en: Cicih M. is a 36-year-old woman, who sells chickens to support her family's needs. She cleans the chickens before selling them at the market, earning US$10.5 a day and earns a small profit. Her husband, Muhadis, does not work anymore, so she is the only one who supports the family. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of US$125 to add to her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
The buying and selling of sheep and alpaca wool has always been a good business for Mrs. Fortunata, fighter, mother of two children that she adores and who keep her motoring on. A few years ago, she and her husband mutually agreed to separate and since then she has been in charge of the family, looking out for the wellbeing and security of each one. Mrs. Fortunata acquires her material at the plaza Dominical and Las Mercedes in Juliaca and adds the sheep and alpaca wool to the mix and sells it to a textile company. Her two sons have finished their secondary studies and will now be enrolling in pre-university courses, which will ultimately increase the family’s expenses. She would like to increase her working capital so that she can cover the cost of running the household and the new expenses that will be incurred. Your help will permit this hard-working mother to accomplish her goals.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de compra y venta de lana de oveja y fibra de alpaca siempre le resultó muy rentable para la señora Fortunata madre luchadora de dos hijos, quienes son su adoración y motor que la impulsa a seguir adelante.Hace algunos años en mutuo acuerdo decidió separarse de su esposo, desde entonces quedó a cargo de su familia velando por el bienestar y seguridad de cada uno de sus miembros; doña Fortunata adquiere su mercadería en la plaza Dominical y las Mercedes de la ciudad de Juliaca, luego de reunir una buena cantidad de lana de oveja y fibra de alpaca los vende a una empresa textil.Sus dos queridos hijos ya concluyeron sus estudios secundarios y este año requieren inscribirse a una academia PRE-Universitaria, razón por la cual sus gastos económicos se incrementarán. Para poder cubrir cada una de sus necesidades tiene pensado aumentar el monto de su capital de trabajo, esta inversión le permitirá cubrir todos sus gastos familiares. Vuestra ayuda permitirá el cumplimiento de los objetivos de esta abnegada madre.

loans.use: Increase capital to acquire more wool in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is widow with 2 children, ages 9 and 6 years old. She is a cloth seller who started her business in 2000. Every day, Rehema works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business inventory

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Patricia had dedicated herself to selling food for more than four years. She started as a kitchen assistant, and after seeing that the income was insufficient and that she had the necessary knowledge, she decided to start her own business. It has been prospering.

Patricia is requesting a $250 loan, which she plans to repay with three months, to purchase the ingredients she needs to be ready when the town fair comes and there is more demand for her product. She wants to be prepared with foods and drinks for this two-week event.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Patricia tiene mas de 4 años dedicándose a la venta de comida, ella empezó como ayudante de cocina y al ver que no le alcanzaban sus ingresos, y contar con los conocimientos necesarios decidió poner su propio negocio en el cual ha ido prosperando.

Solicta un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima ya que en los próximos días habrá fiesta en el pueblo y las ventas suben, desea prepararse en comprar insumos y refrescos para este evento que dura dos semanas.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and drinks / Comprar materia prima

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina K. lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan and like many who live there, she raises and sells livestock. She is 27 years old, but despite her youth, she is an experienced entrepreneur. She is not only in the livestock business ― she also has been selling shish kebab at the local bazaar for many years.

Miss K. came to MicroInvest to ask for financial support for her existing livestock business. She is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $825.00 US to purchase a pedigreed bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Siloge

texts.en: Siloge M., 27, is married with three children. She has many years of experience in the taro business. She sells to the villagers and public three days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~140 USD). She has received one previous loan through SPBD; these SPBD loans are Siloge’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. She will use this loan to purchase supplies for her taro plantation, which she operates with her husband.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, pesticides, knives, fertilizer and labor for her taro plantation.

loans.name: Phong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phong Thi N., 57 year old, has been a TYM partner for 6 years, borrowing money for economic development projects. The amount of her borrowing is increasing by year, thanks to successful investments. The family’s income now allows her to diversify the projects’ focuses and buy many home facilities. Her husband is a retiree whose pension is 1,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Their children all have jobs. Identifying the needs for harvester machines in local areas upon the approach of crops, she plans to borrow 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy harvester machines.

The family’s income is 6,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Phòng 57 tuổi, qua 6 năm tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương gia đình chị đã mạnh gian vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế, vòng vốn ban đầu do mức vốn còn thấp nên chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhỏ, các vòng vốn vay được tăng dần theo hàng năm. Thu nhập từ dự án đều được chị đầu tư vào mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi sản xuất và mua sắm trang thiết bị phục vụ trong sinh hoạt. Chồng chị là cán bộ về hưu với mức lương ổn định 1.500.000đ/tháng, các con chị đều có công việc ổn định. Nhận thấy nhu cầu tại địa phương đang rất cần máy vò lúa, nên gia đình chị đã bàn bạc vòng vốn này xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua máy vò phục vụ bà con trong địa phương vào mùa vụ. Thu nhập bình quân 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: to buy harvester machines

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es soltera, vive sola, ya que no tiene esposo, ni hijos. Desde hace 15 años se ha dedicado al negocio de la venta de golosinas, tiene un pequeño puesto por la carretera panamericana donde ofrece sus deliciosas golosinas.Usualmente, trabaja todo el día, ya que si no lo hace no alcanzaría a ganar el dinero suficiente para costear sus gastos. Lo bueno de su trabajo y lo que más le gusta es que ella es su propio jefe y nadie le tiene que decir que es lo que debe de hacer, por otro lado el mantenerse todo el día en su puesto con el frió inclemente de esta zona del país, hace que su trabajo se le haga más difícil.
Quiere forjarse un mejor porvenir, para poder formar una familia en el futuro.
Con el dinero solicitado quiere tener un puesto más grande y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos para en el futuro tener una tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Nancy is single. She lives alone as she has neither spouse nor children. For the past 15 years she has been selling candy. She has a small stand by the Panamerican Highway where she offers her delicious candies. Usually she works all day as on the contrary she would not have enough money to cover her expenses. The good thing about her job, and what she likes the most, is to be her own boss and have nobody to tell her what to do. On the other hand staying at the stand all day in the harsh cold of that area of the country makes her job more difficult.

She wishes to create a better future to be able to form a family.

With the loan requested she wishes to extend her stand and thus improve her income in order to set up a grocery store in the future.


Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Extend candy stand and increase the variety of products.

loans.name: Señor De Liwirco Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Señor de Luwirco se ubica en la provincia de Huancavelica en el departamento del mismo nombre. Esta comunidad tiene zonas turísticas con aguas termales. Su actividad principal es la ganadería, agricultura y el comercio.

Haydee M. es casada, tiene 5 hijos. Haydee se dedica a la venta de joyas, ropa, y cosméticos por catalogo, estas ventas son por campañas. Su sueño res terminar de construir su casa.

José María R., es casado y tiene 5 hijos, es protesista dental, especialista en salud oral, de lo cual se siente orgullos. Aunque es liciado por una complicación, José María se siente una persona normal. Quiere invertir su prestamos en la compra de materiales y renovar sus equipos e instrumentos dentales. Su sueño es concluir sus estudios profesionales de Cirujano Dentista.

Carmen R., es conviviente, se dedica a la venta por catalogo de cosméticos, también realiza decoraciones de tortas, Carmen dice ser mil oficios. Ahora con su préstamo quiere implementar una tienda de regalos.
texts.en:
The Community Bank Señor De Luwirco is located in the province of Huancavelica in the department (like a state) of the same name. This community is a tourist zone with hot springs. Their principal activities are livestock, agriculture, and commerce.

Haydee M. is married with 5 children. Haydee sells jewelery, clothing, and cosmetics by catalog through campaigning (door-to-door sales). Her dream is to finish building her home.

José María R. is married with 5 children and is a prosthetic dentist specializing in oral health, of which he is very proud. Even though he is hampered by a complication, José María feels like a normal person. He wants to invest his loans in the purchase of materials and renovation of his dental equipment and instruments. His dream is to complete his professional studies to be a Dental Surgeon.

Carmen R. is married and works in catalog sales of cosmetics. She also decorated cakes. Carmen is said to be a "jack of all trades." With her loan she wants to open a gift shop.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Community Bank Señor de Luwirco needs a loan of $2150 for thier 14 members to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich V. lives in Ampil Village in the Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Pen Khouv, are farmers. They have two children one of whom is employed in a shoe factory while the other attends the local school. Although Mrs. Pich V. and her family members all work, they still cannot support the family well. Thus, Mrs. Pich V. has decided to request for a loan to buy a cow for breeding which she hopes will increase her standard of living. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa D., the 54-year old mother of eight, is a high school graduate and entrepreneur from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato. 

Duck raising has been her only source of income. She started her project in the year 2000, with 300 ducks. Using a small loan as starting capital, she has slowly gained the trust of her customers, who come from nearby neighborhoods to buy all the eggs and ducks she can produce.

She now employs two workers to help care for her ducks, thereby creating jobs for others while earning money for herself. Josefa is requesting a new loan from CEV to buy feed. With this, she will be able to sustain and improve her business.

CEV helped her buy 350 ducklings in previous loan cycles. This has been very helpful to her and her family, considering that this is their sole means of support. In addition to credit and training, she also gets the insurance that CEV provides to all of its clients.

loans.use: To buy feed for her ducks

loans.name: Rann

texts.en:
Mrs. Rann T. lives in Tumnop Ang village in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Thorn Thoeun, sells firewood. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn little income to support their household. In order to improve their conditions, Mrs. Rann T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding in hopes of increasing her income after she sells her cow.

She is 29-years-old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young and stays at home. Her husband is on the right on the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Heimy Lucía

texts.es:
Heimy es una joven de 26 años de edad que con una muy buena iniciativa, decidió iniciar su negocio de pulpería estableciéndolo en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de León.

Ella inició el negocio con pocos productos pero a medida que vino invirtiendo en él logro salir adelante ofertando mayores cantidades y esto se lo debe gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha permitido la compra de dichos productos para comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Heimy is a 26 year old young woman with very good initiative. She decided to open a general store in her home in León city. She began her business with few products but as she invested in it she was able to expand, offering greater quantities and this is due to the support provided by Ceprodel which has enabled her to buy the products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia M., 49, mother of 5 children, owns a store which is connected to her house. People come to her store to buy their needs. Now, she doesn’t have a husband. She runs her business and raises her children alone. She was a saleslady before in a one of the biggest department stores in Bohol. She was not happy with her previous job. She stopped working and established her own business.

She is asking for a CEVI loan of Php 5,000. She will use the loan to buy more products to sell in her store. She also has a plan of having a bakery. With the help of her daughter who works at ICM, a popular mall in Tagbilaran, she might be able to realize her dreams. She is interested in looking into some other opportunities that could augment their limited income.

CEVI helps Rosalia achieve her dreams. She is provided with credit assistance, training, and the insurance coverage CEVI gives to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth has a fashion home where she makes dresses for her customers.  She also sells tailoring materials and sarongs. She is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She needs a loan of N60,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She says "thanks" to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials

loans.name: Cruz Del Carmen

texts.es: Cruz del Carmen P. D. G. D. 58 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, actualmente resiD. únicamente con su hija en casa propia. Cruz del carmen posee un maquina D. cocer en su casa, con la cuál se encarga D. cocer ropa para niños y personas mayores. Ella trabaja día con día para poder tener una vida digna junto a su hija, es por ello que solicita un préstamo, a través del cuál pueda comprar más telas, ya que ella desea poder hacer camisones para niños y niñas, los cuales se venden muy bien. Cruz del Carmen anhela aumentar las ventas D. su negocio, para D. esta manera poder obtener una vida tranquila con todo lo necesario para ella y su hija.
texts.en:
Cruz del Carmen P. D. G., 58 years old, lives in the municipality of Soyapango, at present with only her daughter in her own house. Cruz del Carmen has a sewing machine at home, with which she undertakes sewing clothes for children and adults. She works every day to be able to have a decent life with her daughter, which is why she is applying for a loan with which she can buy more fabric, since she wants to make nightgowns for boys and girls, which sell very well.
