La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR D. CCOYLLORITY D. YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Yungaqui, Provincia D. Anta, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ubaldina; la socia tiene 52 años; la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales todos sus hijos son independientes; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales, la socia se dedica a la venta D. animales como vacas, toros, la socia también elabora queso, leche, la socia tiene 8 vacas lecheras y ahora ella desea comprar una vaca. La socia se dedica  a la compra y crianza D. animales; la socia comprara una vaca ternera, la socia elabora quesos y leche sacados D. sus mismas vacas; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. vaca. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Taytacha Senor D. Ccoyllority D. Yungaqui". It is located in the district of Yungaqui, in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Ubaldina. She is 52 years old, married, and she has 4 children, two of whom are independent. She buys and sells livestock. She sells livestock such as cows and bulls. She also makes cheese, and milk. She has 8 dairy cows and she now wishes to buy another cow. She buys and raises livestock. She will purchase a calf. she makes cheeses and milk from her own cows. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of another cow.

She is very satisfied and very thankful for the support that is provided to her through this manner. She is committed to making her loan payments at the established frequency.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Domingo tiene 39 años de edad, de profesion Gerente Financiero casado, con dos hermosos hijos, una universitario.
Su esposa es ama de casa, y junto han logrado las mejoras a su vivienda, anteriormente habia hecho prestamo en Afodenic, para la mejora de su casa, luego se retira, por un lapzo de tiempo, lo que a hora desea ampliar parte frontal de la casa, asi como hacer un porton, lo que le resulta el financiamiento por ser de plazos accesibles, logrando equilibrio en sus gastos basicos, como gastos de familia.
Comprara materiales de construccion como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, soldadura, tablas de madera, entre otros que necesite para realizar la obra. Esta contento por dar mejores condiciones de vivienda a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Domingo is 39 years old, by profession a financial manager, married, with two beautiful children, one of them a university student. 

His wife is a housewife, and together they have been making improvements to their living quarters. Previously he had taken out a loan with Afodenic to make improvements to his home, and then withdrew for a period of time. Now what he wishes is to expand the front part of the house, as well as putting in a front door. Thus the loan, with its convenient installments, achieving balance in his basic expenses such as family expenses. 

He will purchase construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron, solder, and wooden boards among other items which he needs to carry out the project. He is happy to be giving better housing conditions to his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for expanding the front part of his living quarters, achieving better conditions for his family.

loans.name: Abed Al Jalil

texts.en:
Abed A. Jalil is a 52-year-old married man. He is the father of four children, who represent his whole life as he describes them.

Abed A. Jalil opened his shop two years ago. He sells chicken and frozen meat. He loves his business a lot, and he works on improving it.

He's not a butcher, and he has no idea how to be. That's why he turned to selling frozen meat and not fresh. His business is welcoming in the area, and you can always find his shop clean, which is the main thing his customers seek.

Abed A. Jalil is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua, in order to buy the necessary merchandise to improve his business for the holy month of Ramadan. This is his second time as a borrower from A. Majmoua. His previous loan was very impressive, and at the same time, he was a borrower in good standing.

He is planning to expand his business more by opening a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary merchandise to improve his business for the holy month of Ramadan.

loans.name: Venchita

texts.en:
Venchita is single with no children. Venchita is 54 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Venchita sells clothes to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more clothes to sell.

Venchita has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Venchita hopes to own a small store selling clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella, age 44, owns and operates a shop that sells canned goods, breads, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 9,000 so as to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale.

She and her husband have four children.

Estrella has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Estrella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es: Maritza del Carmen de 19 años de edad, reside en casa familiar junto a su madre e hija. Maritza es una mujer increíble que a pesar de su corta edad tiene muchas ideas de negocios y mucha energía para ponerlas en marcha. Ella se dedica a los negocios tales como venta de pupusas, ropa y productos de elote. Tiene  5  años de experiencias en este tipo de actividades. Una de los principales negocios es la venta de productos de elote como: tamales, atol, riguas, etc. Gracias a Dios y a su trabajo ha tenido buenos resultados en la venta de dichos productos y  cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para ella su prioridad es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con sus deliciosos productos,  además es muy carismática y amable razón por la cual las personas la prefieren. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios (elotes, azúcar, aceite, sal, etc.), para poder realizar los deliciosos tamales de elote y poder ponerlos a la venta. Ya que de esta forma es como ella se gana la vida y ayuda a salir adelante a su familia. Le ruega a Dios poder lograr su objetivo y tener la oportunidad de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maritza del Carmen, 19, lives in the family home with her mother and daughter.  Maritza is an outstanding woman who, despite her young age, has lots of business ideas and energy to put them into practice.  She’s in such businesses as: pupusa [stuffed corn dumplings], clothes and corn-based products sales.  She has five years’ experience in this type of activities.  

One of her main businesses is the sale of products based on corn: tamales, atol, riguas [sweet corn wrapped in banana leaves and grilled], etc.  Thanks to God and to her work she’s had good results with the sales of said products and she has quite a few customers because her priority is that her customers are satisfied with her delicious products.  Besides, she’s very charismatic and kind which is why people prefer her.

She decided to ask INTEGRAL for this loan to invest in her business purchasing necessary supplies (ears of corn, sugar, oil, salt, etc.) to make the delicious corn tamales and sell them since this is the way she earns a living and helps her family get ahead.  She prays to God that she’ll be able to reach her goal and have the opportunity for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ears of corn, sugar, oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana, de 22 años habita en la comunidad nativa Santa María. Ahí formó su familia junto a Rubén, su esposo desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia. Cuando tenía 14 años, comenzó a asumir responsabilidades, pues esperaba a su primer hijo. Ello la motivó a comenzar por si sola un negocio donde puede obtener el soporte económico para su familia. La agricultura, actividad que formó desde niña; le ayudó a salir adelante. Sus sembríos constan de café, achiote y yuca, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos de cultivo. Cuenta que antes alquilaba extensas áreas de tierra productiva, pero con el tiempo y apoyo de su esposo; logró comprarse uno propio. Lo que más le gusta a ella es comercializar sus frutos en cada campaña agrícola, pues tiene mucho rozamiento en ello, su alegría y experiencia le ayuda a obtener buenas ganancias. Además cría gallinas del campo, las que enseba para luego comercializarlas y así obtener un dinero extra. Ahora sus planes son sembrar mayor cantidad de café, para poder tener una producción fructífera el año que entra. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Viviana de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de plantitas de café y fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
22-year-old Viviana lives in the indigenous community of Santa María.  There she formed her family together with Rubén, her husband of eight years.  The couple have five children who they care for in their own home.

When she was 14 years old, Viviana started taking on responsibility as she was expecting her first child.  This motivated her to start her own business so that she could financially support her family.  Farming, an activity she has known since she was a child, helped her to get ahead.  She grows coffee, annatto and cassava.  Viviana grows these crops on her own farmland.  She tells us that she used to rent large tracts of land but, over time and with her husband's help, she managed to buy a plot of land of her own.  What Viviana most enjoys is selling her crops each season as there is a lot of interaction involved.  Her cheerfulness and experience help her to make good profits.  In addition, Viviana raises hens which she fattens and then sells in order to make extra money.  Her current plans are to grow a larger quantity of coffee so that she can enjoy an extremely productive year this coming year.

Viviana is a member of the 'Los Amigos Cafetaleros' community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your help so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  With your support, Viviana will invest the money she has requested in buying coffee plants and natural fertilizers for her next sowing period.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.  She has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 3 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She generates additional income through working as a cleaner at a nearby school. The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to build rental rooms.  

Hadjah lives in a home that she owns where she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Komang Ngurah

texts.en:
Komang Ngurah is really happy because he can sell a lot of his milk to customers. The milk not only tastes delicious, but is good for our health. Now he is a major distributor for the milk.  He is proud that, because of the milk, he also supports the health of the community.

He needs a new loan to buy more milk to fulfill the demands of  the salesmen. Komang Ngurah will use the profit to support his children's education and save for family needs.

loans.use: to buy 50 boxes of soy milk

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, en esta ocasión lo quiere para mejorar su negocio surtiéndolo de mercadería como: azúcar, aceite, arroz, frijoles, sopas instantáneas, el propósito de ella es mejorar en sus productos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Los financiamientos anteriores le ayudaron mucho a mantener siempre estable su negocio, el cual le ha permitido mejorar las condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Marta is requesting a new loan.  On this occasion, she would like a loan to improve her business, stocking it with merchandise such as sugar, oil, rice, beans and instant soups.  Her goal is to improve the products she offers and to satisfy her customer demand.  Her previous loans helped her a lot in keeping her business stable.  This has enabled her to improve her own living conditions as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, rice, beans and instant soups

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María integrante del Banco comunal “Oportunidad” perteneciente a la comuna de Padre de las Casas, ciudad de Temuco.
Se dedica al rubro de comercio, específicamente vende frutas, abarrotes, bebidas, en un local que arrienda.
Se dedica a su negocio desde hace 7 años y trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas, distribuidoras, proveedores y en la feria compra las frutas. 
Con el crédito comprará frutas de temporada, entre sandias, kiwis, mandarinas, manzanas, uvas y melones.
Las metas en su negocio son instalarse con un local establecido en su propia casa, ya que el gasto de arriendo la limita para invertir en más mercadería y nuevas maquinarias.
Comenta que la temporada de más alta demanda, son los meses de primavera verano, ya que vende frutas de temporada.
Su marido e hijo la ayudan en la atención de clientes en su negocio, por lo que se siente apoyada.
Además comenzará a participar en gimnasia de relajación para desestresarse de las labores domesticas.
María vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 22, 20 y 18 años de edad, quienes estudian y trabajan. El sueño de ella es adquirir su casa propia, para esto ya postuló al subsidio habitacional, puesto que participa de un comité para la vivienda. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que comparte, ya que son muy unidos y responsables. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas le han servido para perfeccionarse en la administración y contabilidad de su negocio, ya que ha implementado nuevas estrategias.
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
María is a member of  the communal bank "Oportunidad" which belongs to the municipality of Padre de las Casas, in the city of Temuco. She sells fruit, groceries, drinks in leased premises. She has been running her business for 7 years and works Monday through Saturday. She buys her merchandise from wholesale supermarkets, distibutors and suppliers and her fruit in the street market. With the loan she will buy seasonal fruit such as watermelons, kiwis, mandarin oranges, apples, grapes and melons. Her business goals are to establish the store in her own house as the rent she pays limits her ability to invest in more merchandise and new equipment. She says that the seasons with the highest demand are spring and summer as she sells seasonal fruit. Her husband and child help her serve customers for which she feels supported. In addition she will begin a relaxation exercise class to destress from her household activities.

María lives with her husband and 3 children of 22, 20 and 18 years of age, who study and work. Her dream is to buy her own house and to this end she has already applied for a housing subsidy as she is a member of a housing committee. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity the Fondo has extended her, giving her hope to invest in her business. She feels also very comfortable with her group as they are very unitied and responsible. With regard to the training, it has served to improve her business administration and accounting as she has implemented new strategies.
.
Padre Las Casas is a municipality in the south of Chile near the city of Temuco in the region of Araucania. It was given this name in honour of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas who was a defender of the indigenous people during the conquest of America. The community has a large Mapuche population. Its economy is based on the agricultural industry and commercial services.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit such as watermelons, kiwis, mandarin oranges, apples, grapes and melons.

loans.name: William Xavier

texts.es: William Xavier se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace mas de 4 años, debido a esta temporada navideña que se acerca el quiere comprar suficiente productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, el objetivo del crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, calzado, bolsos, prenda de plata y oro. A pesar de que muchas veces le resulta difícil ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria.
texts.en: William Xavier has been selling general merchandise for over four years. Due to the approaching Christmas season, he would like to buy sufficient merchandise to offer his customers. The purpose of this loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, shoes, bags, and gold and silver items. Although it has often been difficult, William has succeeded in helping his family to get ahead. The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of necessary materials.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, shoes, bags and gold and silver items

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Alicia;  La socia tiene 26 años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 1 hijo de 5, años de edad; La socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo todo tipo de textiles, la socia compra en la ciudad de Cusco y Juliaca al por mayor diversos textiles en diferentes tamaños y los trae a vender en uno de los miradores del bello poblado situado en el corazón del valle sagrado; La socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de textiles para abastecer  la demanda.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the ”REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO” communal bank, located in the Ccorao district, within the Calca province and Cusco department.

She’s 26 years old, married, has a five year old son, and works buying and selling different types of textiles in Cusco and Juliaca.  She buys in quantity and of different sizes and brings them to sell from one of the beautiful lookout points in the old city in the heart of the “Valle Sagrado” valley.  She would like to use the money from this loan to buy textiles to meet the demand.

She appreciates the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy textiles to meet her customer demand.

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es: Diana Luz es una emprendedora de éxito, que con mucho sacrificio ha salido adelante junto con su esposo para sacar a delante a sus hijos que están a su cargo. Diana no es la primera vez que trabaja con Fundación, ya que su record crediticio es muy bueno, ella nos explica que gracias al financiamiento y al apoyo a salido adelante. Además Diana posee unas tierras en cual también apoyada con su esposo la trabajan. Diana está solicitando crédito para poder comprar repuestos para el vehículo, ya que se ha dañado y lo necesita de urgencia.
texts.en:
Diana Luz is a successful entrepreneur. Through a lot of sacrifice, she and her husband have been able to get their children ahead. This is not the first time that Diana has worked with the Foundation, and she has a good credit record. She explains that thanks to the first loan and the support she has made progress. Diana also has some land where she and her husband work. 

Diana is asking for a loan to buy repair parts for her vehicle, which has been damaged and needs to be fixed urgently.

loans.use: to buy repair parts for her vehicle.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle. Thelma has been in this business for six years now.  In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ki

texts.en: Ki, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over a year. Her husband is a truck driver. Since the factory is far away from home, Ki is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, she would go to work on time and reduce her transportation expense. In the future, she would like to run a grocery shop and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su pareja la cual la apoya mucho en todo lo que ella hace y asimismo trabaja vendiendo pan, realiza trabajos de plomería, electricidad y albañilería, es un mil oficios como decimos acá en Perú, junto a ella también viven  sus preciosos hijos de 7 y 1 año de edad a los cuales ama mucho y son el mejor regalo que Dios le ha podido dar a una mujer y por los cuales daría la vida con verlos felices. Su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Santiago, Ica Perú. El Distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por albergar varias empresas agroexportadoras, las cuales brindan muchos empleos en la zona y sobre todo porque este distrito se caracteriza también por su actividad agrícola, en especial el cultivo de espárragos, uva y algodón.  En su tiempo libre Rosa disfruta de pasear con sus hijos o tan solo conversar o jugar con ello, asimismo le gusta cocinar uno de sus platillos favoritos “Cara pulcra con Sopa Seca”.
 
Cada día Rosa se levanta muy temprano para iniciar su negocio de venta de Refrescos y raspadillas en temporada de verano porque en invierno vende desayunos; ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 6 horas diarias, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque atiende con cariño a sus clientes y por ello siempre regresan a su negocio.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran ayuda y gracias a ello podrá comprar utensilios para su negocio como vasos descartables, sorbetes al por mayor, entre otros para poder darles más comodidad a sus clientes, así seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”, ya que actualmente vive en casa de los padres de su pareja.
texts.en:
Rosa is 30 years old and lives together with her partner who supports her very much in everything that she does.  Her partner works selling bread, as well as doing jobs in plumbing, electrical, and brick work.  He has a thousand jobs as we say in Perú.  Together Rosa lives with her partner and her precious children, ages 7 and 1, who she loves very much and who are the best gift that God could have given a woman.  For them she would give her life, to see them happy.  Her home is located in the district of Santiago, Ica Perú.  The district of Santiago is known for its agricultural activity, particularly the farming of asparagus, grapes and cotton.  In her free time Rosa enjoys strolls with her children or even just chatting or playing with them.  She also likes to cook one of her favorite dishes, "Cara pulcra con Sopa Seca" a popular Peruvian pork and potato dish.
 
Every day Rosa gets up very early to sell soft drinks and ices in the summer, and in the winter she sells breakfasts.  She works around 6 hours each day.  She believes that things are going well in her business because she provides her customers with care and for that reason they always come back to her business.

Rosa is very thankful for the Kiva lenders since this is the second time that they have offered her their great help.  Thanks to this assistance she will be able to buy utensils for her business like disposable cups, ices in bulk, an other items in order to give her customers more convenience. She will continue working and struggling each day in order to make her great dream a reality: "To have her own home," since she currently lives in her parents home along with her partner.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business (cups, flavored ices, and other items).

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Mrs. Comfort E. sells foodstuffs. A business she started three year ago. She is 60 years old. She has evidence of impact of LAPO loan in her business. She needs the above for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy additional grinding machine and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to purchase 200 chicks

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im S. is 38 years old, and is the mother of three children. She lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She makes her living by running a small shop, and sells cassettes, compact disks, and VCDs. Im can typically make around 5 USD/day in revenue. Her husband works as a silversmith and contributes his income to the household as well. S. hopes that with this loan, she will be able to purchase some silvers and more tools for her husband to use in his business.

In the future, S. hopes she will be able to own her own CD and VCD shop to generate additional income.

loans.use: To purchase silvers, other tools and some CDs (compact disks) for a business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy traditional baskets (Ciondos)

loans.name: Sakina Juma  And

texts.en: Sakina Juma 41, (in glasses) and L. J. (40) are two close business partners. Together they call themselves The Peace. The have been working together as business partners for the past three years. Sakina is a tailor and keeps poultry as well and L. is a cook and owns a restaurant in the Buguruni area. They have both received business training organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation. They are together in need of USD 700, with Sakina in need of USD 450 and the rest in need by L. to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Sakina and Lwiza would like to upgrade their businesses in tailoring and cooking.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
If anyone ever go past hamlet 4 of Hung Yen village in Hung Nguyen province, they will find a small local butcher shop serving the villagers. At a very young age of 33, Mrs. Nguyen Thi S. had already beared 5 children, and apart from running the butcher stall, she also works in 5 acres of cornfield. Mrs. S. is asking for a loan of 325 USD to expand her business by having more products and variety for the people of the hamlet.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Nếu ai đi qua xóm 4 xã hưng Yên, Hưng nguyên chúng ta sẽ bắt gặp một quán nhỏ buôn bán thịt lợn phục vụ cho người dân trong xóm. Với tuổi đời còn trẻ, mới 33 tuổi, nhưng chị Nguyễn Thị Sáu đã nuôi 5 đứa con, ngoài buôn bán chị còn làm thêm 5 sào ruộng. Chị Sáu đang đề nghị TYM cho vay 325 USD để chị xây được gian hàng để mở rộng buôn bán thực phẩm và các mặt hàng phục vụ người dân trong xóm.

loans.use: Buy pork

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Karibu (welcome!) to 24-year-old Judith, who plans to open her own hair and beauty salon, where she will weave, cut, plait and paint! To make her dream a reality, Judith requires a start-up loan of $425 to be repaid within 12 months. She plans to use the loan to buy equipment such as dryers, as well as a stock of hair products such as shampoo, conditioner, and styling gel. She is a high-school graduate and is confident that the skills she gained will enable her to make a success of her as-yet-unnamed salon.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase equipment and products to set up a hair and beauty salon

loans.name: Ni Wayan

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Y., 51 year old, realized a terrific business opportunity in her village. Currently there are many traveling buyers that purchases cacao directly from farmers. Many farmers are planting cacao trees in their fields as it provides quick production turnaround and easy to take care of. Ni Wayan Warni does not want to compete directly with other traveling traders, she decided to enter the cacao drying business. Ni Wayan Warni plans to use the loan from DInari to purchase scales and cacao nuts from traders. These cacao nuts are then sold to wholesalers that comes to her home once a week. At this time, dry cacao trades at $1.20 to $ 1.45 per kilograms. Ni Wayan Warni can get profit of up to 5 to 11 cents per kilogram. In one transaction Ni Wayan Warni can purchase 100 kg Cacao nuts and resell it to the wholesaler. So Ni Wayan Warni can gain $11 profit per transaction (once a week).

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Wayan Y., 51 tahun, melihat peluang yang baik di desanya. Saat ini banyak pembeli biji kakao keliling yang membeli kakao langsung ke petani. Memang petani sekarang ini banyak menanami sawahnya dengan pohon kakao karena perawatannya mudah dan cepat mendapat hasil. Karena tidak ingin bersaing dengan pedagang keliling yang lain, Ni Wayan Y. melihat peluang ini untuk menekuni usaha Pengepul Biji Kakao. Dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari, Ni Made Y. menggunakannya untuk membeli timbangan dan biji kakao dari pedagang keliling. Biji kakao ini akan dijual kembali kepada pedagang besar yang datang ke rumahnya seminggu sekali. Saat ini biji kakao kering berharga Rp. 11.000.- sampai dengan Rp. 13.000.- per kilogram. Ni Made Y. bisa mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 500.- sampai dengan Rp. 1.000.- per kilogram. Dalam satu transaksi, Ni Wayan Y. bisa membeli 100 kilogram biji kakao dan menjualnya kembali ke pedagang besar. Jadi Ni Wayan Y. bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 100.000.- per transaksi ( 1 minggu sekali ).

loans.use: Increase Capital to Buy More Inventory

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en: Rauf M. is a 40 year old man, married and has three children. Merdan lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He rents a small café and this business is family's only income. He established his business five years ago. He has borrowed three loans from Normicro and has expanded his business. Rauf has again applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $700. He would like to purchase new equipment for his café.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Lê Thị Đào, 54, joined TYM fund 4 years ago. Before joining TYM, her family was living in difficult condition. They could only rely on the revenue generated by their small rice field. They have 2 young children who attend school so the expenses add up. So when TYM started operating in her area, she and her husband had decided to borrow money to invest in a butcher stand. In the beginning, their sales were small. Since they buy their beef directly from supplier they were able to make good profit. Sales had increased and they have been able to save money. With subsequent loans from TYM, they invested in their butcher shop. Now their financial difficulty is over, they can assure good education for their children. Mrs Đào also raises cattle in her free time. This time she's requesting a loan of 575 USD to buy cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Đào, 44 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương được 4 năm. Trước đây khi chưa tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị gặp nhiều khó khăn, mọi chi tiêu trong gia đình chỉ trông vào mấy sào ruộng. Chị còn nuôi 2 con đi học nên càng vất vả. Từ khi có Quỹ Tình Thương về hoạt động, chị đã bàn bạc cùng chồng và thống nhất vay vốn đầu tư mổ trâu, bò. Ban đầu chị Đào chỉ mổ với số lượng ít. Với mô hình mua tận gốc bán tận ngọn dần dần chị đã tích góp được số vốn kha khá. Cộng với mức vốn vay của Quỹ tăng dần hàng năm đến nay số lượng hàng bán mỗi ngày tăng lên rõ rệt. Kinh tế gia đình phát triển rõ rệt, các con có điều kiện ăn học tốt, chị Đào vẫn có thời gian để chăn nuôi thêm. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 575USD mua bò.

loans.use: Buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in his store, specifically in the purchase of wholesale rice

loans.name: Mariam's Boko Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 39 years old and is a married woman with a 9 year old child. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 26, 24 and 22 years old. Mariam sells water. She started in 2003. Every day, she works from 6am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more water for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Raya, Asha, Fatuma, Mwanaisha and Mwashabani, who have businesses selling soap, cosmetics, clothing, and food.

loans.use: To buy more water for her business.

loans.name: Shikhkarim

texts.en: Shikhkarim was born in 1953. He is married, has 3 children. S."s family lives in Khachmaz region. 10 years ago he started a farming business. Now he requests a loan of $975 to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his business.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: to buy  seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach P. is a 34-year-old mother of four in Doek Peang in Kampong Speu Province. She is a grocer and farmer. Previously, Mrs. Mach P. obtained a loan from AMK to start her grocery business. Since her business is going very well, Mrs. Mach P. wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for another loan in order to purchase more grocery goods for her customers.

Her husband, Mr. Thy Chuong, is a construction worker and he always assists his wife business activities. Last year one member of the family was in a motorbike accident and Mrs. Mach P. spent $200 to care for them. Because of this, Mrs. Mach P. has insufficient money to expand her grocery business. Mrs. Mach P. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods for her customers.

loans.name: Thi Hieu's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. D. Thi Hieu (ID Number 010038), is 50 years old. Her family has 5 peopL., and both her husband and she purchase scrap materials for saL. T. ear a living. Therefore, she likes T. borrow through the Fund so as T. expand her inventory. It is also convenient T. repay on a installment basis, so she would like T. borrow 3,186,000VND. She also encourages other peopL. in her village T. join her group T. improve their families' economy. Her group consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Bich (ID Number 010006), borrows 3,186,000VND T. purchase scrap materials T. sell
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thuy (ID Number 010039), borrows 3,186,000VND T. invest in her restaurant
  • Mrs. L. Thi Dung (ID Number 010040), borrows 2,242,000VND T. sell fruits
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thuy (ID Number 010041), borrows 2,950,000VND T. purchase construction supplies T. sell
  • Mrs. T. Thi Thin (ID Number 010042), borrows 3,186,000VND T. invest in her general store
  • The total amount requested is 1,100.00USD.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    chị Đặng thị Hiếu năm nay 50 tuổi. MS 010038 , gia đình chị có 5 nhân khẩu, cả hai vợ chồng chị đều làm nghề thu mua phế liệu. Vì vậy rất chị thích tham gia vay vốn của chương trình để có thêm nguồn vốn kinh doanh, đồng thời việc trả vốn lại rất thuận tiện nên chị đăng ký vay ở mức 3.186000 VND,ngoài ra chị còn vận động các chị em kháctrong thôn cùng tham gia vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Bích MS 010006 vay ở mức 3.186000 VND để thu mua phế liệu
  • chị Nguyễn thị Thuý MS 010039 vay mức 3.186000 VND để bán hàng ăn
  • chị Lê thị Dung MS 010040 vay vốn ở mức 2.242000 VND để đi chợ buôn hoa quả
  • chị Nguyễn thị Thuý MS 010041 vay mức 2.950000 VND để mua vật liệu xây dựng
  • chị Tô thị Thìn MS 010042 vay mức 3.186000 VND để bán hàng tạp hoá

loans.use: Invest in retail activities

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame M. is in the taxi transportation business and he also sells lobsters at Asebu in Cape Coast, Ghana. Kwame has received no education. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a trader. He is responsible for the payment of school fees, utility bills, and the feeding of his family. 

Kwame has been selling lobsters since 2006. He wants to increase his sales of lobsters. His loan will be used to buy more lobsters from Tema to resell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save and to build a family house.

loans.use: To buy more lobsters to sell

loans.name: Mexita

texts.es: Mexita tiene 28 años, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta de golosinas, y aparte de eso trabaja en una casa como empleada doméstica, hace todo esto por sus hijos, quienes son su inspiración de seguir adelante. Es por ello que Mexita quiere incrementar más su venta de golosinas y construir posteriormente una bodega, tiene muchas ideas de negocio, así como también desea remodelar las condiciones de su vivienda, y para eso necesariamente estima de un capital que levantará sus ganas de progreso y ver crecer su venta.
texts.en:
Mexita, 28, is a single mother with 3 children. She has supported herself for a long time selling sweets, and she works in a house as a domestic employee as well. She does all this for her children, who are her inspiration to get ahead. This is the reason that Mexita wants to increase her sales of candies and later build a shop. She has many business ideas, and she also wants to remodel her home, so she has estimated the capital needed to raise earnings and see her sales grow.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of sweets she sells, so she can have a shop in the future.

loans.name: Fatma's Group

texts.en:
Fatma has been selling handicrafts in Zanzibar for two years and is currently able to earn approximately $85 each month. A large market exists for wood carvings, masks, and other local crafts because many tourists visit Zanzibar and purchase these local mementos.

This will be Fatma's first loan, and with it she plans to buy more of these handicrafts as inventory for her shop. She intends to put any increase in profits that results from the loan back into her shop to continue to expand her business.

Fatma is 28 years old, married, and has three children, aged two, five, and eight. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Tabia, Zainab, and Tatu.

loans.use: To buy more handicrafts to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is 50 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. Currently two of her children are in school. She has sold charcoal and salt in her local community for 4 years now. Charcoal is a very popular cooking fuel in most traditional Ghanaian homes. Rose buys her supply of charcoal and salt from the villages and sells at retail to her customers. She depends on her business to support her children in school. With the loan, she wants to buy more charcoal and bags of salt to increase her business.  She hopes the loan will enable her to save enough money to support her children through school. She would be very grateful for that support. Rose belongs to the trust group called Morning Star. Members in this group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Namasuba H-Mpagi Ruth Group

texts.en:
Ruth M. is 27 years old and was once a cashier with the Ugandan development bank. She is a married mother of one and also a caring guardian to her late brother’s son. Two years back her dear husband, an architect by profession, set up a hardware shop for her in Najjanakumbi. With her hard work, she has been able to keep the business running effectively and efficiently. She earns a profit of approximately UGX 120,000 per week, which enables her to pay her rent of UGX 200,000 every month. The income from the business helps her put food on the table for her family in a shared role with the husband.

Ruth would use this loan to purchase water and oil-based Sadolin paints, locks, sandpapers, wood vanishes, and 6 mm glasses. The main challenge in her business is delayed payments by debtors but she has managed to control that by taking on a cash-on-delivery principle. She dreams of starting up a restaurant and raising a successful family.

loans.use: To purchase products to expand her hardware store.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila is a widow with one son. She sells men's and women's shoes at a market in Zaporozhye. Ludmila has been in this business for 10 years. She is a hard working person and a good entrepreneur. She takes her inventory to a small city and sells there during the week, then she goes back to the Zaporozhye market and sells there during the weekend. Ludmila would like a loan of $1150 to purchase more winter inventory. She can purchase it with a good discount and make more profit. This will help her to raise her son, since her business is the only source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase winter inventories

loans.name: Skola

texts.en:
Skola has had a small salon and small charcoal store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and salon items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.

Skola is 28 years old, married, and has two children aged 5 and 7.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and salon items for her business.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Raúl tiene 40 años de edad, está casado hace 16 años, siendo padre de 7 hijos, de los cuales 5 viven en su casa. La agricultura es parte de las buenas costumbres que le heredaron sus padres, en todo este tiempo ha tratado de sembrar mayor cantidad arvejas y habas, aunque éstas en menor cantidad por ser de menor ganancia. Raúl procura alquilar chacras donde ya hayan crecido papas anteriormente, esto facilita la siembra de arvejas, ya que de un saco de granos de arvejas, llega a cosechar de 50 a 60 sacos, esto lo realiza 3 veces como máximo en la misma chacra. Pero no todo es bueno, ya que Raúl en ciertas oportunidades se ve amenazado por las plagas que se implantan en las chacras por la excesiva lluvia, y tambien la helada (clima helado), sabiendo que si la rancha ataca a sus cultivos, se puede contrarrestar con funguicidas y pesticidas, pero con la helada no hay solución alguna para salvar los cultivos. Raúl está muy feliz con sus cultivos de arvejas, pese a las dificultades que tiene, los precios lo alientan a seguir sembrando, ya que son muy rentables para él. Él es secretario de su banco comunal, en cada una de las reuniones está encargado de redactar todos los acuerdos, este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo viene pagando puntualmente sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para sembrar nuevamente arvejas y con la venta de ellas comprar semillas. Raúl nos comenta su alegría por habérsele otorgado el crédito, lo que le permite seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Raúl is 40 years old, married for 16 years, and is the father of 7 children, 5 of whom are still at home. Farming is part of the good habits he inherited from his parents, he has always tried to grow a large quantity of peas and beans, even though these in smaller quantity products smaller profits. Raúl was able to rent farms where they previously grew potatoes, and this facilitated growing peas, as from one sack of pea seeds he can harvest 50-60 sacks, and this he does at the most 3 times on the same farmland. But not all is well, as Raúl has been threatened by various plagues on his fields because of excessive rain, and also frost (in this cold climate), knowing that if a pestilence attacks his crops, he can use fungicides and pesticides, but with the frost there isn’t a way to save his crops. Raúl is very happy with his pea crops, despite the difficulties that he has, the prices support him continuing to grow this crop as they are very profitable for him. He is secretary of his communal bank; at each of the meetings he is in charge of recording all the agreements. This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and all this time he has been punctual with his payments. The money he seeks is to buy fertilizer for his next pea planting and with the sales of his peas buy seeds. Raúl tells us he is happy to be given a loan as it enables him to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Edita

texts.es: Edita tiene 41 años, es madre de Cristian de 11, Diego de 10 y Brenda de 4 años, con los cuales vive en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se ha venido dedicando a la venta de comestibles en su bodega, donde trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 u 11 de la noche, tiempo en el cual logra una gran cantidad de clientela, ya que su buen trato ha logrado que sea un negocio muy rentable. A ella le gusta mucho la atención porque casi todos sus clientes la conocen y son sus amigos(as), así que la venta se hace muy amena. Ahora en época de verano el calor hace que sea muy incómodo permanecer durante todo el día en su tienda, pero aún así ella está muy contenta y espera ampliar muy pronto su negocio. Ella es una clienta antigua en MFP y lleva varios préstamos, en los cuales ha sido muy responsable pagando todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el dinero que solicita espera comprar gran cantidad de comestibles y abastecer su tienda con bebidas para esta época de verano.
texts.en:
Edita is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her children Cristian (age 11), Diego (age 10), and Brenda (age 4). For three years she has sold groceries in her shop, where she works from six in the morning until ten or eleven at night. Her hours have earned her a good number of customers and her good treatment of them has made her business very profitable.

Edita really likes working at the shop since she knows most of her customers and they are her friends. This makes selling things very pleasant. Currently, the summertime heat makes it very uncomfortable to remain in her shop all day, but even so Edita is very happy and hopes to further expand her business very soon.

She is an old client of Microfinanzas Prisma, has had many loans, and has always been responsible about being on-time with her repayments. With this loan she hopes to buy a lot of merchandise and to stock her store with drinks for the summertime.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Mrs. Gemma A., 44 years old, is married and lives in Dapitan City. She is much inspired by being a member of Paglaum MPC because she has all the benefits she wants. Since she already has an existing business near the port and her customers have increased, especially the ship passengers, she needs additional capital to increase her stocks of snack foods. She applied for a 7,000 PHP loan at Paglaum MPC to realize her business goals. She wishes to have a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional variety of snack foods

location.town: Dipolog-San Vicente, Dapitan City,Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene 26 años y vive en su propia casa, con sus 4 hijos; Raúl de 10, Miriam de 7, Yudith de 5 y Freddy de 1 año, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La crianza de ganado es una actividad que ha ido aprendiendo a lo largo de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió este trabajo de sus padres, quienes se esforzaron mucho para darle una buena vida. Lleva a vender su ganado a la feria dominical del distrito de Huancané, donde consigue unos buenos precios, ya que sus reses son las más grandes y fuertes de toda la feria, debido a los buenos cuidados que ella les brinda. Tiene 6 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es alimentar a sus animales, espera más adelante poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos, lo más difícil para Josefa es trasladar su ganado hasta la feria, ya que le es muy cansado y demoroso, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de alcanzar sus metas. Este es el primer préstamo de Josefa con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, aunque para ello tenga que ahorrar poco a poco, en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por las demás socias. Con los 800 soles solicitados planea comprar una ternera, la cual le costará aproximadamente 700 soles, el resto del dinero lo invertirá en comprar forraje para su ganado.
texts.en:
Josefa is a very hardworking, 26-six-year-old woman, who lives with her 4 children (Raúl 10, Miriam 7, Yudith 5, and Freddy 1) in their own home. Her children are what motivate her. She has been learning to raise cattle her whole life. She learned this work from her parents, who worked hard to give her a good life, when she was a small girl. She brings her cattle to the Sunday fair in the Huancané neighborhood, where she gets a good price since her livestock are the biggest and strongest at the fair due to the good care she gives them. She's been doing this for 6 years and what she likes most is feeding her animals. In the future, she hopes to be able to increase the number of cattle she has and in this way improve her income. The most difficult thing for Josefa is transferring her cattle to the fair because it's very tiring and slow. But she knows that she has to do it and is happy to work hard, hoping to reach her goals. This is Josefa's first loan with MFP and she's aware of the responsibility she has to pay it on time, even though she will have to save bit by bit to do it. She is an active and supportive member of her communal bank which is why she is so respected by the rest. With the 800 soles requested, she plans to buy a calf, which will cost about 700 soles. The rest of the money will be invested in buying fodder for her cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una ternera

loans.name: Juli

texts.es: Juli es muy reconocida por su trabajo, pues se dedica con mucho esmero, ya que sus padres y hermanos, con quienes vive, le inculcaron el amor al trabajo. Hace 2 años se inició en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que la obligó a salir a las calles y a visitar a diversas personas para ofrecer sus productos a través de los catálogos. Ser soltera le facilita su trabajo, pues cuanta con el tiempo necesario para salir a trabajar y gracias al apoyo de sus hermanos ha podido relacionarse con varias personas, quienes ahora son sus clientes fieles. Pero a pesar de contar con los catálogos de venta, requiere de gran cantidad de productos que estén a disposición inmediata para sus clientes y así atender sus pedidos de manera rápida, Para el futuro quiere instalar en su domicilio un bazar para la exposición de sus productos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está agradecida con el grupo que la acogió y le dio la posibilidad que conformar este banco comunal, donde las mujeres tratan de progresar en base a sus capacidades. Los 500 soles que solicita están destinados en la compra de productos de belleza, pues las temporadas festivas, como el día del padre se encuentran muy próximas.
texts.en:
Juli is very well-known for her work, and she does it with a great deal of care, since her parents and siblings, with whom she lives, instill in her the love for work. Two years ago she began selling cosmetics, which required her to travel around visiting different people to sell her products through catalogs. Being single makes her job easier, because she has the time she needs to go out and work. Thanks to the help from her siblings she has been able to meet numerous people, who are now her very loyal clients. However, while she does have sales catalogs, Juli still has to keep a lot of products on hand to fill her clients' orders quickly. In the future she would like to open a shop in her house where she can display her products. This will be Juli's first loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to the group because she has taken the opportunity they have given her to be part of this village bank, where women can try to progress based on their abilities. She plans to use the loan of 500 soles to buy beauty products since holidays like Father's Day are coming soon.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. is from the village of Yahong in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 45 years old. Gloria is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria helps family members to raise crops on their farm, primarily by planting and harvesting corn to sell. Gloria has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP that she will use to buy fertilizer, such as manure. This loan will be Gloria's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr:
A. Philomène est née le 12 Août 1967 à Adjohoun dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Philomène est mariée à MONNANDJO Emile. Philomène est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Philomène a été à l’école jusqu’en classe CM2 c’est-à-dire le cours primaire. Ensuite, Philomène a appris la couture qu’elle a exercée pendant une dizaine d'année. 

Cependant, Philomène a abandonné la couture pour problème de santé.  Actuellement Philomène vend des tissus sur commande qu’elle distribue souvent à crédit à ses clients. Philomène a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ce crédit. Philomène a besoin de moyens financiers pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de satisfaire toutes les commandes de tissus qu’elle reçoit. C’est pourquoi Philomène sollicite un deuxième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Philomène was born on August 12, 1967 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé County in southern Benin. She is married to MONNANDJO Emile and is the mother of four children who are all in school. She attended school through the 5th grade, that is, primary school. Next, she learned how to sew, something she did for 12 years. However, Philomène dropped sewing due to health problems. She currently sells fabrics by special order and distributes them, often on credit, to her customers. She has already had a loan with Alidé and has repaid it. She has need of funding for boosting her working capital, in order to satisfy all the orders she receives for cloth. This is why she’s requesting a second loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy twenty 5-meter bolts of damask cloth

loans.name: Nasipa's Group

texts.en:
Nasipa is the leader of this group. She works in the security service of “Kyrgyz Railroad”. She is forty-seven and has three children. Apart from her daily work she is occupied with cattle breeding. And recently she has been reconstructing her yard to be able to keep more cattle.

Nasipa needs a loan to purchase sheep and gradually increase their number. She has found that, in wintertime, selling meat is quite a profitable activity, since more people tend to buy meat at that time. 

Nasipa’s partners are Gulnura, Munara and Venera. 

Gulnura is thirty, married, and has two children. She needs a loan to purchase seeds and hay for their sheep, because at this moment the hay cost is relatively low.

Munara is forty-three, married, and has three children. She works in “Al – suu”, a limited liability corporation. She makes the labels. She needs a loan to purchase a bale of cotton for making traditional seat-carpets. Then with the rest of the money she wants to buy a sheep. Now she wants to help her son finish his college education and, besides that, she is planning her daughter’s wedding and now is making some preparations for it.

Venera is forty-five, married, and has four children. She also works as a label maker in “Al – Suu”. Now, Venera needs a loan for irrigation of her land and cultivation work. After doing that, she is going to grow clover and maize. 

“We cannot wait until somebody comes and gives us the opportunity to create our businesses; we shall better strive to create opportunities for ourselves,” say the members of this group.


======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit:  www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at  www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana C. M. tiene 62 años, esta casada con el Sr. Celso Medrano Velis, llevan 42 años de casados, viven en una zona periurbana. Tienen 4 hijos, los cuales estan casados y son independientes.

La Sra. Juana se dedica a la lacheria desde que se casó, tiene 7 vacas lecheras, entrega leche a una empresa local la cual produce toda clase de productos lacteos. Todo su ganado lechero esta en su misma propiedad. Necesita el prestamo para comprar una vaca lechera y alimento para que tenga almacenado debido a la escases en esta epoca de sequia. 

La Sra. Juana desea incrementar sus ingresos para poder vivir mejor y tambien para refaccionar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana C. M. is 62 years old and married to Mr. Celso Medrano Velis. They have been married for 42 years and live in a peri-urban zone. They have 4 children, all of whom are independent and married. Ms. Juana has been in the dairy business since she got married. She has 7 dairy cows. She sells the milk to a local business, which produces all types of dairy products. She owns all her dairy cows. She needs this loan in order to purchase another dairy cow and food for storage so that she can be prepared for shortages during this drought. Ms. Juana would like to increase her income so that she can lead a better life and refurbish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy cow and cattle feed

loans.name: Leh We Try Group

texts.en:
Here are Zainab B., Mohamed J. and Isatu S.. They call their group Leh We Try, a Krio phrase meaning "let us try". This will be the fourth loan for these entrepreneurs from SMT/Kiva. With previous loans, they were able to expand their businesses, increase profits and consequently improve their living standards. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are asking for a new loan of Le 3,200,000.00 to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Isatu S. was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. She is the leader of this group. She is 33-years old and married with four children. Zainab has been a businesswoman for more than ten years. She sells food in the market and with this loan, she will be able to add more items.

loans.use: To purchase more food

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es: Bernardina tiene 49 años, es madre D. dos hijos, quienes son su mayor tesoro y junto a su pareja tratan D. brindarles las comodidades posibles para su desarrollo. Ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras y frutas en el mercado D. su localidad, donD. trabaja por seis meses, tiempo que logró conseguir un puesto en alquiler, ya que es la única forma D. iniciar su negocio dentro del mercado. DesD. entonces realiza su actividad con mucho ánimo todos los días desD. las seis D. la mañana hasta las cuatro D. la tarD., aprovechando la demanda que hay por las mañanas. Sin embargo para hacer su negocio rentable tiene que ofrecer productos D. calidad y sobre dar una buena atención a las personas, ya que es un factor importante para los clientes. Bernardina siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy sociable y esto le ayudó a  incrementar su clientela. Sin embargo, el empeño que pone a su trabajo por adquirir un puesto D. venta le está resultando muy caro, pues el costo del alquiler perjudica con las ganancias que obtiene del trabajo. Bernardina espera le concedan nuevamente el préstamo para sacar adelante su negocio y tener su propio puesto D. ventas, además ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y ha cumplido a tiempo sus pagos. Los seis préstamos que tuvo con Microfinanzas PRISMA le permitieron formar un equipo D. trabajo muy ameno, ya que las socias que conforman su banco comunal tratan siempre D. trabajar organizadamente. Los 800 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra D. mercadería para ampliar  su puesto con nuevos productos comestibles.
texts.en:
Bernardina is 49 years old, and the mother of two children that she treasures. Together with her partner, she tries to proviD. them with all the comforts for their progress. She dedicates herself to selling fruits and vegetables at the market in her locality, where she has been working for six months. In this time, she has managed to attain a stall that she rents, as this is the only way to start her business within the market. Since then, she has carried out her activities with great enthusiasm every day from six in the morning until four in the afternoon, taking advantage of the demand there is for her product in the early part of the day. Despite this, in order to make her business profitable, she has to offer quality products and good customer service -- important factors for her clients. Bernardina has always characterized herself for being very friendly, and this has helped her to increase her customer base. Regardless, the effort she has maD. to rent a stall for her work is proving to be quite expensive, since the cost of her space cuts into the profits from her sales. Bernardina hopes that they will re-lease the space to her so she can grow her business and have her own place from which to sell her product. In addition, she has proven herself as a responsible person and has maD. her payments on time. The six loans that she had with Microfinanzas PRISMA allowed her to form a good working team, as the members that make up her cooperative bank always try to work in an organized manner. The 800 soles she requests will be invested into the purchase of merchandise to expand her stall with new edible products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Rafina

texts.en: Rafina sells drinks to make a living. She is 38 years old and married with three children. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for over three years. She requests a loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike is a 45 years old woman living in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is married and has 2 children.All her children are schooling.She sells drinks and juice in her shop.She hopes for the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Donata's Group

texts.en:
K. Donata is a friendly and hardworking lady who has had a clinic in Kashozi trading centre as her business for fifteen years. Before moving to the trading centre, she started working from the village and only moved because the market was not good. But she is happy where she is now.

Donata is 37 years old and married with three children aged between 14 and 6 years. She also takes care of four dependents.

Donata offers medical care and first aid to the local people and hence is an important factor in her local community. She is able to make 340,000/= as profits each month and this helps her in taking care of her family plus paying the children’s school fees.

Donata still has a dream of moving to the main town of Bushenyi to transact her business from there, since the population there is large. She has been successful so far because of her good customer language and friendliness, in addition to the loans that help increase her capital every time she uses them.

Donata needs a loan to help with the completion of her children’s school fees since she would like them to a obtain the best education up to university level.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda C., 59 years old, and her husband Nolasco, also 59, have been farming for forty years now. Nolasco also drives for a living. They have six children. They live together in the breezy town of Silang, Cavite.

When they are in season, Esmeralda trades bananas, pineapples, and other crops from their farm in the nearby market. But while waiting for the harvest to come in, she gets to attend to her general store (as shown in the picture). She is earning close to 26,000 PHP a month. She uses her profits and other savings to send her children to school; they still have two college students. Esmeralda is proud enough to declare that four of their six children finished college out of their earnings. She was also able to purchase a jeepney, which they are now using to deliver fruits and other crops to the market.

Esmeralda joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005. She loves the camaraderie of the women entrepreneurs. She is applying for a new loan in the amount of 24,000 PHP, which she will use to fund the next pineapple crop. She will purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and other farm tools. Some of the funds will be used to purchase grocery items to sell at her store.

Esmeralda wishes to get rich so she can help her poor neighbors and relatives. Her usual prayers include good health and harmonious relationships amongst her children.

About CCT: The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missions in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and additional grocery items

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a esposo (Victoriano) de 75 años y sus 5 hijos: Ruth de 20, Reyna de 16, Servando de 13, Marco de 10 y Sandro de 7 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Su negocio está ubicado en la explanada “Laguna Temporal” (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), ella vende tejidos artesanales y los modelos que tiene son muy novedosos porque ella misma los teje.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y mientras más lo hace mejor se siente, además que de esta forma puede pagar los estudios de sus menores hijos. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus artesanías hasta su puesto de venta, ya que vive muy lejos de ahí. Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad sus prendas.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Felicitas con MFP y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta y sabe que le ayudará a progresar. Con los seiscientos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de prendas que produce.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 45, is a hard-working, determined woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Victoriano, 75 and their 5 children: Ruth, 20, Reyna, 16, Servando, 13, Marco 10, and Sandro, 7, who are the motivating force for all her efforts. Her place of business is in the "Laguna Temporal" esplanade (site of Juliaca's fairs). She sells artisanal weavings and her designs are very unique because she herself weaves them. What she most likes about her work is the weaving and the more she does it the better she feels. Besides, this is a way for her to earn money to pay for her childrens' schooling. She has had this occupation for 3 years and considers the most difficult part of it is having to carry her wares to her sales stall because she lives far away. Her future plans are to save enough money to set up a shop where she can sell her wares more peacefully. This is Felicitas' third loan with MFP and she is very punctual with her payments because she does not want to cause her communal bank any inconveniences; she is very comfortable in it and knows that it will help her to get ahead. With the 600 soles requested she will buy more wool to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Uon

texts.en: Uon M., 35, is a hard-working woman who lives in Phnom Penh city, where she makes a living selling cakes in front of a garment factory. Her husband contributes to the family's income by driving a motorbike taxi. The couple has two children, both of them in school. In Cambodia, this is the time of year when fish are in abundant supply and prices are especially low, so Uon is applying for this loan to buy a large amount of fish to turn into paste to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk to turn into paste to sell to her customers

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia R. is a 43 years old and the mother of five children; only the youngest is still single and the rest of the siblings have their own families. Her husband, Herardo, is a fisherman. She worked very hard to raise her big family. Despite the many difficulties she encountered, she was able to send all their children to school which is one fulfillment of her dreams.

In 2005, with the desire of having supplementary capital for her fishing business, Amalia came up with the idea of joining ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), a Kiva partner in the Philippines. She applied for this loan of Php 20,000 to buy assorted raw materials for her business like fishing net, bamboo, fingerlings (baby fish), etc.

Amalia’s business is one big help in sustaining their daily needs because it provides them with good earnings and she wants to continue the business and will make more investments in it. She dreams of putting up a bigger fish cage in the future and of being able to get a stall in the market for selling her fish.

ASHI is their partner in fulfilling their dreams to fight against poverty and giving them faith in changing their lives. She is very motivated to develop her business towards sustainability because the proceeds it generates provides her with the financial means needed to support her family.

loans.use: To buy assorted raw materials for her fish cage like fishing net, bamboo, fingerlings, etc.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is twenty-nine years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Although she has no children herself, Dorcas caters for two nieces who are in school. She is a hair dresser by profession. She works in a shop by the roadside in her community. She has two apprentices under training. Dorcas has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy artificial hair, pomade, and other working materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair.

loans.name: Tito Wilfredo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLL.”, Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de SaylL., ubicado a 30 minutos en bus local de L. ciudad del Cusco. SaylL. es lugar de los restaurantes más famosos al aire libre, aquí se pude venir cualquier día de L. semana a disfrutar del paisaje mientras se saborea de un deliciosos plato típico de Perú y en especial de a ciudad del Cusco, el chicharrón, (elaborado a base de carne de cerdo son trozos de 3 a 4 acompañadas con papas doradas y choclo dulce o salado con una ensalada de cebolL. y hierba buena tipo menta).

El socio es el Sr Tito, tiene 43 años de edad, es casado con L. socia Rosa, tienen 2 hijos de 11 y 7 años de  edad, nuestro socio es de profesión policía, el socio trabaja en L. comisaría de SaylL., nuestro socio tiene junto a su esposa el negocio familiar de venta de chicharrones. El socio también es maderero, y requiere el préstamo para comprar maderas, las cuales trae de L. selva de puerto maldonado y las vende en Cusco. El trae L. madera por pedidos.

El socio agradece y valora L. oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Tito belongs to the Communal Bank "Saving is Progress - SaylL.". He lives in the SaylL. district, which is located 30 minutes by local bus from the city of Cusco. SaylL. is where the most famous open air restaurants are located. You could come here any day of the week to enjoy the landscape while you taste some of the delicious typical dishes of Peru and especially Cusco, like the chicharron (made of 3 or 4 pieces of pork, accompanied by golden potatoes and sweet corn or flavored with an onion salad and a mint-like herb). Sr. Tito is 43 years old, is married to a fellow group member, Rosa, and has two children ages 7 and 11. He is a police officer in the precinct of SaylL.. He and his wife have a business selling chicharrones. Sr. Tito is also a logger, and needs a loan to buy wood. He brings the wood on orders from the jungle in Puerto Maldonado to the city of Cusco to sell. Sr. Tito is grateful for and values the opportunity given to him through this loan and is committed to paying it back in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Las Momostecas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de señoras,  del paraje Pologuá de la Aldea San Antonio Pasajoc, municipio de  Momostenango  departamento de  Totonicapán, son personas que se conocen, desde hace 5 años han trabajado siempre juntas, en diferentes actividades que se organizan dentro de la comunidad Como por ejemplo Comité de Escuelas en donde estudian sus hijos actividades de la Iglesia en el cual lo integran de la siguiente manera: se cuenta con una justa directiva la cual tienen a su presidenta, Secretaria,  Tesorera: y  la demás son Vocales. Estas cinco  personas se dedican especialmente  a la Crianza de Animales Cerdos, Ovejas, Pollos y una se dedica al Servicio de Alfabetizadora en la Comunidad. Las personas trabajan en su hogar en el Paraje Pologuá, de la Aldea San Antonio Pasajoc Momostenango  se realizo la visita en cada una de sus viviendas y se comprobó la actividad que realizan y se verifico que  tienen mucha experiencia de lo que realizan, por lo que se le considera que son personas responsables y trabajadoras a pesar de no contar con lo suficiente recursos  económicos son personas emprendedoras.

 Las personas  necesitan ampliar sus Capital de Trabajo, por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de Pologuá,  para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de sus familias
texts.en:
This group of ladies from the place Pologuá de la Aldea San Antonio Pasajoc, Momostenango municipality, Totonicapán department, are all known to each other. For 5 years they have always worked together in different activities that they organise within the Como community, such as Comité de Escuelas where their children study, and church activities. They work in the following way: they have a board of directors with a president, secretary and treasurer: the rest are members. These 5 people work especially in raising animals - pigs, sheep, and chickens, and one works for the Servicio de Alfabetizadora in the community. They work in their home in Paraje Pologuá, de la Aldea San Antonio Pasajoc Momostenango. They makes visits to each other's homes and they confirm that they have a lot of experience in the activities that they do.
