For this they are considered responsible people and hard-working, and apart from not having sufficient economic resources they are enterprising women. The ladies need to increase their working capital, for which reason they approached the officies of the assocation ASDIR de Pologuá to finance their economic activity and in this way improve their living conditions and those of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Purevsuren is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own apartment. His wife works as an inventory manager in a community hospital. His oldest daughter goes to secondary school and his son goes to kindergarten. Purevsuren and his wife have been living in their current apartment for three years, since they got married. During the day, Purevsuren has been operating a cell phone repairing business at the “Tuin Dolgio” market. Purevsuren started his business in 2009, and he is planning to change his workplace and improve his appliances and equipment for his business. They are planning to expand the business and create their own workplace. He will purchase a computer for installing songs and video clips on cell phones.  Purevsuren says, “I would like to expand my business.” He is requesting a 200,000 tugrug (~ 140 USD) loan, with 150,000 tugrugs (~ 105 USD) to be used for a computer and 50,000 tugrugs (~35 USD ) to be used for spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and spare parts

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander M. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. He is 40 years old. Alexander is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Alexander owns & operates a specialized retail store buying and selling sand and gravel in the local community. Alexander has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alexander joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Alexander has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alexander is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Alexander from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Bertha Verónica

texts.es: Bertha Verónica A. es comerciante de frutas y verduras cuyo oficio realiza desde su niñez cuando ayudaba a su madre quien también comercializaba estos productos. Ella con el préstamo comprara frutas y verduras de temporada como aguacate, jocote, mango, grocea…etc.
texts.en:
Bertha Verónica A. has been selling fruit and vegetables since she was a child; she used to help her mother who also sold produce. Betha plans to use her loan to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables such as avocado, mango and other typical regional fruits such as jocote and grocea.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase harvests of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Dibor

texts.en: Dibor S. is 55 years old, married and the mother of four. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE for two years and has always paid back her loans on time. Her main activity consists of buying and reselling eggs. Dibor S. wants to use this loan to buy more eggs. The revenues from this activity allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase eggs

loans.name: Ángela Rosa

texts.es: La señora C. B., se dedica al acopio de leche baca, la cual vende en su casa de habitación, también vende queso y cuajada que elabora también en su casa, en CEPRODEL se le otorgado dos préstamos anteriores a este, los que ha invertido en el negocio ya que lo ha venido aumentando en acopio y venta. En este caso solicita este nuevo préstamo para realizarle un cambio de zinc a parte de la casa y cambio de dos puertas que se encuentran dañadas. Tiene dos hijos bajo su cargo en edad escolar y con las utilidades del negocio mantiene la educación de ellos.
texts.en:
La señora C. B., se dedica al acopio de leche baca, la cual vende en su casa de habitación, también vende queso y cuajada que elabora también en su casa, en CEPRODEL se le otorgado dos préstamos anteriores a este, los que ha invertido en el negocio ya que lo ha venido aumentando en acopio y venta. En este caso solicita este nuevo préstamo para realizarle un cambio de zinc a parte de la casa y cambio de dos puertas que se encuentran dañadas. Tiene dos hijos bajo su cargo en edad escolar y con las utilidades del negocio mantiene la educación de ellos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reparación de techo y puertas de la casa

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
LA SRA. ELSA ESTA CASADA Y TIENE HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTARN EN  EDAD ESCOLAR, DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE COMIDA QUIEN ADEMAS DEBE LEVANTARSE MUY TEMPRANO PARA PODER PREPARAR LOS ALIMENTOS PARA SUS HIJOS Y MANDARLES AL COLEGIO, EL ESPOSO DE LA SRA. ELSA TRABAJA EN EL CHAPARE POR TANTO MUY POCO SE ENCUENTRA DENTRO DE LA CIUDAD, Y ELLA SOLA SE ENCARGA DE LA EDUCACION Y SUSTENTO DE SUS HIJOS, ES ELLA QUIEN EN REALIDAD TRABAJA PARA MANTENER A SU FAMILIA, Y AUNQUE EL TRABAJO ES BASTANTE SACRIFICADO ELLA NO SE QUEJA Y DICE QUE SE ENCUENTRA MUY CONFORME CON LA VIDA QUE LLEVA EL DINERO LO NECESITA PARA COMPRA DE INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUS RIQUISIMOS 
PLATILLOS, Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL YA QUE LE ESTA YENDO MUY BIEN CON SU NEGOCIO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Elsa is married and has children of school age. She prepares and sells meals for a living, and she has to wake up early every day in order to prepare food for her children and send them to school. Her husband works in the El Chapare region, and this means he is seldom at home, so she has to provide for the education and necessities of her children by herself. It is her efforts that actually support her family, and even if her job is rather demanding, she does not complain and declares being very satisfied with the life she is leading. She needs the loan to buy ingredients to prepare her delicious dishes, and thus being able to increase her income since her business is going very well. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita G. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 51 years-old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Juanita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Juanita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used  to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Juanita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell	.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es: La  solicitante es casada, trabaja en granja y con los ahorros compraron un auto que su esposo lo maneja. El destino del credito es para comprar el sistema de conversion a gas, lo que le permitira reducir los gastos en consumo de combustible.
texts.en:
Rosalinda is married and works on a farm. Using her savings, she bought a car for her husband to drive. This loan will be used to convert the vehicle to a natural gas system, which will help reduce fuel costs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert her husband's vehicle to a natural gas system

loans.name: Tserennadmid

texts.en:
Tserennadmid S. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Tserennadmid currently operates a raw materials trade in her district. She started her business in 2003 and has found success in her business. She is now renting a small food shop in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar in order to improve her quality of life and stabilize her family's financial situation.

Tserennadmid dreams of possessing her own food shop in the future. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials and food supplements for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for her shop

loans.name: Davy

texts.en:
Mrs. Davy B., 22 and her husband, Mr. Saran Phorn, 22, have been married since 2008 and just have a young daughter. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Davy is not in the photo, her husband was available instead.

Davy is a tailor. She operates the business at home. Her husband is a security guard. She is applying for her first loan, in the amount of $500, to purchase additional fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mauricio Alexander

texts.es: Mauricio Alexander H. de 32 años, reside en el municipio de San Francisco Gotera en el departamento de Morazán. Él se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en su hogar, así mismo comercializa materiales para construcción, negocios gracias a los cuales puede llevar el sustento diario a su hogar, y por los cuales mantiene a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y que así mismo le ayuda con el negocio de verduras y vive junto a sus tres hijos, todos menores de edad quienes son estudiantes de educación media. Tanto Mauricio como su esposa son personas muy responsables con su hogar, los cuales desean poder brindarles todo lo mejor a sus hijos, los cuales son el mayor incentivo para ellos de salir adelante cada día. Mauricio solicita un préstamo para poder surtir su venta de frutas y verduras, ya que este negocio es muy bueno y poseen gran cantidad de clientes los cuales a diario compran sus productos, así mismo para comprar mayor cantidad de materiales para construcción como cemento, ladrillos, arena y otros más.
texts.en:
Mauricio Alexander H. is 32 years old, he lives in the municipality of San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. For a living he sells fruits and vegetables from his home and he also markets building materials. These businesses allow him to cover the daily requirements for his home and take care of his family; his wife who takes care of their home and helps with the vegetable business and their three children, who are all in middle school. Mauricio as well as his wife are very responsible persons and they wish to give their children the best as they are their incentive to move ahead every day. Mauricio requests a loan to supply fruits and vegetables as business is good and has many customers who buy their products daily, and also to buy more building materials such as cement, bricks, sand, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables as well as building materials.

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Faithful Business Group

texts.en:
Jacob J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Faithful Business'. Jacob is 32 years old, married, and has two children, 5 and 9 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. He cares for one sibling.

For 10 years, he has been selling  dishes (breakable and plastic bowls) in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 53,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more dishes. He describes himself as an earnest man.

His goal is to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more dishes ( breakable and plastic bowls)

loans.name: Dédé Philomène

texts.fr: D. est une femme très dynamique. elle a appris la coiffure et a ouvert son propre salon de coiffure qu'elle a appelé "FINE GIRL", pour augmenter son revenu elle a associé à son activité la vente de produits cosmétiques.voulant faire accroître ce dernier commerce, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des mèches, tissages et divers produits de beauté. elle a débuté ce commerce en 2004. elle est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Dédé Philomène D. is a very dynamic woman. She is a trained hairdresser and she runs her own business, "FINE GIRL" . To increase her income she enlarged her business and started selling beauty products. Now she would like to improve this part of the business and for this reason she requests a loan by WAGES to buy hair extensions, wigs and different beauty products. She started this business in 2004, she is married and mother of two children.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wigs, hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Suy P., 35, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. P. sells groceries, earning an income of $7 per day. P.’s husband is a tuk-tuk (a motorcycle with a trailer) driver, and he is able to earn an income of $6 per day. 

P. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha T. is a 54 year old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a ready to wear business, a general store and a gasoline retailing business. She lives in Gatuslao St., Poblacion, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her ready to wear, general store and gasoline businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 3,000 PHP. 

Editha is now borrowing 15,000 PHP which she will use to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Editha aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join their team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan R. is from the village of Mapulog, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old, married, and has 3 grown children. To make a living, Susan owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing karaoke services to local community members, for which customers pay 5 pesos per song. She is also operating a sari-sari (variety) store, at which she sells beverages and all kinds of junk food and snacks as an additional way of generating income. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. This will be Susan’s 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide her services

loans.name: Mey Yin's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of five people who live in Preaek Touch village, Kandal province. Mrs. Mey Y. is the leader of the group loan who has been selected by the members. The members of this group will use their portion of the loan to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes.
Mrs. Y., 65, is a farmer who owns 2.80 hectares of land, which she uses to cultivate corn and peanuts. She will use her loan from Kiva partner, AMK, to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire farm labor to cultivate her corn and peanuts. Mrs. Y. is a widow with a child who works as a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire farm labor

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is 28 years old and in business. He sells auto spare parts in a conducive environment. His main customers are vehicle owners. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy more motor spare parts for sale. Fredrick is married and a father of two young children. He hopes to establish himself in business and become a prominent businessman with a five-year plan of selling auto spare parts wholesale. He describes himself as honest, GOD-fearing, and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more auto spare parts for sale

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad lives in Multan with her family in the area named Islampura with her family. Multan is a big city and known for its history and tombs. She came here after her marriage with M. S. to live in a 2 room brick house.  

She is a widow and lost her husband few years ago. It was a very difficult time for her because all the responsibilities were shifted onto her shoulders, but she recovered herself and fought through the circumstances very bravely. She started an embroidery business because in Multan people like to wear embroider clothes in normal routine. She introduced her work first to her relatives than she started receiving orders from nearby areas. Now she collects orders from her nearby areas and provides them the finished orders on time to make a living for her family.  

She is the mother of two sons. One of her sons is doing a job abroad and other has a grocery store business in the local market.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity for his grocery store and improves his sales. Irshad is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive results in her sons’ business and his income will become increased.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: June

texts.en:
June is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, clothing and electricity bills.

She has operated her clothes-selling business for the past 10 years, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she operates a pharmacy shop which contributes to her other source of income. June faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards. With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cloth materials for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for resale

loans.name: Naranhuu

texts.en: Naranhuu Y. is 57 years old and lives with her husband and five children and grandchild in Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a teacher's apartment. One child is a university student and one child attends a local school. Naranhuu operates a bakery production business in her town with the help of her daughter. She produces a variety of pastries and breads and sells her products through the local market. She started her business in 1995 and has since gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. After almost 15 years of operation, her earnings have enabled her to provide her family and helped her daughter to get married. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase flour in bulk in order to make traditional cookies for the Tsagaan Sar, Mongolian lunisolar New Year festival.

loans.use: To purchase flour in bulk in order to make traditional cookies

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet F. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Juliet is married and has four adult-aged and two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a hog raising business. She has been engaged in this business for five years and earns approximately $115 a month.

In 2009, Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Juliet is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living situation.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

location.town: Tudela-Mayor Village Lapasan, Clarin Mis Occ

loans.name: Evarista Del Carmen

texts.es: Evarista casada, comerciante y agricultora, emprendedora, inicio su negocio con esfuerzo propio, tiene en proyecto mejorar el sistema eléctrico de la vivienda así también la diversificación de la finca con el cultivo rentable. Desde  hace tiempo atrás atenido ese proyecto pero por algunas dificultades que s ele ha presentado como la enfermedades y plagas que atacan a los cultivo ha invertido en productos de prevención. El préstamo que solicitad es para ser utilizado en la compra de Insumos y Fertilizantes para ser aplicado a los cultivos. Obteniendo productos de calidad  para venderlo a mejor precio y en mayores cantidad.
texts.en:
Evarista is a married woman.  She is a saleswoman, a farmer and an entrepreneur who started her business through her own efforts.

Evarista has a project to improve the electrics in her home and also to diversify her farm with profitable crops.  She has had this project for some time but she has faced some difficulties such as diseases and infestations which have attacked her crops and she has invested in preventative products.

Evarista is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers to apply to her crops.  This will help her obtain high-quality produce that she can sell in larger quantities and for a better price.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is a married woman with six children, two of whom graduated from school and four still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She owns real estate houses which has been in operation for the last ten years. Her potential customers are  tenants and neighbours. In addition she also makes natural juice to sell which contributes as a source of income.  Arafa hopes to open more businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase cement and sand to expand her real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cement and sand to expand her real estate houses.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a widow who lives in Calatrava, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  buy and sell of native materials and a banana & coconut business.  She has five children who are 11 to 31 years old.  Gloria  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1991 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gloria  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000 to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for her children's education and the needs of her family.  Gloria is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Ana Maricela

texts.es:
Ana de 19 años de edad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de ropa, golosinas y merienda, su familia la conforman su madre y hermanos, es soltera, tiene 4 años de dedicarse al negocio, ya que comenzó muy joven a ayudarle a su madre con el trabajo y a compartir los gastos del hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en el inventario de ropa nueva, golosinas, arreglos y cosméticos, este préstamo le permitirá variar el negocio, ofrecer diferentes productos, lo que pretende es tener un negocio fuerte, rentable y capaz de atender la demanda de los clientes.
El objetivo de Ana es crecer con el comercio, mantenerse con productos de calidad y que sus ventas mejoren para ayudar con una mayor cantidad a su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana is 19 years old and she lives in Puerto El Triunfo in the department of Usulutan. She sells clothing, sweets, and light meals. Her family is made up of her mother and siblings. She is single and she has 4 years in the business. She started when she was very young in order to help her mother with the work and to share the household expenses.

She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of inventory, including clothing, sweets, flower arrangements, and cosmetics. This loan will help her add variety to the business and to offer different products.  Her goal is to have a strong business that is successful and capable of meeting client demand.

Ana's objective is to develop her business and to keep have quality products so that her sales will improve. She will therefore be able to contribute in a larger capacity to the home.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of new clothing, sweets, flower arrangements, and cosmetics

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji, who is a father of five daughters and two sons, works in a settlement near his city and breeds chickens for sale in his backyard.

Naji took out a loan from FATEN to purchase chickens and increase his egg production and chickens sold which will enhance the financial situation of the big family he has.

Naji is photographed above.

loans.use: tp purchase chickens to breed and sell.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza C. Martínez y su esposo son una familia muy unidad que ven por el bienestar de sus hijos a los cuales quieren ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Esta pareja cuenta con 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar por lo que en este momento requieren de un préstamo para utiles escolares y pagar las colegiaturas de la institución educativa en la que en este momento cursan el año. Así de esta manera seguirá ofreciendo a sus hijos una mejor educación para que en un futuro obtengan una carrera académica.
texts.en: Lorenza C. Martínez and her husband form a very close family that looks out for their children's well-being and quality lifestyle.  This couple has three school-aged children and therefore are in need of a loan to buy school supplies and pay for tuition at the school where the children are enrolled this year.  This will allow them to continue their education in order to have a career in the future.

loans.use: To pay for school tuition and supplies

loans.name: Saline

texts.en:
Saline A. O. is a 40-year-old member of a group in Faulu Kenya. She is married and blessed with eight children.  

She is able to help her husband to raise the children because she runs a salon. She says that she gets a good number of customers in a day. Her dream is to open a wholesale shop for selling hair products. 

She has been guaranteed a loan of 60,000 KES with her group members in Faulu Kenya. She will use the loan to buy two hair driers and a hair blow drier.

loans.use: To buy two hair driers and a hair blow drier.

loans.name: María Rosalba

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad y después de trabajar durante años en una fábrica de confecciones, María Rosalía C. J. se quedó desempleada, situación que la obligó a crear su propio negocio. Con su máquina ubicada en su casa, sus manos y las ganas de seguir adelante para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, esta emprendedora empezó a confeccionar diferentes prendas de vestir sobre medida. 

María Rosalía espera seguir adelante con su negocio, ampliar su clientela y así mejorar sus ingresos. Actualmente esta emprendedora requiere de un préstamo para comprar insumos y telas lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Rosalía C. J., age 63, was left unemployed after many years of working in a clothing factory. This was the situation that has led her to start her own business. With nothing but her hands, a home sewing machine, and the desire to move forward, this entrepreneur started to manufacture various kinds of made-to-order articles of clothing.

Maria hopes to keep moving forward with her business, expanding her client base and increasing her income. Currently, she is seeking a loan to purchase fabric and other supplies that she needs in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and other other supplies

loans.name: Mwanaiki

texts.en:
Mwanaiki is a married woman with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop, selling paraffin and charcoal to her neighbours and passers-by. The major challenge she faces in her business is seasonality. Mwanaiki dreams of expanding her business and selling as a wholesaler in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase one gallon of paraffin and 50 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one gallon of paraffin and 50 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson has operated a bicycle garage business for the past five years. His customers are his neighbors and passers-by. His primary business challenge is seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing another garage in the future.

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase equipment for use in his garage.

Anderson and his wife have one small child who is too young yet to attend school. Anderson owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for use in his bicycle garage

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.es: Celedonio nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba(Cusco, Perú) y tiene 44 años de edad. Actualmente, Celedonio vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su pareja y sus tres hijos. Celedonio es chofer y se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en la ciudad del Cusco en su propio taxi, él trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche todos los días. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Celedonio requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro y para pagar la matrícula de sus hijos. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Caledonio was born in the city of Quillabamba (Cusco, Peru). He is 44 years old, and now lives in Cusco with his spouse and their three children. Caledonio works in the city as a chauffeur, using his own taxi. He works from 6 AM to 9 PM, seven days a week. He has been driving a taxi for several years now, and thanks to his work ethic, he has done quite well for himself. Caledonio needs a loan so that he can make some repairs to his taxi and pay his children's school fees. Because Caledonio is so responsible and hard-working, he was invited to join the Hatun Rumiyoc community bank, which is part of the Araiwa Association.

loans.use: to repair his taxi and pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is 35 years old and she is a fruit seller.  Her husband is a tractor driver and their income is $13 per day.  They have 2 children ages 13 and 15 years old.  All of the children are studying in school.  

Every month, she has to spend $25 on food, $10 on electricity, and $15 on school fees.  She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy more fruit to sell. She has a lot of costumers because she has been selling for almost 2 year now.  In the future she wants to extend her store to sell more fruits and she wants to repair her house.  For her children, she will send them to study at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Richard Vicente

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos  a Richard, tiene 24 años  de edad, está soltero y estudia para laboratorista clínico  en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí,  actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres. Para el este es su cuarto ciclo en el Grupo de Crédito y nos cuenta que le gusta ya que con los créditos él ha podido mejorar su negocio el mismo que le da lo suficiente para continuar sus estudios. 

El tiene un pequeño local en sus casa en donde vende varias cosas como helados, aguas, sodas, golosinas y además también tiene unas vitrinas donde exhibe ropa y zapatos de todo tipo, allí el trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 14h00 que tiene que ir a la universidad a seguir sus estudios, nos cuenta que le gusta su trabajo ya que además de ganarse lo necesario para sus gastos, este también le da el tiempo necesario para estudiar y cumplir con las exigencias que estos requieren. Su mercadería la compara en Portoviejo en un lugar que le dan ropa seleccionada y a buen precio, lleva con su local un año  y empezó con uno de los créditos pero desde hace cuatro años el ya vendía lo que es ropa pero puerta a puerta.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, zapatos, golosinas y todo tipo de productos que vende en su local.

Sus metas son terminar sus estudios y tener su propio laboratorio para ser útil a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Esteban' community bank meet in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 24 year-old Richard who is single and studying to become a laboratory technician in the Universidad Técnica de Manabí.  He currently lives in his parents' home.  This is his fourth loan cycle with his community bank and he tells us that he likes it because the credits have enabled him to improve his business which provides him with enough money to continue his studies.

Richard has small business premises in his home where he sells a variety of goods such as iced treats, water, soda and candies.  He also has some display cases where he displays all kinds of clothes and shoes.  He works there every day from 8.00am to 2.00pm which is when he has to go to university to study.  He tells us that he enjoys his work because, in addition to earning the money he needs to cover his expenses, it also gives him time to study and meet the demands that his studies place on him.  He buys his merchandise in Portoviejo, in a place that gives him selected clothes at a good price.  He has run his premises for one year and started out with one of his loans.  However, he has been selling clothes for four years (he used to sell door to door).

Richard will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, shoes, candies and all kinds of products that he sells in his store.

Richard's goals are to finish his studies and to own his own laboratory so that he play a useful role in society.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, shoes, candies, etc.

loans.name: Takku Liguey Liberté 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Takku Liguey est issu d'une classe d'alphabétisation dont les enseignements comportaient un module en création et gestion de micro- entreprise. Pour mettre en pratique les connaissances théoriques acquises et améliorer en même temps leurs revenus, cinq femmes de la classe se sont organisées en groupement et ont démarré des activités génératrices de revenus. La majorité d'entre elles faisaient de la restauration devant leurs domiciles respectifs ou elles proposaient à des clients le petit déjeuner et le diner, à base de céréales locales transformées. Cette activités leur permettait de satisfaire leurs besoins particuliers mais aussi de soutenir leurs maris dans la prise en charge de la famille. Beaucoup plus jeune que les autres,le chef du groupe (qui a la main levée)est âgée de 30 ans; Elle tient une table ou elle fait la restauration devant son domicile et reçoit des clients venus s'installer dans son quartier pour des besoins de travail. Elle a démarré son activité il y'a six mois seulement mais elle arrive déjà a générer des bénéfices qui lui permettent non seulement d'appuyer son mari en améliorant considérablement la qualité de l'alimentation de la famille mais aussi et surtout de satisfaire  ses propres besoins.  Deux mois après avoir ouvert un compte à l'IMCEC, le groupe sollicite en ce moment un prêt de 300 000F pour acheter du mil, des haricots, de l'oignon, des pommes de terre, du poisson et d'autres produits destinés à l'activité de restauration. Les cinq femmes ambitionnent d'implanter des restaurants construits en dur à la place des tables qu'elles ont installé à l'air libre et qui posent un problème d’hygiène.
texts.en:
The Takku Liguey group came into being during a literacy class in which a unit on creating and running a micro-enterprise was taught. In order to put the acquired theoretical knowledge into practice and at the same time increase their income, five women from the class organized themselves into a group and got started earning income. 

The majority of them sold cooked food in front of their respective houses where they offered breakfast or lunch to their customers, with dishes using locally processed cereals. These activities allowed them to satisfy their individual needs and also to help their husbands support their families. 

Much younger than the other group members, the group leader (who is raising her hand in the photo) is 30 years old. She has a table in front of her house where she sells food, and receives clients who come to her neighborhood seeking work. She started her activity 3 months ago but is already making profits that allow her not only to support her husband in order to considerably improve the quality of food her family eats, but also and especially to meet her own needs.

They opened an account at IMCEC and after having saved for two months, they are asking for a loan of 300,000 F to buy millet, beans, onions, potatoes, and other various products. Their ambition is to put up real buildings  to serve as little restaurants instead of the open-air tables they presently use which pose a problem of hygiene.

loans.use: to buy millet, beans, onions, potatoes and various other produce.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past seven years, Salome has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 60,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Sây

texts.en:
Farming is the most important part of 58-year-old Mrs. Sây’s daily work. She has been farming since 2003.

She and her husband have five children. Three of her children have already married and live separate houses.  The other two are working in a  sewing factory in Phnom Penh city where they earn a fixed salary each month. 

When planting season arrives, Mrs. Sây wants to buy rice seeds and fertilizer and to plow her field. Because of lack of money, she would like to request some funding from Kiva to buy seeds and fertilizer and to plow her field. Mrs. Sây is pictured in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer and to plow her field.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Hog-raising is fun, according to Lanie. Though it is challenging to clean out the pen on a regular basis, she may need to exert extra effort and patience in this field of work to generate income. She usually earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos (P) with each hog disposal. 

Lanie is now 36 years old and had three children to educate. But due to insufficient funds, she was not able to send them all to school. 

She is now asking for loan of P13,000 to buy hog feed, medicines and vitamins to ensure good nutrition for the hogs. With good nutrition for the hogs, she can offer them at a higher cost.

Someday, Lanie still hopes to save enough profits for the future education of her children. She would like to strengthen her hog-raising business to assure a brighter future for her family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines and vitamins to ensure good nutrition for the hogs.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.  Estudió sólo hasta 1ro de educación secundaria.
La señora se dedica  a la venta de carne, desde hace un ciclo trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por las suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de cuatro animales menores.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará ocho animales, ella los compra en las ferias de Juli, Zepita, Camicachi, luego los carnea  y vende la carne en el mercado de Ilave.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo quien también trabaja en la agricultura.
La señora desea crecer en el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, el ahorro y su ganancia
texts.en:
Filomena is a member of Central Vaquería Communal Bank, located in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno.  She is 42 years old and married with five children.  She reached only the first year of her secondary education.

Filomena sells meat.  She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for one loan cycle.  Her first loan was for the sum of 500 PEN, which she invested in purchasing four small animals.

With this new loan of 1,500 PEN she will buy eight animals.  She buys them in the markets in Juli, Zepita, and Camicachi, then butchers them and sells the meat in the market in Ilave.  Her children and her husband help her in the business.  Her husband also works in agriculture.

Filomena hopes to grow in the business and improve her income.

What she likes about the communal bank is the convenience of the loan, the savings, and her profits.

loans.use: to buy eight animals.

loans.name: Yuridia

texts.es:
La señora yuridia tiene 30 años de edad, y está casada con el señor cesar, con quien tiene 2 hijos Eduardo y Carmen de los cuales los dos estudian, el mayor está cursando el segundo año de primaria y la más pequeña primer año de preescolar, ella se dedica a la venta de colchas y blancos por catálogos desde hacen más de 8 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, porque está buscando la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y a sus pequeños con sus estudios, también para contar con una buena solvencia económica y una mejor vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como: sabanas, cortinas, edredones, toallas, fundas para almohadas y salas, etc. Y así tener un poco mas surtido.
Doña Yuri (así es como le dicen sus compañeras del grupo), comenta que el más grande propósito que tiene para su negocio, es el de hacerlo crecer  mucho mas, ya que quiere construir un local y poner su tienda de blancos, puesto que así aumentara sus ganancias, para asegurar la educación de sus hijos.
Ella está muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva y FRAC, por esta ayuda que les están ofreciendo, ya que les beneficia muchísimo.
texts.en:
Yuridia is 30 years old and married to Cesar.  The couple have two children, Eduardo and Carmen, who are both in school.  The eldest is in his second year of elementary school and the youngest is in her first year of pre-school.  Yuridia sells bedspreads and other home products through catalogs.  She has been in this business for more than eight years.

Yuridia says that she decided to start out in this business because she was looking for a way to support her husband with their household expenses and  pay for their young children's education.  She also wanted to be in a good financial position and enjoy a better quality of life.

Yuridia invested the loan that she received in buying more merchandise such as sheets, drapes, comforters, towels, pillowcases, cushion covers, etc.  This helped her to stock her business a little better.  Yuri (as she is known by her fellow group members) says that her biggest goal for her business is to grow it a lot more.  She would like to build premises and set up a store selling home products.  This would increase her profits and guarantee her children's education.

Yuridia is very grateful to Kiva lenders and FRAC (Fundación Realidad A.C.) for the help that they are providing as it benefits her a lot.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as sheets, drapes, comforters, towels, pillowcases, cushion covers, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 49 years old and married to Henry.  The couple does not have children. For the last 10 years, Grace has owned rental houses.  She earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000.  

Grace was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a registered client of the organization.  She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the full amount of the loan to renovate the houses.

She will use her anticipated profits to build more rental houses. In the future, Grace plans to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Regine

texts.en:
Regine is 41 years old, married, and has five children between 6 and 18 years old. 

Regine owns a boutique selling various goods such as cosmetics, sugar, biscuits, etc. This is her 11th successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 5 a.m. until 11 p.m. every day.

Regine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying various goods such as cosmetics, sugar, toilet paper, etc., to sell. With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and build a secure future for her business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cosmetics, sugar, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Katiusca Eugenia

texts.es:
Katiusca, se dedica a la venta de mercadería como perfume, los señores, cremas con ella vive con su madre y hermanas, tiene un año de estar en el negocio, trabaja todos los días de la semana.
Ella está solicitando préstamo para la compra de dos cajas de mercadería entre ella cremas, lociones, maquillajes, con esta inversión podrá mejorar la disponibilidad para ofrecer al cliente.
La aspiración es mantener el negocio en un local propio, generando mayores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Katiusca lives with her mother and sisters, and works selling merchandise like perfume, lotions, and creams.  She has had the business for a year.

She is requesting a loan to buy two boxes of merchandise, including creams, lotions, and make-up.  With this investment she will be able to improve  availability for her customers.

Katiusca's goal is to have the business in a suitable place, generating greater income for the family.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of merchandise: creams, lotions, and make-up.

loans.name: Monrovia Group

texts.en: Esther, who is in her early 40s, is married with five children, all of whom are still in school. She also takes care of her father. Esther has been running a clothing shop for fours years now. She works from 8 am to 7:30 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be her 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Esther used the previous loans to buy a plot of land, pay school fees and household expenses, improve her shop by inserting more shelves and increase her stock of clothing. She has paid back all her loans successfully. Esther is requesting a loan to increase her clothing stock. Her dream is to one day be able to open a wholesale shop. She will share this loan with her loan group "Monrovia", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is 53 years old and has seven children who range in age from 12 to 35. She is a widow who earns a living by running a general store. She is applying for this loan to buy rice, sugar, beans and sorghum to sell to her customers. She plans to use the profits made possible by this loan to renovate her house and pay her children's school fees. She dreams of one day owning a large, successful store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gredel

texts.es: Gredel, de 41 años, es una mujer buena, amable y alegre, esta casada y fruto de su matrimonio tiene dos hijos de 21 y 20 años, vive en una casa propia en donde comparte sus días a lado de sus dos hijos y su esposo con quien trabajó mucho para poder brindar lo mejor a sus hijos, ahora les esta brindando educación y es por eso que trabajan a diario para que no les falte nada. El trabajo de Gredel, consiste en la venta de diversos productos, entre las cosas que vende son productos de belleza, perfumería, cosméticos, y más, además de ropa de moda que trae de la ciudad de Lima y los deja en crédito entre sus amigas, vecinas, familiares y compañeros de trabajo. Además de tener esta actividad, también es profesora de un centro educativo de la ciudad, lleva realizando estas actividades por 18 años y le esta yendo muy bien. Se inicio con su actividad cuando vio la necesidad de poder solventar sus estudios, ya que aún era estudiante y necesitaba tener algunos ingresos, poco a poco fue progresando, hasta que egreso y pudo también trabajar en lo que había estudiado, pero aun así siguió con la venta de cosméticos ya que le brinda buenas ganancias. Tiene muchos planes a futuro, espera poder seguir trabajando y generando buenos ingresos a su hogar, pero por el momento traerá más productos y así empezar a agrandar su negocio. Este será el crédito número 1 con MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y espera poder compenetrarse rápidamente con su banco comunal del cual tiene muy buenas referencia por el compañerismo y solidaridad que existe entre ellos. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará productos de belleza, cosméticos y perfumería para poder vender, además de algunas prendas para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Gredel, 41, is a good, friendly, and happy woman. She is married, and from this marriage she has two children, 20 and 21 years old. She lives in her own house where she spends her days at the side of her two children and her husband, with whom she worked hard in order to be able to provide the best to her children. Now she is providing them an education, and for that reason she and her husband work every day so they don't lack for anything. Gredel works selling various products; among the things she sells are beauty products, perfume, cosmetics, and more, as well as fashionable clothing that she brings from the city of Lima and sells on credit to her friends, neighbors, family members, and coworkers. In addition to this, she is also a teacher at an educational center in the city. She has been doing this work for 18 years, and it is going very well for her. She started with it when she needed to be able to cover the cost of her studies, since she was still a student then and needed to have some income. Little by little she made progress until she graduated and was able to also work in the area she had studied. Even so, she continued selling cosmetics, since they bring her a good income. She has many plans for the future. She hopes to be able to continue working and creating a good income for her household, but for the moment she will bring in more products and in this way begin to expand her business. This will be her first loan with MFP, so she hopes for your collaboration so that she can realize her plans. On the other hand, she promises to make her repayments on time, and she hopes to quickly develop a good relationship with her communal bank, of which she has heard very good things due to the comradeship and solidarity that exists among its members. With the amount requested of 1000 soles, she will buy beauty products, cosmetics, and perfume in order to sell them, as well as some clothing to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She has three children, all of whom are in school. She owns a second hand clothes boutique that has been in operation for the past four years. Judith also runs a 'second hand household items' store. She joined Kiva partnet, Milango, to access credit. Judith is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase a stock of school bags, bed sheets and bed covers. 

The main business challenge is price fluctuation, but Judith looks forward to open a larger store in future. She will use the extra income obtained from the business to pay school fees and to provide health care to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of school bags, bed sheets and bed covers.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 31 years old, and has a common-law husband with one child. Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Elvira has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 10 years, and also earns an income from fruits and vegetables vending.  Elvira aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 71 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children. 

Milagros has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Milagros has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Milagros hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sumaiya

texts.en: Sumaiya wants a loan to buy new clothes for resale. She is a 28-year-old woman living in Masindi, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family rests on her, and her dream is to own a boutique and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: El señor Juan José Gonzales  vive en el barrio Urkupiña  de la zona de el Plan 3000 él vive en la casa de uno de sus hermanos en alquiler no cuenta con esposa ni con hijos, él cuenta con un vehículo el cual lo trabaja en una línea de trufis que hacen el servicio a las provincias. Trabaja desde que amanece hasta que anochece en su vehículo pero en a línea que trabaja el paga un alquiler por la línea el pide el préstamo para poder comprarse una línea de este sindicato ya que el no conoce muy bien la ciudad el no trabaja de transporte de taxi por este motivo, y como la línea en la que trabaja es una sola ruta esto le facilita el trabajo, así no hay riesgos de perderse en las calles de la ciudad ni tampoco memorizarse los nombres de las calles para saber donde estar ubicado.
texts.en:
Juan José Gonzales  lives in the Urkupiña neighborhood in the Plan 3000 zone. He lives in one of his brothers houses where he pays rent. He does not have a wife or children. 

He owns a car which he drives on a trufi route [fixed route taxi] that services the provinces. He drives from dawn till dusk. 

However he has to pay rent on the route that he drives. 

He is asking for a loan to buy a route from this union. 

He does not know the city very well and does not want to work as a taxi driver. 

Since his work is just one route it makes his job easier. There is no risk of getting lost in the city streets and he doesn't have to memorize names of streets in order to know where they are located.

loans.use: to buy a transportation route

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.ru:
Баргигул жизнерадостная женщина 49 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3-их детей. Баргигул живет со своей семьей в сельской местности. У Баргигул большое хозяйство. Кроме огорода у нее еще есть крупнорогатый скот. Который требует очень большого внимания. Ведь от купли продажи скота Баргигул получает очень хороший и постоянный доход. Она покупает на базаре скот, хорошо ухаживает за ним и перепродает его. А полученное молоко Баргигул продает соседям. Так Баргигул зарабатывает на жизнь.
Сейчас Баргигул хочет расширить свой бизнес. Для этого ей понадобились деньги. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. 
Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.

loans.use: to buy a cattle

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther A., a 33 years old woman she is from a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells food items to people in her environment, married with six (6) children. She needs the above loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kadi

texts.en: Kadi is 46 years old and married, although she has no children of own she is taking care of her brother's 2 children.  They are living in a rented house and her husband is unemployed.  Kadi started her business as a hawker and later established a small stall in the open market for selling mainly onions and palm oil.  When she joined SMT, she expanded her business in the same market where she was given a larger space for selling by the city council.  As her business progresses, she would like to diversity her stock for more profit. She hopes to own her own house one day.

loans.use: Diversify her inventory at her stall in the local open market.

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.es:
Deolinda is 39 years old, has been married for 20 years and has three children, all minors and still in school. Her husband has been the chauffer of a locally well-known businessman for three years and used to be a traveling salesman.

While her husband was a traveling salesman, Deolinda was a housewife but wanted to contribute to the household. After her children were born she saved some money and invested in a little kiosk in their neighborhood (a residential area in Carapeguá) because there wasn’t a store that sold staple products. Today her business is one of the biggest stores in the neighborhood and most people living in the area buy their products from her because her store offers all staple products and other various products.

She started to work with Fundación Paraguaya a few years ago and joined a women’s group of microbusinesses in her neighborhood call “Kuña Guapa” (fighting woman). In the group there are 15 members that work together to make weekly payments towards their loans. They are jointly responsible for all of their loans.

Today Deolinda hopes to further expand her microbusiness and is asking for a loan of $150 that she will use to purchase wholesale products like pasta, sugar and dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Deolinda tiene 39 años, está casada hace 20 años, tiene tres hijos, todos ellos menores y están en edad escolar, su marido es chofer particular de un conocido empresario de la zona hace tres años, anteriormente el señor se dedicaba a las ventas ambulantes.

Mientras su marido se dedicaba a las ventas ambulantes, la señora era sólo ama de casa, pero ella quería aportar con los ingresos de la casa y como nacieron también sus hijos, ella junto unos ahorros y los invirtió en la instalación de un pequeño kiosco, ya que en el lugar donde están (zona de viviendas populares de Carapeguá) faltaba un negocio de donde se pueda comprar los productos de primera necesidad. Hoy en día es una de las Despensas más grandes del barrio, y de ahí se surten casi todos los habitantes del vecindario, ya que ofrece todos los productos de primera necesidad y otros productos varios.

Ella empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya hace un año atrás, asociándose a un Comité de Mujeres que se formó en su barrio, el grupo de microempresas se llama “Kuñá Guapa” (mujer luchadora), conforman el grupo 15 socias, trabajan todas juntas, pagan semanalmente por los préstamos adquiridos y la responsabilidad del crédito es solidaria.

Hoy día Deolinda está deseosa de seguir viendo progresar su microempresas, por lo que solicita un crédito de $ 150 que lo invertirá en la compra de productos para la venta al por mayor como fideo, azúcar y lácteos.

loans.use: to buy wholesale pasta, sugar and dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more second hand shoes stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar is a 26 year old single man who lives in Khachmaz town. He and his brother (pictured) have been in  business for a year. They buy sheep to fatten for sale in market. Now they need a loan of  $850 to buy 10 sheep.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Nalongo's Group

texts.en: Nalongo has a piggery. In addtion she practises farming on a small scale. She intends to use the extra profits to buy manure to add to her farmland and also hire more land for cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en: Mehman H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 58 years old, married and has five children. He drives a taxi and this business is his family's only income. He needs a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase necessary spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica is an admirable woman possessing the desire to work and the vision to launch new businesses. At her short 20 years of age, she runs three shops in a market. Until four years ago, she worked helping her mother selling food. When her mother heard about the inauguration of a new market, she didn’t hesitate to propose to her daughter that she ought to begin to sell produce from a market stand. Jessica was eager to work and immediately accepted her mother’s proposal. Besides, more income for her family would not have been a bad thing. She has four children and many hopes for them. They are the motor that pushes her the most. Now, she has two produce stands and a book store that has been open for two months with the help of her husband. Her objective is to expand over the next months and buy a photocopier.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Las ganas de trabajar y la visión de emprender nuevos negocios hacen de Jessica una mujer admirable. A sus cortos veinte años maneja tres puestos de venta en un mercado. Hasta hace cuatro años trabajaba ayudando a su mama vendiendo comida. Cuando su mamá se enteró de la inauguración de un nuevo mercado no dudó en proponerle a su hija que empezara a vender verduras en un puesto. Jessica tenía ganas de trabajar así que acepto de inmediato la propuesta de su mamá, además, un ingreso más a su familia no le hubiera ido mal. Ella tiene cuatro hijos y muchas esperanzas en ellos, ellos son el motor que la empuja a crecer más. Ahora tiene dos puestos de verduras y una librería abierta hace dos meses con la ayuda de su esposo, su objetivo es ampliarla en los siguientes meses y comprar una fotocopiadora.

loans.use: Expand her new book store.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Sr. Raúl Martínez Saucedo is single and lives with his parents. He and his mother work together in a corner store owned by Raúl. The business is located in a section of the house.

The business is four years old, and Raúl runs it with the help of his mother. She is very energetic and obliging. With the income from this business, they have been able to open a second store in which they sell goods such as toys, household items, and clothing. This store is located in the town’s municipal market.

They are asking for a loan to buy a freezer and a refrigerator so that they can carry a greater quantity of cold drinks to sell in the store. By doing this, they will increase their sales and earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Raúl Martínez Saucedo es soltero, y vive con sus padres. Raúl trabaja junto con su madre en una bodega que es de Raúl. El negocio está ubicado en un predio de la casa.

Dicho negocio tiene una antigüedad de cuatro años, el cual atiende con la ayuda de su madre, que es una persona muy activa y, además, con buen carácter. Gracias a las ganancias que ha dejado este negocio, han podido abrir otro en donde venden artículos de mercería como juguetes, artículos para el hogar, ropas entre otras cosas; esto está ubicado en el mercado de Municipal de la ciudad.

Solicitan el crédito para la compra de un congelador y una heladera que les facilitará tener mayor cantidad de bebidas bien frías para la venta, esto ayudará a aumentar las ventas y obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer and refrigerator

loans.name: Sadatu

texts.en:
Sadatu is married and has one child. She is thirty years old. She buys millet, beans and maize in bulk and then sells them to her community.

Sadatu travels to the northern part of Ghana (a twelve-hour drive) to buy her products. She wants to use her loan to buy more millet, beans and maize, because she has run out of stock. She also wants to buy a in larger quantities to avoid price hikes and to reduce her frequent travels to the north.

Sadatu is a member the group called “Agyenkwa Nyame” (meaning "Soul Saving God"). Members agree to support and guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Sadatu holding her baby in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more millet, beans and maize.

loans.name: Annet Wani’S Group

texts.en:
Annet W. is a 38-year-old married mother of four children. She also takes care of her brother’s children, all of whom are in school. She lives and works in Kawempe, an urban neighborhood of Kampala.

For the past 10 years, Annet has worked as a tailor, a skill she learned at school and has turned into a profitable business. Using fashion charts that show different styles of clothes, customers come to her shop to select the type of outfit they want, either bringing their own material with them or choosing from the inventory Annet has in stock. In particular, she makes clothes from bitenge, material printed with colorful patterns worn by men and women throughout Uganda. She says it takes her three hours to make a full dress. he number of customers varies from day to day, but December is her busiest month, so much so that she doesn’t have time to eat lunch.

Annet has been a member of MCDT for five years and has paid back four previous loans. Before receiving a loan from MCDT, Annet says it was difficult to get capital for her business. The loans have helped a lot. She will use a new loan to buy more material so that her customers have more to choose from. Although her future is “God’s guess,” she says she would like her business to be larger than it is now.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of fabric

loans.name: Vaioalisi

texts.en: Vaioalisi F., 47, is married with six children. She has many years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the village and general public 4 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. Vaioalisi expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Vaioalisi's earnings will be used to improve her business and help out with family expenses.

loans.use: Vaioalisi would like to improve her business, make some repairs to her home and and help pay her childrens' school fees.

loans.name: Tatu's Tusife Moyo Group

texts.en:
Tatu is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children. She became a clothing seller in 2005. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$110.

Tatu now hopes to receive a loan to buy more clothes for sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Zuwena who owns and runs a cafe.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Daysi, de 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, que es su mas grande razón para salir adelante. 
Es de profesión profesora de educación primaria (activa), además, en su domicilio dicta clases de reforzamiento, atiende a niños de 6 a 12 años. Por su buen desenvolvimiento y metodología, cuenta con varios alumnos, atiende solo por las tardes, actividad que realiza hace 3 años y le está yendo muy bien. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es estar con los niños a quienes enseña, y que sus padres se sientan satisfechos de ver el progreso de ellos, y que puedan aplicar sus avances en su centro de estudios.
Daysi trabaja para los gastos diarios y la educación de su hijo.
Con el dinero que solicita quiere alquilar un local para el dictado de sus clases de reforzamiento y así, brindar una mejor comodidad a sus alumnos.
texts.en:
Daysi, 44 years old, is a single mother. She has one son and he is her main reason for wanting to get ahead. She is a school teacher, and she gives reinforcement lessons at her place to kids between 6 and 12 years old. Because of the methodology that she uses and her good work she has several students. She teaches them in the afternoon, and she has been doing that for the past 3 years, and she is really getting ahead. The thing that she likes more about her job is that she gets to spend time with the kids that she tutors, that the kids can apply what they learn in their class, and that their parents are very satisfied with the progress their kids are making. Daysi works in order to cover her daily expenses and provide for her son's education. With the loan that she is requesting she would like to rent a space so that she can give classes there and therefore bring more comfort to her students.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a place where she can tutor and make her students more comfortable.

loans.name: Mrs. Poen Eth's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Poen E.'s Village Bank and its members are located in Peareach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.Mrs. Peon E., president of the village bank, is a 40-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are enrolled in the local school. She owns a small plot of land on which she can cultivate rice for a living. In her plantation, she now faces an obstacle because the soil is infertile and has led to declining crop yields. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Peon E. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to better support the field.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers in order to increase crop yields

loans.name: Mov

texts.en: Mr. Mov H. was born in 1959 and now lives in Steung Ping in Kampong Cham Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Nhoem Ni Yeap, are farmers who cultivate both rice and vegetables. With the revenue, he can purchase very little because he owns a small piece of land. Mr. Mov H. is the father of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the youngest one is attending the local school. Although, Mr. Mov H.’s family members are involved in different businesses, they still do not have enough money to support their field when they face problems. Therefore, Mr. Mov H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pumping machine. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water pumping machine for his farm

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.en: Enyonam F. is a wife and mother of five children who are currently in school. She is a 40-year-old trader who trades in charcoal and bags of gari.  Charcoal is a very popular cooking fuel in many traditional Ghanaian homes. She has been in this business for the past 3 years. Through her business, she has supported two of her children through senior high school. Enyonam obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Tema and sells it at retail to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more charcoal and bags of gari to increase her stock. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children. She belongs to the community group called Morning Star Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and bags of gari.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a 42-year-old woman, married with 6 children. She sells timber. She started this business in 2004. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more timber to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more timber to sell

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es:
Maria Feliz D.
