Ramírez tiene la edad de 68 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Maria tiene 5 hijos de los cuales su hijo varón de 43 años y trabaja como técnico automotriz su otro hijo varón de 42 años trabaja por cuenta propia este otro hijo de 41 años de edad trabaja como técnico agrónomo y trabaja en el Ingenio San Antonio su hija mujer de 39 años de edad es enfermera y trabaja en el Ingenio San Antonio y su hija menor de 27 años y trabaja como ingeniera de el laboratorio de Monte Rosa, su esposo no labora, sus propósitos son de mantener activo su negocio por lo que tiene que mantenerse ya que la situación esta cada día mas difícil, sus deseos ya los cumplió que son de ver a sus hijos casados y formados profesionalmente y trabajando para sus familias por lo que ahora sus sueños son de ahorrar dinero ya que su esposo no labora y tiene que seguir luchando para su beneficio.


Su actividad económica es la de servicio de de transporte de acarreo personal, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años, Doña Maria inicia este negocio con la ayuda de su esposo ya que tenían que sacar a sus hijos adelante y fue por idea de su esposo quien le ayudo al empezar el negocio su esposo conducía el camión ya que el trabaja en el Ingenio San Antonio por lo que lograron tener ingresos alquilando el camión destinado al traslado de la caña por lo que así fue fácilmente darse a conocer por lo que así consiguió mas clientes y fue así que obtuvo su negocio  pero debido a que su esposo ya no puede trabajar es Doña Maria quien se hace cargo del negocio y es por eso que quiere salir adelante con su esposo y es por eso el motivo del financiamiento es para repara el camión ya que necesita darle mantenimiento y comprar piezas que son necesarias para el buen funcionamiento del mismo.
texts.en:
Maria Feliz D. R. is 68 years old, married, and has 5 children. A son of 43 years is an automobile mechanic; another son of 42 is self-employed, a son of 41 is an agriculture technician working at the San Antonio Estate, a daughter of 39 is a nurse, also working for the San Antonio Estate, and her youngest daughter of 27 is a lab engineer at the Monte Rosa laboratory. Her husband is unemployed. Her business is transportation. It was initially a family business started 15 years ago, where both her husband and herself worked together, he driving and renting their truck for the transportation of sugar cane. Mrs. Maria is in charge of the business now, and she would like to obtain funds to make repairs to their truck in order to keep it in good working order, because this is now their only source of income, since her husband is no longer able to work, and times are hard. Now that her children are well established, her main aspiration is to support her husband and to maintain the business alive.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Benoit

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
D. Benoit a 44 ans et il a 2 enfants, Sandra et Justine, les 2 sont scolarisées. Il vend des boissons depuis 20 ans, et il les achète au dépôt de Vodgè, un quartier de Cotonou. Le revenu de ses autres crédits lui a permis de payer les frais de la scolarisation de ses enfants. Dans le futur, il voudrait commencer par vendre aussi les jus de fruits.
texts.en:
Benoit D. is 44 and has 2 children, Sandra et Justine, both enrolled in school. He has been selling drinks for 20 years, and he buys them in the depot at Vodgè, a neighborhood in Cotonou. The profit he made thanks to his previous loans has permitted him to pay the school fees for his children. In future, he would like to begin selling fruit juice as well.

Benoit is requesting this loan from Kiva partner, Alidé. The meaning of Alidé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "another path always exists for the most poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa beside Nigeria, where the GNP per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to very vulnerable clients and it is in a group which will soon be beginning a micro health insurance program.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Aline

texts.es:
La señora Aline A. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Villa Pavón, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Daniel Vásquez y sus dos hijos.
La señora Aline es secretaria en un consultorio medico particular, y su esposo es empleado en una veterinaria de su zona.
Con el crédito anterior construyeron dos habitaciones en obra fina, las que están habitando.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una cocina y el pasillo de ingreso a su vivienda.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Aline A. lives in her parent's house, located in the Villa Pavón area on the west side of La Paz, with her husband Daniel Vásquez and her two children. Aline is a secretary in a private medical office and her husband is an employee in a veterinarian's office. With their previous loan they build the two bedrooms that they are now using. The loan that they are requesting is to be used for building a kitchen and an entrance walkway to their house. This is the second time that they have requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis performed favorably qualifies them to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a kitchen and entrance walkway to their house

loans.name: Ngy

texts.en:
Ngy N., 50, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband work collecting palm juice to sell and to refine it to sugar palm. Together they make about US$7 in revenue per day. They run a small stand selling palm juice, beer and meat. This couple has four children, two of whom are construction workers and two who are in school.

Ngy N. needs a loan to expand her business and make more profit to raise their standard of living. She will use the loan to purchase beer and meat to sell.

loans.use: To purchase beer and meat.

loans.name: Habibudin

texts.en: Habibudin is the son of N. and he lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 45 years old and married. There are five members in his household and all of them benefit from his income. He has a retail shop in which he sells different kinds of things. He would like to expand his business by buying more products to sell in his shop, things that are in demand at the market but not currently available, so he has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani (AFN) for the term of 12 months.  He would like to say that Kiva is an effective process.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: Vidal es padre soltero, tiene 41 años y vive junto a sus 4 hijos; Félix de 16, Leandra de 14, David de 13 y Erika de 8 años, quienes son el motivo fundamental de todos sus esfuerzos. Los días de Vidal comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su inseparable motocarro sale en busca de clientes que deseen ser transportados hasta su destino, sus servicios son muy solicitados por los vecinos de su barrio, ya que en cualquier urgencia que tienen, él siempre está presente para transportarlos. Lleva 4 años en este trabajo y lo que más le gusta es conversar con otros mototaxistas mientras espera a que alguien tome sus servicios, ya que esto hace más ameno su día. Vidal espera más adelante comprar otro motocarro para alquilarlo y así generarse nuevos ingresos, lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene que trabajar todo el día y no puede ver continuamente a sus hijos a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios. Este es el tercer préstamo de Vidal con MFP, es muy conciente de que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, para no perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en arreglar las fallas mecánicas que últimamente está sufriendo su motocarro.
texts.en:
Vidal, 41, is a single father living with his 4 children who are the fundamental motivation for all his efforts: Felix, 16; Leandra, 14; David, 13; and Erika, 8. Vidal's day begins very early in the morning, when with his inseparable three-wheeler, he goes out searching for clients wishing to be transported to their destination. His services are very sought-after around his neighborhood, since no matter how rushed they are, he is always there to carry them. He has been doing this work for 4 years, and what he most enjoys is conversing with the other moto-taxi drivers while they are waiting for somebody to use their service, making his day pass more pleasantly. Vidal hopes in the future to buy another three-wheeler to rent out and thus generate additional income. What he likes least about his work is that he has to work all day long and is not able to watch over his children all the time, to whom he greatly desires to give a good education. This is the third loan Vidal has taken through MFP, he is very aware that he has to make every payment on time in order not to be detrimental to the other members of his communal bank, where he is very beloved because of the responsibility he demonstrates. The $175 he is requesting will be invested in repairing the mechanical problems his three-wheeler has recently been suffering.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of his three-wheeler

loans.name: Marlena

texts.es:
La señora Marlena es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 33 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios superiores incompleto (educación primaria). Vive en el Barrio Vizcachani.
Trabaja desde hace 4 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos (descanso un año por motivos de viaje), Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos  soles. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos, mazamorras, gelatinas. 
Ella desea construir su casa.  Manifiesta que le gusta la forma en que trabaja Manuela Ramos, sobre todo los ahorros y las charlas que imparte.
texts.en:
Marlena is a member of the “Las Fronterizas” Communal Bank in the Desaguadero District of Chucuito Province, in the Puno Region of Peru. She is 33 years old, married with one child and has some secondary school education. She lives in the Vizcachani neighbourhood.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 4 years (she took one year off to travel). Her first loan totaled 300 nuevos soles. She runs a small grocery store and, with this loan of 1000 nuevos soles, she will purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, mazamorra and jelly.

She wishes to build her own house. She says that she likes the way Manuela Ramos works and especially appreciates the savings advice and training lectures the organisation gives.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, mazamorra and jelly

loans.name: Delnie

texts.en:
Delnie L. makes a living primarily from raising pigs for sale. She is 31 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Delnie has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Delnie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Delnie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Delnie is now requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Delnie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cultivating maize

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth M. is a young mother residing in Barangay Sinili, Santiago City. She is engaged in charcoal and vegetable vending as her way of assisting her husband in providing for the needs of their family. She is married to Marlon, a tricycle driver who also works as a farmer. They have two children and all they want is to give them a better life. Through their hard work and patience, they believe that they will succeed in life. Their two children are Reymark - 2 years old and Rachelle - 2 months old.

Bernadeth would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 for the improvement of her vending business. This amount will be of great help in fulfilling her plans for her business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es: Hortencia tiene 49 años, su prioridad, como toda madre, es el desarrollo y crecimiento de su hijo, ya que es madre soltera y vive con su único hijo en su casa, trabajando con mucho esmero por brindarle lo mejor. Desde muy joven se dedicó a la venta de cosméticos y siempre ha tratado de brindar lo mejor de su trabajo, reflejo de esta dedicación es el cargo de empresaria que tiene dentro de la línea de belleza. Por esto, tiene como responsabilidad trabajar con un grupo de jóvenes muchachas a quienes orienta y ayuda para que logren sus metas de ventas. Esta actividad la realiza todo el día, tratando siempre de tener un espacio de descanso para estar con su hijo, siendo lo más difícil las horas de supervisión que realiza por las tardes, pues tiene que verificar la cantidad de los pedidos que se realizan. Ahora, Hortencia tiene proyectado abrir un bazar en su casa, donde instale vitrinas para exhibir sus productos e incrementar sus ingresos, sin salir de su hogar. Los 6 créditos que tiene con Microfinanzas PRISMA le han permitido mejorar sus ingresos económicos, pero sobre todo, le ayudaron a mejorar su trabajo como miembro activo de su banco comunal, el cual se formó hace 3 años. Los 1800 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de vitrinas para colocar sus productos y para adquirir mayor cantidad de productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Hortencia is 49 years old. As any mother, her priority is the development and growth of her son. Since she is a single mother and lives with her only son, she is committed to work very hard to provide him with the best. She has been selling cosmetics since a very young age and has always sought to do the best she can. This determination reflects in the responsibilities that she assumes in the cosmetics line. For that reason she is in charge of a group of young girls to whom she gives guidance on the best way to achieve their sales objectives. She performs this activity throughout the day, always trying to take a break to be with her son. Her greatest difficulty is the supervision time in the evening when she must check the placed orders. Now Hortencia plans to open a store in her home, where she will install showcases to display her products and increase her income without leaving her home. The six loans that she has had with Microfinanzas Prisma have enabled her to increase her income, but above all they have helped her to improve her work as an active member of her community bank, which was formed three years ago. Hortencia will invest the 1800 nuevos soles of her loan in showcases to place her merchandise and in more cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy showcases

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn and peanuts

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 25 años, es una joven muy decidida, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vejez tranquila. Su negocio son los tejidos artesanales, ella aprendió esta actividad desde muy pequeña cuando ayudaba a su madre a terminar los tejidos que le solicitaban, actualmente tiene su puesto en la explana Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido por sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y más a un si son artesanías, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los tejidos hasta su puesto, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y le genere mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el primer préstamo de Lourdes con MFP y espera pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y no meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy activa. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar su producción y ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 25, is a very determined young woman. She lives in her parents’ house, and her biggest desire is to give them a peaceful old age. Her business is woven handcrafts. She learned this activity when she was very small. She helped her mother finish weaving orders. Lourdes currently has a stall in the Laguna Temporal plaza (place where there are fairs in the city of Juliaca). It is very busy with customers. What she likes most about her work is weaving – even better if it is handcrafts. She has been doing this for five years. The hardest part is transporting her weaving to her stall. But, she knows that this is her work, and she has to do it. In the future she hopes that her business grows and generates better income. This is Lourdes’ first loan with MFP. She expects to make all of her payments on time and not cause problems for the members of her community bank. She is a very active member of her community bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy more wool to increase her production and offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Niriam

texts.es:
La señora Niriam G. Q. tiene 27 años. Tiene 1 hija de un año de edad, y su marido no vive con ellas por que por cuestiones económicas tuvo que ir a trabajar a Argentina ya que no lograba conseguir trabajo en Bolivia.

La señora Niriam vive en la casa de su madre ubicada en la zona de Maica Central en Cochabamba, en su domicilio es donde tiene su ganado lechero con el cual produce leche. Toda la producción de leche entrega diariamente a una señora que elabora yogurt y otros productos lácteos. Su mama es quien la ayuda con el cuidado de las vacas ya que su marido no está para ayudarle como siempre, y con un bebe de 1 año es complicado hacerlo sola.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de ganado lechero para poder incrementar la producción actual de leche que tienen, y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y por consecuencia su nivel de vida. La señora Niriam espera poder incrementar su ganado de tal forma que gane lo suficiente para contratar a alguien que la ayude con el cuidado de las vacas y así no tener que depender de su mama la cual ya es una persona mayor y también poder darle más atención y cuidado a su bebe.
texts.en:
Señora Niriam G. Q. is 27 years old and she has a daughter who is a year old. Her husband does not live with them for economic reasons; he had to go to work in Argentina because he could not find work in Bolivia. Señora Niriam lives in her mother's house which is located in the Maica Centra area of Cochabamba. She has dairy cows on the property which produce milk. All of her milk production is delivered daily to a woman who makes yogurt and other dairy products. Since her husband is away her mother helps her care for the cows which, with a 1-year old baby, is difficult for her to manage on her own. The loan will be used for the purchase of dairy cows in order to increase her production of milk, and this way she can improve her income and as a consequence her standard of living. Señora Niriam hopes to be able to increase her earnings such that she is able to earn enough to hire someone who can help her with the care of the cows, and this way she would not have to depend on her mother, who is an older person. Also, this way she could have more time to give attention and care to her baby.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Amanbek

texts.en: Amanbek is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  His oldest son attends the local secondary school while the younger two children attend kindergarten. Amanbek operates a raw material trading business in his local market. He began the business in 1999 and continues to trade raw materials such as sheep and goat skins to local retailers. In 2008, he also began to trade meat and meat products in order to supplement his income. This business is the only source of income for Amanbek’s family and he is determined to expand his customer base and product offerings in order for his family to become financially secure. He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD) loan to purchase more sheep and goat skins, meat and supplies for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep and goat skins, meat and supplies

loans.name: Charmilyn

texts.en:
Charmilyn C. is from the village of Bacnor East, Burgos, Isabela, and is happily married to Reynaldo. They are gifted with two children as fruit of their love. Their main source of income is farming, but it is not suitable for emergency cases when it is not time for harvesting. Charmilyn operates her own business direct selling  Avon, Natasha, and MSE cosmetics and apparel products. At the same time, she sells frozen food for an extra source of income. She looks for customers around her village to buy her products.

Her husband works in their fields. Their yield serves them for their children's expenditures in school. Her husband also works for someone else for extra income if he has time. Sometimes Charmilyn is also doing activities in their fields to help her husband. At present, her customers are increasing but her capital is insufficient to supply all her customers' orders. She wants to have more income because her family expenditures have increased. She wants to borrow the amount of 13,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders to be able to buy more items to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 30 years old, an ordinary villager of Barangay Caritan, Tuguegarao City. She is married to Jhun G., 34, a local tricycle driver. They are blessed with two gifted children: the elder is Jhon Llyod, 11 years old, a grade V pupil. The younger is Jersey Joy, 10 years old, a grade IV pupil. Both of Joy's children are enrolled in a public school in their community. The couple hopes that their children will also finish their college degree.

Motorcycle transport is the primary source of income for Joy and her husband Jhun. Aside from the transport business, Joy is also engaged in raising native chickens to earn extra income.

For the continuous development of their motorcycle transport business and her poultry business. Joy is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 from KIVA lenders. She hopes that her loan will be approved so as to enable her business to grow and earn more profit.

loans.use: additional capital for business development

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a native of Cagayan. She is 49 years old and married to Alfonso B. Jr. who is a local farmer in their village. They are blessed with seven children. Four of the children are married and the others are still studying in a local school in their village.
Cristina manages her mini-grocery store in their community with her husband in order to provide a good education for their children.
She alternates her household activities with retail trade. She needs to be patient to use her time to be able to provide the needs of her family, especially when it comes to their educational needs.  She buys her commodities in Mariton, Tuguegarao, Cagayan once a month.
According to her, she has been in business for over ten years and she tries to maintain it for the sake of her children. Cristina is requesting a loan of Php15,000 from KIVA lenders for the maintenance and continuous development of her business. She hopes that her business will be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her mini-grocery business

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun N., 49, has been selling dried fish in market for years. She is married with a teenage child who attends school. Her husband operates a trailer-motor taxi. Bun N. wants to increase her current income by also selling plastic items, but she doesn’t have money to purchase inventory. She is therefore applying for a loan to be used as the needed capital.

Bun N. was not available when the photo taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase plastic goods for resale.

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en: Tsend-Ayush is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in a ger district on the outskirts of the city. Her two daughters both attend a local secondary school and Tsend-Ayush and her husband operate a traditional shoe business. She began her business in 2004 and produces 4-5 pairs of shoes per day. Her working capital now exceeds 800,000 tugrugs (~560 USD) and she would like to expand her business in the future. This is her second loan from Xac Bank, Kiva’s MFI partner. Tsend-Ayush is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan in order to purchase fabric and materials for her shoe business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, trabaja en la Policía Nacional desempeñando el cargo de policía en seguridad Ciudadana.
Su domicilio se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz vive en la casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para educación (pago de un curso de actualización para policías). Con este curso la señora tendrá la posibilidad de mejorar sus ingresos ya que le ascenderán de cargo.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en  el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Martha works for the National Police, fulfilling the obligations of the police in city security. Her home is located in the Tembladerani district of the city of La Paz. She lives in the house of her parents. The loan will be used for education, to pay for a continuing education course for police officers. With this course, she will have the possibility of improving her income, since she will rise to a higher position. This is the fourth time that she has asked for a loan from IMPRO. Her record qualifies her as a good client in the payment of her debts.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos. Primero trabajaba de manera dependiente, pero luego se propuso tener su propio negocio, por lo que arrendó un terreno de suelo arcilloso para fabricar sus ladrillos. Actualmente, su esposo es quien trabaja a tiempo completo, y ella lo hace medio día para poder velar por sus hijos. Asimismo, cuenta con el apoyo de algunos de sus familiares para la fabricación de los ladrillos y ella se encarga de la comercialización.

Esta es la octava oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y hasta el momento se siente muy contenta de ser parte de un banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra los materiales necesarios para la fabricación de ladrillos, tales como aserrín y arena fina.
texts.en:
Elena, 30, lives with her husband and two children in her own home. For the last 10 years she has manufactured bricks. At the beginning, she was employed by someone else but then, she decided to become independent and set up her own business. She leased a lot that was rich in clay to start her brick making. Currently, her husband works the business full-time and she does half-time so that she can look after her children. In addition, some of her relatives help her make the bricks and she sells them. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she is happy to be part of a communal bank. The funds requested will be used to buy supplies, like sawdust and fine sand, needed to make bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase brick-making supplies.

loans.name: Djidé

texts.fr: Djidé C. est une femme de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NEMATABA depuis 6 ans et demi et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 13 fois de suite. Elle fait un petit commerce d'arachide. Son objectif est d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en nourriture et santé.
texts.en:
Djidé C. is a 56 year old married woman and the mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the Nemataba Villagers Bank for the past 6 and a half years. She is well experienced in the loan process, having benefited from 13 in a row. She has a little peanut shop. Her goal is to improve her families living conditions through food and health.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capital

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es: Francisca del Carmen G. D. M. D. 56 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive en compañía D. su esposo quien se dedica a ayudarle con el negocio. DesD. hace 10 años que francisca posee su propio negocio, en el cual comercializa pollo, alitas y medallones D. pollo empaquetado, y así mismo embutidos, tales como salchichas y jamón. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual siempre ha tratado D. mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio, situación la cual le ha sido difícil, debido a que casi todas las ganancias las invierte en los gastos D. su hogar. Es por esta razón que Francisca solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. pollo, esto debido a que entre mayor cantidad compre, menores serán los precios por obtenerlo, lo cual le trae muchos beneficios a Francisca, ya que podrá obtener  mayores ganancias y así mismo podrá invertir más en el negocio.  Ella es una mujer muy responsable, la cual tiene muy buenos valores morales, por lo cual es muy querida en el mercado Regional D. Usulután, en donD. está ubicado su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca del Carmen G. D. M., age 56, resides in the Usulután department of El Salvador. She lives in the company of her husband, who is dedicated to helping her with her business. For the past 10 years, Francisca has had own business in which she sells chicken, chicken wings and packaged cuts of chicken, as well as cold cuts such as sausage and ham. She is a very hard-working woman who has always tried to improve the shape of her business, a situation that has been difficult given that she spends almost all of her income on household expenses. For this reason, Francisca is requesting a loan so she can buy a larger quantity of chicken. With a larger quantity of chicken, the price to buy it will be lower, which would allow Francisca to benefit by earning more revenue and at the same time be able to invest more in her business. She is a very responsible woman and has very good moral values and therefore is well-liked in the Regional D. Usulután market, where her business is located.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken meat

loans.name: Rona-E-Darakht Shing Group

texts.en:
Marzia is a member of Rona-e-Darakht Shing group. She is 30 and has 3 children who go to school. She lives in the 1st district of Kabul, Afghanistan. She works with her husband. He has a fruit shop. When he buys fruit, Marzia cleans it and packs it and her husband sells it in his shop at retail price. She is glad that she can support her husband in his business and that they can live together happily. She needs the loan to purchase more different kinds of fruit.


She hopes the business will grow soon so that her children will have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to expand the business

loans.name: Preab

texts.en:
Preab S. is married and resides with her children in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She has five children. She is engaged in the agriculture sector as a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a security guard for a private company, earning an income of $3 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: Buy cows

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
B. Elias is a reserved 41-year-old married father of four children. He has been operating his pork business in Kabagareme in Bushenyi district for over ten years.

Elias started his business by rearing one pig. From then onwards, his business has grown to the extent that he has been able to educate all his children. In a month, Elias reveals he makes close to 500,000 shillings. He also makes some additional income through selling firewood.

Elias’s future plans are to expand his business by buying more pigs. With this loan he is optimistic that his blueprint future projects will materialize.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Unidas En El Trabajo Group

texts.es:
En una oportunidad Yudi recibió la invitación  de una señora  para vender productos de belleza  al principio le pareció un trabajo difícil ya que nunca había vendido nada, pero se dio cuenta que en su barrio nadie ofrecia ese tipo de producto es así que empieza a vender entre sus vecinos,amigos y familiares. poco a poco le empiezan a comprar y  su clientela aumenta de modo que obtiene ingresos con los que ha podido ayudar en los ingresos familiares, tiene trabajando 3 años, le va muy bien por que cumple  y  entrega los pedidos a tiempo, aparte de dar  facilidades de pago a sus clientes.
Para el futuro quiere tener un bazar donde pueda ofrecer sus productos  a mucha gente, sabe que para lograrlo tiene que seguir ahorrando.  Yudi junto a 9 socias forman el grupo “UNIDAS EN EL TRABAJO” ella es la presidenta, tienen mas de 1 año juntas todas son comerciantes y vecinas del mismo lugar, ella invertirá su dinero del préstamo para comprar mas productos de belleza  para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.

* Yudi esta con polo a rayas,en la foto aparece una señora mas como invitada.
texts.en:
Yudi was invited by a lady to sell beauty products. At first this seemed like a difficult job since she had never sold anything before, but she realized that no one in her neighborhood offered this type of product, so she began selling to her neighbors, friends and relatives. Little by little they started to buy from her, and her customer base grew so that she earns enough income to be able to help with household expenses. She has been working for three years, and it has gone very well for her because she fills and delivers her orders on time. She also offers credit to her customers. In the future she wants to have a store where she can offer her products to many people. She knows that to achieve this she has to keep saving. Yudi and nine other members form the "Unidas en el Trabajo" ("United in Work") group. She is the president. They have been together for more than a year. They are all businesswomen and neighbors. Yudi will invest her part of the loan in purchasing more beauty products to fill her customers' orders. * Yudi is in the striped shirt. Another woman also appears in the photo as a guest.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Wilson Daniel

texts.es:
el señor Wilson Daniel M. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora Reina Isabel Rivas con quien han procreado tres hijas, tienen vivienda propia, Reina le ayuda a Wilson en la venta de dulces y galletas, dicha actividad que realizan desde hace 2 años.
el señor Wilson se a dedicado tambien al negocio de taxi pero lo vendio y esta alquilando el numero. ahora se dedica a vender dulces y galletas en las pulperias y confiterias de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, vende al por mayor,  viaja en su carro pickup y visita lugares foraneos donde no entran distribuidores de estos productos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas confites y galletas.

This borrower has taken out one or more previous loan(s) with Prisma Honduras, some of which may have fundraised on Kiva.  At the time the information for this loan profile was compiled, the borrower was also interviewed and photographed for the journal update from the previous loan, so you may notice that the picture is the same.
texts.en:
Wilson Daniel M., 34, lives in a free union with Reina Isabel Rivas with whom he has three daughters. They live in their own home and Reina helps Wilson sell candy and cookies, an occupation they have been in for two years. Wilson has also provided taxi services in the past but he sold his vehicle and now leases the one he has now. He currently is dedicated to selling candy and cookies to stores and snack shops in the city of San Lorenzo; he sells at wholesale traveling in his pick-up to visit outlying places where distributors of these products do not supply. He will use the funds to buy more sweets and cookies. This borrower has taken out one or more previous loan(s) with Prisma Honduras, some of which may have fundraised on Kiva. At the time the information for this loan profile was compiled, the borrower was also interviewed and photographed for the journal update from the previous loan, so you may notice that the picture is the same.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candy and cookies.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men N., 41, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells fruits and vegetables for an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 4 per day.  N. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a new motorbike so her husband can transport grilled eggs for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s schooling.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Marca Valle Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal marca Valle inicia su segundo ciclo con 13 socias que pertenecen al distrito de Lircay, Comunidad de Perccapampa en el departamento de Huancavelica, la actividad principal de la comunidad es la agricultura (papa, haba, choclo).
Leona es socia del Banco Comunal  Marca Valle, este ciclo apoya en la junta Directiva de su Bancomunal en el  cargo de Secretaria. Ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos dos varones y dos mujeres, los cuales estudian en la Escuela de la Comunidad. 
Leona trabajo desde muy niña, ya que quedó huérfana a temprana edad. Leona inicialmente, vendía quesos y huevos, ahora gracias a sus préstamos y cuenta con más capital, se dedica a la venta de carnes y animales mayores. Agradece los prestamos que recibe porque le han permitido crecer en su negocio y las capacitaciones le han ayudado a ahorrar y ser puntual en sus pagos.
Leona necesita un préstamo, con el cual comprara 02 terneros flacos, los cuales criará para engordar hasta que puedan venderse, esto seguramente será todavía en noviembre. Leona trabaja muy duro, ya que quiere que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales. Su sueño es tener sus vacas grandes y lecheras.
texts.en:
The Marca Valle cooperative bank starts its second cycle with 13 members from the district of Lircay, located in the Huancavelica region. The principal activity in this community is agriculture (potatoes, beans, and corn). Leona is a member of the Marca Valle cooperative bank, serving on the executive committee this cycle in the role of Secretary. She is married, and has 4 children, two boys and two girls, who are studying at the local school. Leona has worked since she was a girl, as she was orphaned at a young age. Initially, Leona sold cheese and eggs and now, thanks to the additional capital from the loans, she dedicates herself to selling meat and livestock. She gives thanks for the loans she has received, because they have allowed her to save and to make her payments on schedule. Leona needs a loan to purchase 2 calves that she will raise until they’re ready to sell, which probably would not be until November. Leona works very hard, as she wants her children to complete their studies and become professionals. Her dream is to see her cows grow strong and become milk-producing.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 calves.

loans.name: Valeh

texts.ru:
Valeh jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On rodilsya v 1966 qodu. Valeh bejenec iz Fuzuli qoroda. Seycahs jivet v Absheron regione.v Etom biznese on uje 16 let. 

On uje odin raz bral dengi u Kivi i za eto ochen blaqodaren Kive cto oni pomoqli emu razvit eqo bizmnes. No kak vi znayete s kajdim dnem vixodit vse noviye produkti tovari. Poetomu on seychas xochet vzat 2000 AZn chtobi kupit bolshe novoy produkcii dlya razvitiya eqo biznesa
texts.en:
Valeh is married and has 2 children. He was born in 1966. Valeh is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli. Currently, he lives in the Absheron region. He has been in this business for 16 years. Valeh already borrowed money from Kiva once and is very grateful to Kiva that they helped him develop his business. But, as you know, new types of products get released every day. This is why he wants to borrow 2000 AZN today in order to buy more new products for expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new products

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Robelyn Y. is from the barangay (district) of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old and married to Rolando Y., a sales manager of Nature Spring Water Incorporated. She is blessed with 3 young children. Robelyn is presently engaged in a business selling dried fish and longganisa (sausage). She also has another business buying and selling junk bottles, plastics and scrap metals. She additionally receives support from her husband's salary. Roselyn has been involved in these businesses for 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from them.

In 2007, Robelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. An active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program, Robelyn has successfully repaid a loan of 3,000 PHP. She is now requesting an amount of 5,000 PHP as her 5th loan,  to be used for additional capital for her two existing businesses. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the businesses to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use and the children’s education, loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansions. 

About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her two businesses: selling dried fish and longganisa (sausages) and buying and selling junk bottles, plastic  and scrap metal

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene, de 51 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto del amor tiene tres hijos, Carlos, Lerner e Iris de 6, 5 y 3 años respectivamente. Juntos viven en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en al localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tienen su casa propia. Cuando era muy joven, sus padres sufrieron una recaída en su producción agrícola y desde luego que sus ingresos se reducieron a tal punto que no tenían ni para comer. Con el tiempo incursionaron en el rubro de la carpintería, de esa manera se valió para sobrevivir, actualmente su pareja le ayuda en todo los aspectos, y fruto del esfuerzo incansable obtuvieron su premio.  Hoy tiene bien posicionado su carpintería en su localidad, en donde ofrece todo variedad de muebles, que ellos mismo fabrican. Es por ello que percibe buenas ganancias económicas con respecto a los años anteriores y reconoce que la clave de su éxito es el amor al trabajo. Normalmente trabaja con su esposo y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, solo que en temporada necesita de operarios con el propósito de que lo pueda agilizar en la fabricación de muebles. Su rutina diaria es a partir de las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche y su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma localidad. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su carpintería, con la finalidad de que pueda producir a gran escala muebles de todos los estilos y formas, según los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Este es su decimocuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual augura cumplir fielmente con su cronograma de pagos, además está satisfecho con su grupo comunal, por las buenas relaciones que existe en cada uno de sus socios. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de madera como: tornillo, caoba, y quinacho con la finalidad de que pueda producir muebles a cantidades considerables, para que así pueda vender su producto a un precio justo.
texts.en:
Irene, who is 51 years old, lives with her partner and the fruit of their love, three children, Carlos, Lerner and Iris. Their children are 6, 5 and 3 years old respectively. They live together in their own home in the Santa Rosa neighborhood of the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle. When she was very young, Irene's parents suffered a decline in their agricultural production. Because of that, their income was reduced to the point that they didn't even have food to eat. With time, they ventured into the area of carpentry, and they managed to survive. Currently, her partner helps her in all aspects, and due to their tireless efforts, they were granted their reward. Today their workshop, where they sell a wide variety of furniture that they make themselves, is well positioned in their neighborhood. Because of that, they earn a good profit, compared with earlier years. Irene recognizes that the key componenet of their success is their love of the work. She normally works with her husband, and together they make a good team, but at times they need additional workers to speed up the fabrication of the furniture. Their daily routine starts at 8:00 in the morning and lasts until 8:00 at night. Their point of sale is in the same nieghborhood they live in. Her future plans are to expand her workshop, with the goal of producing all styles and shapes of furniture on a large scale, according to the likes and preferences of her customers. This is her fourteenth loan with MFP, which shows that she will loyally comply with her re-payment time line. In addition, she is satisfied with her communal group, with the good relationships that she has with each of the members. With the loan she is requesting, she intends to invest in the purchase of wood, such as tornillo, mahogany and quinacho, with the goal of producing large quantities of furniture so she can sell her products at a fair price.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is a used goods trader. She sells her wares at a stall in the busy Campbell Street of Makeni. She is married to an active trader and has four dependents. She was initially financed by her husband nine years ago to commence trade in used clothing. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 to buy additional used clothing to sell.

She hopes to use the proceeds of her loan to educate her children to university level as well as to support her husband in his efforts to build a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for her stall

loans.name: Yadira De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La Sra. Yadira de los Ángeles S. es trabajadora activa del Colegio “Escuela Monte limar” San Rafael del Sur tiene  Veinte y cinco  años de trabajarle a esta institución desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación primaria. Ha tenido  diez créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar su casa de habitación, los créditos le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Yadira de los Ángeles S. is an employee of the "Monte Limar" school located in San Rafael del Sur where she has worked for twenty-five years as a primary school teacher. Yadira has had ten loans with CEPRODEL all of which were used for the purchase of construction materials and making improvements to her home. The loans have been a great help to Yadira since they allowed her to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sand, cement, gravel, construction labor

loans.name: Margaret Mugure

texts.en:
Margaret has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha town for the past six years. She is 26 years old, married to James Ngang'a and they have one child.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid her first loan well and in good time. She is planning to diversify and start selling cereals, which include green grammes (mung beans), peas, rice, maize and beans. She will use the loan amount to buy the cereals in large quantities.

Margaret hopes to build a shop, in future, from which she will be selling her products.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Bayanbat

texts.en: Bayanbat N. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two young sons in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His wife stays at home taking care of their two sons. Bayanbat operates a shoe sewing business. He began his own business in 2003 with help of his mother and since 2008, he has been operating his shoe making business by himself. Over the years, he has managed to build a stable operation and his earnings have enabled him to improve his family's standard of living. He has used his earnings to purchase new furniture and electronic products for his home. In the future, he hopes to expand his business. He is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more materials such as leather, fabric, heels and glue for his shoe sewing business.

loans.use: Purchase more materials for shoe sewing business

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng R., 42, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia: an area known for being the most populated area in the country. R. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. His wife prepares fabrics at home, earning an income of about USD 2.5 per day. The family has to spend USD 75 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month. 

R. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a tuk tuk to improve his business as a tuk tuk driver. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. 

R.'s wife appears in the photograph while she is preparing fabrics at home.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk

loans.name: Turuu

texts.en:
Turuu T. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and son in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent in a rented yard. His younger son lives on his own and his older son works for World Vision, International Non-Governmental Organization. 

Turuu operates a taxi service in his town. He started driving a taxi after working as a carpenter for several years. For the future, he hopes to start another business alongside his taxi service to supplement his income. 

Turuu is a very honest and friendly man. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase winter clothes at wholesale prices to sell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothes, wholesale, for resale

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian M. M. is 33 years old, single and has no children. She makes a living selling porridge in different areas in Mombasa, a city on Kenya's coastal region which is well-known for its many tourist attractions and white-sand beaches. She has been in this business for the last three years and enjoys serving the local population. Her business is profitable, although she must move around constantly to find new customers. But she is determined to work very hard and has applied for a Kiva loan for Kes 80,000 to buy more grain to mill and sell as cereals.  She hopes to grow her business and become a supplier of cereals to a larger group of customers. She describes herself as welcoming and friendly.

loans.use: to buy flour to mill and sell as cereals

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is a resident of Multan, which is Pakistan’s fourth largest city and famous for its history and tombs. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area named Rahim abad, which is a small housing colony of the city. 

Surriya is a businesswoman and operates a small boutique at her home. She makes beautiful embroidered clothes and supplies them to different shops and other boutiques. She does this business to financially support her family. She remains conscious about the future of her children. That’s why she works very hard to fulfill their basic needs and to save money for their futures. 

She is married to R. R. D., who is an electrician by profession. He provides electrical repair services to his clients and generates income for the family.  Surriya has 3 sons. Her eldest son works in a private company for meager income. Another son has a mobile shop in the market. He sells different mobile phones and accessories to his customers. Her youngest son is studying in 6th class. 

Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her boutique business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery items such as beads, colored thread, clothes and sketches in bulk quantity, which will help her to make more embroidered dresses to serve more clients. She is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her boutique business and she will increase her household income. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that this step will be a profitable one for her business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for her boutique business

loans.name: Eleazar Rafael

texts.es:
Eleazar es un joven dedicado a la costura que trabaja junto con su mama, oficio que aprendió juntos a sus padres.
Trabajo que hacen en su casa de habitación hoy reconocidos por su buen trabajo en la costura. Comenzó con poco capital. Lo que comienza a buscar financiamiento siendo Afodenic quien ha dado sus créditos  y que atreves de esto logro aumentar su producción en ropa.
Con este nuevo financiamiento invertirá en la compra de tela, en diferentes colores y estilos. Contento porque cuenta con el apoyo de su mama, así como el financiamiento financiero de la institución.
Como planes es lograr la captación demás clientes para obtener mejores niveles de ventas.
texts.en:
Eleazar is a young man devoted to tailoring. He works alongside his mother, having learned the trade with his parents.

He works at home and is recognized for the good quality of his tailoring. He started out with little capital. He began to seek financial funding through Afodenic who granted him credit and thus enabled him to increase his production of clothing.

With this new loan he will purchase fabrics of various colors and styles. He is happy because he has the support of his mother, and the financial funding of the institution. His plans are to secure additional customers and achieve higher levels of sales.

loans.use: He will buy fabric in various colors to increase his production

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida B. is a widow who lives in Brgy. Poblacion, Ginatilan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: selling scrap materials and sacks and selling soft and hard drinks. She has five children, who range in age from 10 to 31 years. Florida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Florida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon helped her earn a monthly income of 33,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she could continue to save up for the future security of her family. Florida B. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel nacido el 25 de febrero  en Santa Cruz vive en Sombrerito tiene su parcela que trabaja agricultura también se dedica al siembra de plantas de cítrico como ser naranja, mandarina, achachairu el tiene 3 hijos pero todavía son pequeños, su esposa es ama de casa que esta al cuidado de sus hijos, ella se  dedica a la venta de achachairu, mandarina y naranja después comercializan sus productos en el mercado de el Torno y la Guardia, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para la compra de semillas, plantas de cítricos  y también para el pago a los peones por el trabajo de preparado de la tierras, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Daniel was born February 25th in Santa Cruz and lives in Sombrerito where he has agricultural land. He also works planting citrus trees such as oranges, tangerines and achachairu. He has three children who are still small. His wife is a housewife and cares for the children. She works selling the achachairu, tangerines and oranges and later they market the products in the markets in Torno and Guardia. The money from this loan will be used to buy seeds, citrus plants and also to pay laborers to prepare the lands. Mr. Daniel is a very hardworking person and is grateful with the institution for offering help.

loans.use: To buy citrus plants

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin C. P.: tiene 29 años,se dedica a la agricultura desde hace años el se dedica tambien en a la ciltivacion de maiz, y leña el tambien bende carbon por costales el dice que en ese negoco le a ido bien ya que a tenido un incremento en su ganancia y en su capital, el solicita el credito para poder comprar fertilizante para abonar la milpa y comprar tambien plantas de cafe, para sebrar y asi poder lograr su sueño que es poder vender maiz y cafe por mayor.
texts.en: Martin C. P. is 29 years old, and has been a farmer for a number of years.  He cultivates corn, and also sells firewood and sacks of coal.  He says that this business has gone well, since he has seen an increase in his profits and in his capital.  He requests a loan so that he can buy fertilizers for his cornfields, and also so that he can buy coffee plants to cultivate.  In this way he can realize his dream, which is to be able to sell corn and coffee at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee plants

loans.name: C7449 Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
Leonard is 24 years old and is single. Leonard currently works in a shop in Kanazi district.  He takes care of two relatives who are between 8 and 25 years old. He runs a well-organized small store which sells various products, such as rice, sugar, soap, etc. He has been operating it successfully for three years, and his shop is open from 6am to 7pm every day.

Leonard is the leader of this group, called 'DUTERIMBERE' in the local language, which means "to be developed". The group consists of two men and eight woman. 

The group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more products for their boutique so that they can provide better service to their customers. The loan will impact the group members by helping them to purchase larger quantities of stock, which will allow them to earn more profits. With the extra income they all earn, Leonard and his group hope to save some money and to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a married woman who lives in Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a food or vegetables stall, a carinderia (small eatery) and a tricycle transport business.  Her husband Renato, who is 47 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are 13 to 35 years old.  Jessie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 26 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jessie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  Great sales at the Caravalan market for vegetable produce are on Wednesday and Saturday. This time, for her 27th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to use to buy stock for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and home repairs.  Jessie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and materials for her food stall

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: Pablo Emilio de 39 años, casado, es originario del departamento de Carazo, de oficio transportista lleva 3 años en este negocio. Inicio cuando tenía 37 años en ese entonces el no tenia los suficientes ingresos para proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario, hoy en día tiene su propio taxi, que lo alquila y las personas que lo manejan le entregan una cantidad la final del día. Actualmente Solicita el crédito es para comprar un juego de llantas y repuestos necesarios para su carro. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta tener otro vehículo, para obtener más ganancias.
texts.en: Pablo Emilio is 39 years old and he is originally from the department of Carazo. His occupation is public transport and he has been in the business for 3 years. When he started out he was 37 years old and back then he did not have sufficient income to provide his family with what they needed. Today he has his own taxi and he rents it so that other will drive it and he will earn a percentage at the end of the day. He requests a loan to purchase a set of tires and to carry out maintenance repairs to the car. Among his plans for the future is to have another vehicle in order to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a set of tires and to carry out maintenance repairs

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson would like a loan to pay school fees for his children.  He lives in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda and his dream is to educate his children to attain a degree as a minimum qualification.

He is a farmer and has been farming for ten years and the proceeds have helped him in paying school fees for his children.  He desires to become a successful farmer and export his produce.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Naydia

texts.es:
la sra. Naydia G. L. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la colonia Luis Zuniga de la ciudad de tegucigalpa y se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosmeticos y productos de uso personal, Naydia se levanta todos los dias temprano para salir a vender su mercaderia, trabaja de lunes a domingo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de  calsonetas, camisetas, trajes de baño, blusas, faldas, lociones, cremas, cosmeticos, shampoo, acondicionador, jeans.
desea tener variedad de productos para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes, ahorita tiene un pedido de ropa para verano con el cual obtendra buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Naydia G. López, 41, lives in the Luis Zuñiga neighborhood in Tegucigalpa.  She sells clothes, cosmetics and personal use items.  Naydia rises early every day to go out to sell her merchandise.  She works Monday through Sunday.

She will use the loan to buy underwear, t-shirts, bathing suits, blouses, skirts, lotions, creams, cosmetics, shampoo, conditioner and jeans.

She wants to have a variety of products available to cover all her customers’ needs.  She currently has a pending order for summer clothes that will produce good profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. lives in the Ntinda neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, two of whom are in school.  

Hadjah has a business selling raw food. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products at the market.

She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and ever-increasing prices of food. 

Hadjah has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of cassava, yams and sweet potatoes.   Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to run a wholesale-only business .

Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of yams, cassava and potatoes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, reside en Lolotiquillo, departamento de Morazán, se dedica al destazo de ganado y cerdos, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 6, 4 y 1 año de edad, Carmen lleva cuatro años dedicándose al destazo de animales, la cual realiza una vez por semana, dicha actividad la aprendió de su padre.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo que le permita comprar ganado y cerdos para el destazo, otra parte necesita invertirla en la preparación de tierra para sembrar maíz, esta será una gran ayuda para él pues tendrá animales para seguir en su negocio y al mismo tiempo cultivara para la alimentación de su familia.
Su objetivo es darle a su familia un mejor futuro, que sus hijos tengan acceso al estudio y puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in Lolotiquillo in the department of Morazan. He is a butcher of cattle and pigs. He lives with his wife and three children, aged, 6, 4, and 1. He has been butchering livestock for four years, working once per week. He learned this business form his father.

He currently needs a loan to purchase cattle and pigs to butcher. He will invest another part to prepare his fields to cultivate corn. This will be a great help for him because he will have livestock with which to continue his business. He will also cultivate for the family's consumption. 

His objective is to provide his family with a better future, so that his children will have access to education and to have an opportunity to improve themselves.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Somoe

texts.en:
Somoe is a married woman with two school-going children. They live in a house that they own. It has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sacks of sugar and jerrycans of paraffin for resale. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sacks of sugar and jerrycans of paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is a 52-year-old farmer from village Maghlaki, Imereti Region, West Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Maya, their 24-year-old son and 23-year-old daughter. 

The only source of income for the family comes from their agricultural business, where all family members are involved. They have two milk cows, produce cheese and sell it to local retailers. They also have a greenhouse where tomatoes (in the summer period) and greens (in winter) are grown. Amiran sells tomatoes and greens to vegetables exporters. Along with the above-mentioned they have a plot of the land where greens and watermelons are grown. They sell watermelons to local retailers. 

Amiran requested credit for construction of another greenhouse. Demand on the market will allow him to sell more greens and vegetables and almost double the income of the family. 50% of the increased profit will be reinvested in agriculture and the rest will be used for covering household costs – purchase of furniture and renovation work.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en:
Batdelger is 38 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in his older brother's backyard. They live in Songinohairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His wife is a sales person who operates her own grocery store. 

Batdelger manages a goldsmith business at a rented booth at a trading center called Duuhee. He started his business in 2009 and has been able to stabilize his business. Now he is one of the experienced businessmen who managed to build a strong customer base. He is planning to have his own workshop in the near future. 

He is a polite man who says, "I am planning to save my earning in order to buy a plot of land where I can build a house for my family." He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a plot of land for his family use.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is engaged in retail. She imports women’s shoes and bags from abroad and sells from a rented booth at the city market. Trading is the family’s main source of income. Mariam has to renew the stock regularly, and that requires additional financial investment. With the loan’s help Mariam will be able to increase the trade, meet clients’ demands and sustain her family.

loans.use: to pay for shoes.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 56 years old and is a married woman with 6 children. She is a farmer who tills land in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She grows rice and vegetables. Cirila sells her harvest at her town's market. As well as farming, Cirila also owns and manages a sari sari (variety) store. She sells items like shampoo, soap and other daily use products.

Cirila has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Cirila hopes to have a stable business to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Haja Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Haja Ramatu. She is married with six children aged 6, 9, 11, 14, 16 and 20 years old. In 1982, Haja Ramatu established her cosmetics/jewelry business.
Haja Ramatu was introduced to this type of business by her Aunty. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 
Haja Ramatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock (jewels and body cream).  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately Le 300,000. 
In the future, Haja Ramatu plans to buy land, educate her children and open a big cosmetics shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and body cream for her business.

loans.name: Kadongo

texts.en:
Kadongo is a married man with three school-going children. He owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over twenty years, he has operated a poultry selling business. His potential customers are neighbours and town dwellers. In addition, he also operates a goatmeat business, which contributes as his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. His major dream is to expand his business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: El Cinco 2 Group

texts.es: Maria Aracely tiene 33 años de edad, es comerciante, miembro del Grupo Solidario El Cinco 2, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hijas, y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad El Cinco en el municipio de Olanchito. Maria inicio a vender ropa y sandalias hace dos años gracias a una de sus amigas, ya que ésta se dedicaba al mismo negocio y entonces le recomendo a Maria comprar donde sus proveedores y estos le dieron un buen precio. Su negocio no tiene nombre porque diariamente realiza sus ventas de forma ambulante, parte desde muy temprano por la mañana y recorre las calles de su comunidad y algunas comunidades aledañas. Su mayor dificultad no es el clima, ya que llueva o haga sol ella siempre sale a ganarse algun ingreso para el sosteniemiento de su familia, sino la mucha competencia. Maria solicita este financiamiento para comprar variedad de ropa para niños (as), mujeres y hombres, sobre todo estilos que estan a la moda y adecuados para el clima lluvioso. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su negocio estara mejor surtido y asi podra ofrecer a sus clientes mayor diversidad. Su meta es ver a sus hijas graduandose en la universidad y tener un local propio. Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Sus compañeras de grupo Maria Juana se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y Edelmira a la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
texts.en: Maria Aracely is 33 years old and a businesswoman. She is a member of the solidarity group called “Five 2”. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She has two children and together they live in the El Cinco Community in the Olanchito municipality. For the past two years Maria has sold clothes and sandals. She learned the business thanks to one of her friends, who is in the same business. Her friend recommended that Maria buy the necessary supplies, which the company sold to her at a good price. Her business doesn’t have a name, as she is a roving salesperson. Early in the morning she begins selling in the streets of their community and in neighboring communities. Her main difficulty is not the weather, as even if it is raining or hot she always goes out to try to earn sales in order to support her family. Maria is asking for this loan in order to buy a variety of clothes for children, women and men. She wants to buy the latest styles and clothes for the rainy climate. With the support of this loan her business will offer a greater variety of goods. Her goal is to see her daughters graduate from university and have their own place. This is her first loan with FAMA and she hopes to pay her payments on time. The fellow members of the group are Maria Juana, who sells cosmetics, and Edelmira who sells second hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been a farmer for the last 11 years. He is 31 years old, married and blessed with two children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. 

Being this is his third loan, he plans to spend it to purchase farm supplies. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dreams are to be the best and most well known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Duo Peña De Oro Group
