texts.es: Duo Peña de Oro. este grupo esta conformado por Vivian Isabel de 36 años de edad casada y tiene dos hijos ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas siendo ella la lider de este grupo y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz para la elavoracion de tortillas,al igual que la siguiente socia ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y esta solicitnaod este credito para la compra de maiz par la elavoracion de tortillas el sueño de ellas es darles lo mejor a sus hijos darles estudios para que en el futuro sean uno profecionales.
texts.en: Duo Peña de Oro. este grupo esta conformado por Vivian Isabel de 36 años de edad casada y tiene dos hijos ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas siendo ella la lider de este grupo y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz para la elavoracion de tortillas,al igual que la siguiente socia ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y esta solicitnaod este credito para la compra de maiz par la elavoracion de tortillas el sueño de ellas es darles lo mejor a sus hijos darles estudios para que en el futuro sean uno profecionales.

loans.use: Compra de maiz para la elavoracion de tortillas para la venta.

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es: Jhony, de 28 años habita en la comunidad nativa Santa María. Ahí formó su familia junto a Anita, su esposa desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, a los que cuidan en su casa propia. Desde joven comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura; sus principales cultivos constan de café, plátano, achiote y maíz; los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos de cultivo. Cuenta que tiene 2 hectáreas, los cuales adquirió gracias a su perseverancia y empuje, pues es muy alegre. Ya tiene 8 años de experiencia y lo que más le gusta es poder vivir en el campo, “me gusta sentir el aire y la paz que brinda la naturaleza”, comenta mientras cuenta que vende su producción a la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde tiene compradores fijos. Además de prepararse para su próxima cosecha de achiote, donde está segura podrá obtener buenos resultados. Con ello espera ahorrar lo necesario y así obtener un negocio propio para el futuro de sus hijos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar trabajando. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Jhony de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de plantitas de café y fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Jhony, 28, lives in the community of Santa María.  He formed his family there with Anita, his wife of 8 years.  They have four children, all minors that they care for in their own house.  He started working in farming when he was still a young man.  His main crops are coffee, bananas, achiote [annatto] and corn that he grows in his own fields.  He relates that he owns two hectares that he acquired through perseverance and drive since he’s very cheerful.  He has 8 years’ experience and what he enjoys the most is being able to live in the countryside.  He says: “I like to feel the air and peace that nature provides.”  He also relates that he sells his harvests in the city of Pichanaki where he has regular buyers.  He’s getting ready for his next achiote planting where he’s expecting good results.  He hopes with them to be able to save up what’s needed to acquire a business of his own for his children’s future.

He belongs to the “Los Amigos Cafetaleros” communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where he hopes for support from all of you to be able to continue working.  He promises to be punctual with his installment payments.  If Jhony were to receive your support, he will invest the requested money in the purchase of coffee seedlings and natural fertilizer for his next planting.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo chose to be a single man. He is now 54 years old and lives in a village planting and harvesting rice for sale. Due to financial difficulty, he engages in hog-raising business to earn additional income. He aims to earn and save to support his parents and save for his future. He endures hardships and problems he encounters for he wants to make his business viable and profitable.

He wants to ask for an additional capital of P15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hog-raising business. He believes that this loan will enable him to improve the business as long he works hard and strives for it.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for hog-raising business.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en: Enhtuya is a loving mother of two. She lives with her husband and two kids in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent, in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, and her two kids are college students. She started her retail dairy business in 2004 by renting a counter in the market. Through her business, she realizes a monthly profit of 780,000 MNT. Now that winter is approaching, dairy prices will increase, so she needs to save supplies. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "In order to pay two college fees, I need to work hard and do everything I can." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy milk to make dairy products.

loans.use: to buy milk to make dairy products.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios. 

Rocio tiene 34 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad de Salvación y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene varias actividades económicas en la ciudad de Salvación. Roció trabaja como empleada pública en el centro forestal de la ciudad de Salvación en el área de gerencia, ella también tiene un puesto de venta de artesanía, ella en sus horas libres se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía en su domicilio. Ya es un año que se dedica a la artesanía y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Rocio requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas secas para elaborar collares y pulseras. El sueño de Rocio es exportar sus productos. 

Rocio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rocio belongs to the “Del Futuro del Manu” (Of the Future of Manu) communal bank and the members meet every 30 days in the city of Salvacion, Manu province, Madre de Dios department.

Rocio is 34 years old, is in a common law relationship, and has one son. She was born in the city of Salvacion and still lives there. Rocio has various economic activities, all in Salvacion. She is a public employee in the city's forestry center in the management area. Rocio also operates an artisan sales stall. In her free time st home she makes artisan crafts. She has been doing this for a year now and things are going very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

At this opportune moment, Rocio needs a loan to buy dry seeds for making bracelets and necklaces. Her dream is to export her products.

Rocio appreciates and values the loan and promises to comply with her schedule of monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy dry seeds for making bracelets and necklaces to sell.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Teopista's Group

texts.en:
Teopista's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Teopista is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past year, Teopista has been working hard to manage her stand, which sells fresh produce and other foods. 

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more produce for resale, and it will help Teopista to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Teopista hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Teopista's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more produce for resale.

loans.name: Sala

texts.fr: Madame Sala est une femme marée de 45 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Elle est mère de 2 enfants de 5 et 14 ans.  Elle était restauratrice auparavant  mais  depuis 20 ans elle pratique la vente de voiles et de lampes torches, ainsi que d’autres objets divers. Elle a choisi cette activité par passion et s’intéresse  plutôt a l’argent qu’elle gagne. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2007. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de voiles et d’autres objets divers qu’elle va revendre a sa clientèle. Elle envisage renforcer son activité de commerce et  accroitre ses bénéfices pour  mieux contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sala lives in Senegal. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 2 children aged 5 and 14 years old. She was originally a restaurateur, but for the past 20 years has been selling diverse products such as veils and torches. She has an affinity for sales and likes running a profitable business.

She has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since November 2007 and is requesting a loan of 50 000 francs so that she can buy veils and other items to resell to her customers. She plans on strengthening her business and increasing her profits, which she will use to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy veils and other items for resale.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 37 years old and married. Julie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods like snack foods, detergent and other groceries.

Julie has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Julie aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like snack food, detergent and other groceries.

loans.name: Lia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lia; ella tiene 45 años de edad, la socia es soltera y la socia alterna la agricultura con la ganadería y especificamente con la compra y venta de productos lacteos, derivados y la venta de leche, la socia vende en la misma plaza principal del poblado a sus clientes y personas que desean llevar la leche a otros poblados cercanos. La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, ella en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de leche, queso, requeson, mantequilla para la venta y de este modo incrementar sus ventas.

La socia se compromete a cumplir ocn el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido y de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Lia is a member of the community bank "Qori Orcco", located in the Urcos district in the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cusco.

Lia is 45 years old, single, and works in agriculture and livestock, specifically the purchase and sales of dairy products and milk.  She sells in the main square of the town to her customers and people who want to bring the milk to other nearby towns.  Lia is a hardworking and happy woman.  She wants to use this loan to purchase milk, cheese, requeson, and butter to sell so that she can increase her sales.

She promises to make all of her payments on time and in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cheese, requeson, and butter.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 43 years old, and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Candelaria runs a fishing/fish vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase equipment for her fishing boat.

Candelaria has been in this business for 11 years.  In the future, Candelaria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru: Зеби одна из первых клиентов организации, которая имеет семейный бизнес по продаже конфет и печеных изделий. Она торгует вместе со своим мужем, и товар привозят вместе. Зеби смогла с помощью кредитов развернуть свой товарооборот в несколько раз.У неё трое детей, два сына и одна дочь, которая учится в университете. Для достижения хороших результатов в учёбе Зеби решила купить своей дочке студентке нотбук и подала очередную заявку на получение займа.За свою кредитную историю Зеби ни разу не нарушала условия организации и довольна сотрудничеству.
texts.en: Zebi is one of the first clients of our organization.  She has a family business of selling candy and baked goods.  She works together with her husband, and they bring in the merchandise together.  With the help of loans, Zebi was able to increase her product turnover by several times.  She has three children - two sons and one daughter, who attends a university.  In order to achieve good results in studies, Zebi decided to buy a laptop for her student daughter and requested this loan for this purpose.  Throughout her entire credit history, Zebi has never violated any of the organization's terms and is satisfied with the partnership.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her daughter

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Don Julio se dedica a la producción de Tubérculos y vende leche productos de las pocas vacas que ordeña en su parcela ubicada a unos 200 km de la localidad de Juigalpa, su esposa permanece en la ciudad y es docente; en cambio don Julio viaja semanal de su finquita de donde trae provisión, sobre todo tubérculos como Yucas, Banano, Cuajada, frijoles y demás que produce para el uso del hogar y también para ayudarse económicamente y venderlos al por mayor y al detalle, ambos han sacado adelante la familia compuesta de él, su esposa y sus 4 hijos la mayor de 17 ya es casada y los tres menores viven con él y estudian.

Su primer crédito fue invertido en cambiar el techo e instalar Puertas de Madera, obra que fue completada satisfactoriamente Gracias al Financiamiento de Kiva hoy su casa es mas segura y su familia esta muy contenta.

Recientemente don Julio tenia un dinero con el que inició la construcción de rampla, en la parte de atrás de la vivienda, pero no ajustó para completar toda la mejora, por lo que invertirá este crédito que solicita a Kiva para comprar más hierro, tubos, caliche, cemento, arena y pagar la mano de obra del albañil para continuar la mejora y levantar el muro de un metro, ademas instalar tuberías desde el lavandero hacia el cause que permita la salida del agua directo y evite dañar las paredes internas u otras incomodidades en el hogar. 

posterior  hará otro préstamo para continuar el enverjado desde el muro hacia arriba para dar mayor protección a su familia.

loans.use: Instalacion tubos de salida de aguas negras hacia un cause que pasa por la parte de atrás de la vivienda, la mejora dará mayor sanidad a la familia de don Julio.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Mrs. Charity I. is a 46 year old woman with seven (7) children. Although she had no formal business training, she opened her own business in the year 1996. She dwells in the urban area of Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. The above amount she requested is to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more baby things

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Madame O. sells salt in bags to her customers. She buys direct from the mining centre and resells to market women. She has a problem transporting the bags of salt and buying large quantities for supply. She is seeking a Kiva loan of $950.00 to enable her to solve this problem.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a very hard-working woman. She is married and has three children ages 8, 15 and 20. Seven years ago when her husband lost his job Martha decided to open her own business. She set up a grocery store in part of her home and little by little her business has grown. Fortunately, her husband found a new job, but Martha kept the shop to give her children a better quality of life. The family has worked together to make this business succeed. At this time Martha is asking for a loan of $925 that she will use to buy merchandise and offer her customers the variety they seek. She promises to repay the loan in 3-6 months. With your help this family and their business can prosper. They sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 8, 15 y 20 años de edad. Hace siete años su esposo quedó desempleado y para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar Martha decidió iniciar su propio negocio, con la venta de abarrotes, acondicionó un lugar de su casa para su tienda y poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor e incrementando sus ventas. Afortunadamente su esposo logró obtener un empleo, pero Martha continúa con su negocio para poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

La unión familiar ha logrado sacar adelante este negocio y para continuar creciendo, Martha solicita un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para tener un mejor surtido en su tienda y conservar la preferencia de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Con tu apoyo harás prosperar la vida de esta familia y su negocio, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
MARIA CRISTINA is 28 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works on the farm. She is dedicated to purchasing chickens, which she prepares and separates to sell them among the people of her community. She is a member of the group Brasilia 2, along with doña Rosa Corzo Coutiño (who prepares typical foods). With the loan doña Maria Cristina will buy more live chickens to raise them at her home and from there provide herself with chickens to later sell after they are prepared and quartered. Doña Rosa will buy cooking utensils to increase the preparation of typical foods at her place.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

MARIA CRISTINA, tiene 28 años, casada, tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo. Ella se dedica a la compra de pollos los cuales prepara y troza para venderlos entre la gente de su comunidad. Pertenece al grupo Brasilia 2, junto con doña Rosa Corzo Coutiño (prepara comida típica). Con el préstamo doña Maria Cristina comprara mas pollos vivos para criarlos en su casa y de ahí abastecerse para posteriormente venderlos destazados y doña Rosa comprara utensilios de cocina para aumentar la preparación de alimentos típicos de su localidad.

loans.use: chicken sales

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru:
Mastona sells children’s clothing and footwear in the central market of Isfara. She has 10 years of experience in this business. Her husband is working in Russia and sends money home. The business adds to the family budget. Mastona is 32 years old and is raising three children. She started borrowing money through MicroInvest in April of this year and has shown herself to be an exemplary client. Mastona plans to use the new loan to purchase fall clothing and footwear.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mastona çàíèìàåòñÿ ïðîäàæåé äåòñêîé îäåæäû è îáóâè íà öåíòðàëüíîì ðûíêå ãîðîäà Èñôàðû. Åå îïûò â ýòîé äåÿòåëüíîñòè óæå 10 ëåò. Åå ìóæ íàõîäèòñÿ íà çàðàáîòêàõ â Ðîññèè è ïðèñûëàåò äåíüãè. Äîïîëíåíèåì ê ñåìåéíîìó áþäæåòó ÿâëÿåòñÿ áèçíåñ. Ìàñòîíå 32 ãîäà è îíà âîñïèòûâàåò òðîèõ äåòåé. êðåäèòîâàòüñÿ â Ìèêðîèíâåñò îíà íà÷àëà â àïðåëå ýòîãî ãîäà è óæå ïîêàçàëà ñåáÿ êàê îáðàçöîâàÿ êëèåíòêà. Íîâûé çàéì îíà ñîáèðàåòñÿ óïîòðåáèòü íà çàêóï îñåííåãî àññîðòèìåíòà îäåæäû è îáóâè.

loans.use: For purchase of autumn assortment of clothes and footwear

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Mai Thị Hợi is 54 years old. She and her husband have 4 children. Since they live in a shore side village, selling fish at the market is a natural occupation for her. When her husband was still in the army and on duty away from home, Hợi had to make a living and raised their children by herself. The main fish suppliers for her inventory are the fishermen in her village. When her oldest child bought a fishing boat and started working for his own, Hợi joined TYM fund and invested her loan in the fishing equipment. Now that her son supplies her fishes, she makes bigger profit. Everyday, she and her daughter in law go to the market to sell fishes, their revenue is about 130 USD a month. Her husband is now a retiree and receives 125 USD a month from the state pension. Ms Hợi is applying for a new loan of 325 USD to buy new fish nets and invest in her son's fishing boat.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Mai Thị Hợi năm nay đã bước sang tuổi 54. Vợ chồng chị sinh được 4 người con. Là người dân vùng biển, bán cá ngoài chợ đã trở thành công việc quen thuộc với chị Hợi. Thời gian trước anh Hoa chồng chị công tác trong quân đội ít khi ở nhà, một mình chị Hợi buôn bán nuôi dạy các con. Nguồn cung cấp chủ yếu cho hàng cá của chị vẫn là từ những người đánh cá trong làng. Sau khi con trai đầu mua thuyền và tự đứng ra tổ chức công việc đánh bắt cá, chị Hợi đã tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vay vốn đầu tư vào việc mua trang thiết bị đánh bắt. Nguồn thu nhập nhờ đó cũng tăng lên do có nguồn hàng trực tiếp trong gia đình. Chị và con dâu đi chợ bán cá hàng ngày thu nhập 130 USD/tháng. Chồng chị là hiện đã nghỉ hưu lương hàng tháng trên 125 USD. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 325 USD về đầu tư cho con trai mua lưới đánh cá.

loans.use: Buy fishing-net

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is 44 years old and a mother of four. She used to work hard to sell groceries, which also generated no income because there was no big supply and demand for these products in her city. Three years ago, she gave up selling groceries. Now, she sells clothing to various houses: she sells clothing seasonally, leaving her customers the products and getting paid at her next return visit. She works in the same company her husband Juan Manuel works. He is also responsible for the administration of bill collection from his customers every 30 days. Teresa, like all mothers, wishes that her children become professionally successful. That is why she works very hard with dedication to this job. Currently, she has her own store which is not used because there are many repairs that need to be done to display her clothing. With this goal to refurbish this place, establish her business, and sell her products, she seeks a loan to develop and utilize the space that she has. With your help, Teresa will be able to materialize her goal in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa de 44 años de edad, madre con cuatro hijos, se dedicaba a la venta de abarrotes, el mismo que no lo produjo ningún ingreso económico ya que existe una gran oferta y demanda de estos productos en su ciudad; hace tres años dejó la venta de abarrotes y ahora se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir a domicilio, éstas las ofrece deacuerdo a las temporadas dejándolas con un compromiso de pago a su retorno y próxima visita; trabaja en compañía de su esposo, Juan Manuel, quien también se encarga de administrar los cobros que realizan sus clientes cada treinta días..Teresa, como toda madre desea que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales exitosos, y por esa razón con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación se encamina más a fondo en esta labor. Actualmente cuenta con un local propio el cual no es utilizado debido a que le falta muchos arreglos y sobre todo implementos para una adecuada demostración de sus prendas.Con el objetivo de establecerse en este lugar y comercializar sus productos de manera permanente, solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la adecuación e implementación del espacio que posee. Con tu gentil apoyo Doña Teresa podrá concretar en corto tiempo su propósito.

loans.use: to fix up her store

loans.name: Nusuta's Group

texts.en: Nusuta is 30 years old and married with four children. She sells new clothes. She plans to stock more clothes and construct a house from the extra profits she hopes to earn from her expanded business. She and her three friends, Zaituna, Habiba, and Betty, will each receive a share of this loan to invest. The four members of the group will support each other in the timely repayment of the loan. They are all intent on improving the financial situation of their families by expanding their businesses.

loans.use: To expand each of their individual businesses

loans.name: Arubaine 5 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Maliza N.. She sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal from villages. Maliza is 40 years old and is married with a husband who sells dry foods. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 25. Each week, Maliza makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to construct a residential house. Maliza has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest it in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Maliza is joined in her group by Racheal N., Rose N. and Rebecca M.. Racheal N. sells charcoal and wants to expand her business. Rose N. sells new shoes and wants a loan to increase her stock. Rebecca M. sells used clothes and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand charcoal business.

loans.name: Kamukamu B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Babirye E.. She is currently in the business of produce sales and is requesting a loan to increase inventory. Babirye is 48 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 14 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Babirye makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business.

Babirye is joined in her small group by Joy K., Justine A., Maria N., and Irene W.. Joy K. has a business selling fish and wants to boost business. Justine A. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to purchase more fish from the lake shores. Maria N. operates a business selling clothes and wants to boost business. Irene W. is currently in the business of selling maize and is requesting a loan to add more capital.

loans.use: To boost and expand produce sales business

loans.name: Román

texts.es:
Román is 56 years old and works as a street trader, selling household goods. He is married to Isabel González, who has a storehouse and helps with the family’s living expenses. They live in their own home and have two grown-up children, who were able to start a professional career, thanks to the efforts of their parents.

At a very young age, Román started working with his father as a salesman. With the profits generated from the business, he bought a motorcycle and started working for himself more than 15 years ago.

Every day, he travels long distances on his motorcycle, selling door-to-door. Two of his cousins work with him and he trains them and pays them for their services.

He needs this loan to buy goods such as bedsheets, saucepans, coolers, flasks and cutlery.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Román tiene 56 años de edad y se dedica a la venta ambulante de articulos para el hogar. El está casado con Isabel González quien tiene una despensa, ayudándole con los ingresos de la familia, ellos viven en casa propia y tienen dos hijos mayores de edad quienes adquirieron una profesión gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres.

Román empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su padre como vendedor, con las ganancias que le generaron el negocio el pudo comprar una moto y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia hace más de 15 años .

Realiza las ventas casa por casa en su moto recorriendo varios kilómetros diariamente. Trabaja con él dos sobrinos a quienes les enseña la profesión y a la vez les paga por los servicios prestados.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como sábanas, cacerolas, ventilador, termos, cubiertos y otros.

loans.use: To buy goods such as bedsheets, saucepans, coolers, flasks and cutlery

loans.name: Halima's Udugu Group

texts.en:
Halima is 42 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 22, 19 and 13 years old. Halima sells clothes. She started in 2008. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $72 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mariam and Bahati, who sell clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha E. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in the Oka area of the Edo state in Nigeria. She buys palm kernels and mills them into palm oil. She sells this in the local market in her community. She learned this business over five years. She started her own business in the year 2002. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more palm kernels for milling into palm oil to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more palm kernels

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S. is a grocery seller in Sangke Meanchey Village, Siem Reap Province, while her husband, Mr. Kuy Mengleang, is a house construction worker. They have eight children, four of whom are married. One of their children works with Mr. Mengleang to help support the family’s expenses. Because of increasing transportation costs, Mrs S. is requesting a loan of $400 which, when added to her savings, will permit the purchase of a motorcycle for use in her family, thereby reducing their expenses.  Mrs. S.'s husband is pictured.

loans.use: To help purchase a motorcycle for family use.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 41 years old, married, and has 8 children. She became a charcoal and firewood seller in 1988. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm, earning a monthly profit of about US80.

Fatma now hopes to obtain a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and firewood to increase inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Phorn Lai's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-eight people have formed a Village Bank which is located in Tuol Meas Village in Kandal Province. Most of these group members are married and they have children as shown in the picture. Mrs. Phorn L., 58, is the village bank president who has been selected by the group members.

Mrs. Phorn L. owns a small store on the street where she sells dried fish. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Phorn L. decided to ask for a loan to buy more dried fish to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Pot Nor, is a cow breeder who is raising only one cow. Aside from this business, he is the vice-village chief who can make $31 per month to support his family.

Mrs. Phorn L. hopes to increase her income and improve her standard of living with this loan. In the picture, Mrs. Eith O. is not shown because she was busy with her work but her husband came instead of her so he is shown in the picture. This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Nine members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to re-sell

loans.name: Pe

texts.en:
Mrs. Pe S. was born in 1956 and now lives in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  She and her husband, Mr. Ny Chhet, have a plot of land where they cultivates rice.  They have seven children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining four are attending the local school. 

Although Mrs. Pe S.'s family members have different businesses, they still cannot support their family well.  In order to improve Mrs. Pe S.'s living conditions, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motorbike taxi business. She hopes to increase her income with this new loan.

loans.use: To add to her saving to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motorbike taxi business.

loans.name: Ramzan M. Arshad Group

texts.en:
Ramzan baji, the wife of M. Arshad, lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She completed her education through the 8th standard grade. She owns a two-room brick house, where she has been living for the past 20 years. 

Ramzan baji is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is a tailor and has a shop where he sews clothes. Her younger son is in kindergarten. Her daughter is in the 3rd standard grade. 

Ramzan baji’s husband drives a truck. He used this vehicle for hauling different things (fruits and vegetables). Ramzan baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

Ramzan baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine for her son.

She is joined in her loan group by three other members. Aziz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothing business. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a hairdresser. She makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. Deborah is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more hair materials like weaves, hair creams, and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more salon materials to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
“Aside from business development, I also hope to send all my children to school to earn a college degree someday for them to have better future. All my sacrifices are for them. As early as today I want to start saving in preparation for their studies,” Catherine said.  

Catherine U. is a busines-minded woman who is full of hopes and dreams. Part of her dreams is to improve her canteen and somehow expand into buying and selling hogs, which will give her a higher income. 

Catherine admitted that she needs additional capital for the business, in order to develop and expand it in the coming months, and help her husband in providing for their livelihood. For this reason, she is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase pork and add more menu items to her food business, and to be a retailer of electronic/auto load sim cards.

Catherine is 26 years old, and married to Antonio, who is a creative wood carver. They have two children: Carl Andrei – 6 years old and already in the first grade in the primary level; and the younger one is Chales Anthon – 1 year old. 

“Part of my investment will be the renovation of our house in the future,” she added. Considering that their place is prone to flood, she wanted to have a more comfortable and safe house. 

And to further achieve those hopes and dreams, Catherine said, she must work harder and strive more to succeed.

loans.use: To purchase pork for her canteen and be a retailer of sim card loading

loans.name: Dien Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Diện năm nay 50 tuổi, gia đình có chị có 2 con đã trưởng thành. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003, từ khi tham gia vay vốn của Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị đã phát triển kinh tế và có điều kiện mua sắm thêm nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình. Nguồn thu nhập  của gia đình chị chủ yếu là từ diệt chiếu và chăn nuôi thủy sản . Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 7000.000 để  cải tạo ruộng đất nhằm gia tăng sản xuất  cho vụ tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dien Thi L. is a 50 years old woman. She has two grown-up children. In 2003, she joined the TYM fund. Since then she has been borrowing money to invest in businesses, so that she can buy more home facilities. The family’s income mainly comes from production of sedge mat and seafood. Mrs. L. plans to make the next loan of 7,000,000 VND to improve the field in order to improve the productivity.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve fields

loans.name: Cica Irène

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
A. Z. Cica Irène fait la couture et la vente de pagnes et bijoux depuis 11 ans. Irène a une fille qui s’appelle Dorone et qui va l’école. Les crédits passés lui ont permis de faire ses achats en gros a Lomé au Togo et de supporter la scolarisation de son enfant. Dans le futur elle voudrait ouvrir une boutique et vendre également des chaussures.
texts.en:
Cica Irène A. Z. is a seamstress and has been selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and jewelry for eleven years. She has a daughter named Dorone, who goes to school. Past loans have enable Ms. A. Z. to do her buying wholesale in Lomé, Togo, and to support her child’s schooling. In the future, she would like to open a shop and to sell shoes too.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and it has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans at an interest rate of 0% to highly vulnerable people. It is part of a group that will soon launch a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and jewelry for resale

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en:
Yaw Oti Mensah is a 47-year-old married man with two daughters. Both daughters are in junior high school. Oti’s wife works to help support the family. She is a food vendor. He lives with his wife and children in a brother-in-law’s house in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. 

Oti trades in maize. He procures bags of maize from nearby villages at affordable prices. He distributes the maize to the retailers in the market square. Oti also sells to food vendors. Oti has been in this business for five years. He wants a loan to increase his working capital so he can procure bags of maize in bulk to be able to supply to more customers. Oti is hopeful that if he works harder, he will be able to put up his own building and to give his children the best education possible.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Grenly

texts.en:
Mrs. Grenly Y., 52 years old, is married and lives at Poblacion Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She has four children; one is in college. Their source of income is from selling “lechon” (roasted pig, a Filipino delicacy). They started their business in 1976 and it is still doing well today.

With increasing demands, they opted to seek financial assistance. That’s why in August 2008, she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to use their loan facilities. She was able to pay her previous loan and is now applying for PHP10,000 (US$225). 

The amount will be used for her lechon business and venturing into duck raising. She is hopeful that someday, her business will expand to other areas and become successful with duck raising.

loans.use: To buy pigs for "lechon" business and start-up capital for duck raising

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en: Faafetai M., 28, is married with one child.  She is just starting in the plantation business.  She sells to the village people and general public, six days per week.  She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~140 USD).  SPBD loans are Faafetai’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She will use her loan to buy items to start her business.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals to kill insects and tools for planting taro, yam and taamu

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la casa de su madre. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la compra y venta de animales, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres que siempre se han dedicado a este negocio y en la actualidad le sirve para su sostenimiento. Rosa está muy contenta por lo que ha logrado, ella compra los animales durante la semana para luego venderlos los días sábados y domingos en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad con ayuda de sus hijos y su esposo. Para Rosa, este negocio es rentable, y junto a su esposo tienen planes de seguir dedicándose a esta actividad e incrementar la cantidad de animales que venden. Esta es la primera vez que Rosa solicita un préstamo con MFP, ella esta muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal, a la que fue invitada porque vieron en ella a un buen ejemplo de trabajo responsable. Este dinero será invertido en la compra de ovejas y cabras que son los animales que más vende.
texts.en:
Rosa, 37, lives with her husband and children in her mother’s house. For 20 years she has been buying and selling animals. She learned this business from her parents, who always engaged in this business. They still rely on this activity for their sustenance. Rosa is very pleased with what she has achieved. She buys the animals during the week. She then sells them, with the help of her husband and children, on Saturdays and Sundays in the livestock fairs in her area. This business is profitable for Rosa. She and her husband have plans to continue this activity and increase the number of animals they sell. This is the first time that Rosa has asked for a loan from MFP. She is very happy to be part of her community bank. She was invited to join because they saw her as a good example of a responsible worker. The loan will be used to buy sheep and goats, which are the animals that she mostly sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Femmes Commercantes 2 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, they can obtain larger sums and get financing for their businesses without a long delay. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in the weekly rural markets and fishing zones for resale in the town

loans.name: Milamel

texts.en:
Milamel M. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Milamel is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Milamel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector; operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Milamel has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Milamel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milamel has recently successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Milamel is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Milamel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Luz Magaly

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92749&_tpos=6&_tpg=1
Luz es socia D. Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Luz es soltera, tiene 35 años no tiene hijos alquilo un local donde puso y una bodega,  su bodega queda en una venida,  ella trabaja todo el día.
 Desde que está en Finca, los  préstamos han ayudado para  invertir, su negocio ha crecido.
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos para surtir su bodega, todo lo necesario para una bodega.
El sueño de Luz es tener una casa propia, y que su negocio crezca más.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92749&_tpos=... Luz is a member of the Mujeres Progresando Community Bank. Luz is 35, single, and she does not have children. She rents a place where she set up a mini market. Her mini market is on an avenue, and she works all day. Since she has been in Finca, the loans have helped her to invest, and her business has grown. She needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and everything necessary to stock her mini market. Luz’s dreams are to have her own house and that her business grows more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, milk, and noodles

loans.name: Olushegun

texts.en:
B. produces and sells popcorn and bakes cakes; she engages in indoor and outdoor catering services and has been in the business for the past four years.

B. is 30 years old and married with two children. She is requesting the loan of N120,000 to purchase more corn for the productions of popcorn. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more corn for the production of popcorn to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria purchased Parkside Postal three years ago to provide a neighborhood mail and shipping center for the community.  Despite strong sales in her first two years, she is still unable to qualify for a loan from a bank.  More recently, the recession has been hard on Gloria’s business, and she has been forced to draw down her savings to keep the business running.  

Gloria knows many of her customers by name.  The relationships she has built and the level of customer service that she provides are what set her apart from competitors.  A $5,000 loan helps Gloria to invest in more marketing and renew her notary license in order to expand her customer base, increase business revenue, and endure the economic downturn.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Gloria from  United States

loans.use: Notary license and marketing
